loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Айнуры среднее образование, с 2008 года занимается животноводством и торговлей. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Айнуры есть 5 коров, 50 овец. Также в магазине она продает хозяйственные товары широкого назначения для дома, к примеру, посуду и зеркала, также бижутерию и украшения. Ее супруг изготавливает сани, ворота, металлические печки. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота в магазине. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ainura is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry and retail sales since 2008.  She currently has five cows and 50 sheep on her farm.  She also sells a variety of goods in her shop.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to increase her merchandise turnover.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise turnover in her shop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Mrs. Gladys E. is a 39 years old woman who specializes on sales of food items to people in her environment. She desires her five (5) years old business to expand tremendously. She is greatly in need of $400 to expand her business

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy dairy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more livestock needed to expand his butcher business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his spare parts business

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: A. Zebo is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. She engaged in business for over 9 years. She is very honest   and responsible person. She always repays her loans in time. She is married and has 3 children. Her business is to trade of biscuits, cakes and candies. She has many clients and her business is going well. For September she received big order from two wedding and she needs in extra capital for making purchase. She must purchase 12 boxes of candies, 8 boxes of biscuits and 20 kg of cakes.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Sra. Justina C., 47, is the single mother of two daughters living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay. One of her daughters works and the other is still in school.

Justina works as a clothing designer and embroiderer. She learned this profession from her mother when she was very young. However, when business ceased to be prosperous, Justina decided to work in a small restaurant serving drinks and lunch for one of the schools in her neighborhood. Unfortunately this work did not earn her much more than her previous work in sewing. The space being rented for the Cantina was very expensive. For this reason Justina decided to quit the cantina and start a more affordable business in her neighborhood. At that time there was a great demand for a place of this kind, as few other existed. Thus, Justina came to open her copetin, a small shop that sells basic groceries as well as serves some food. Her primary clients are mechanics in the various auto-repair shops near her store.

When she began her business, Justina didn’t have the necessary equipment. She only had enough to buy them little by little. With the loan she has obtained from the Foundation, Justina will be able to purchase a freezer and refrigerator. With these items she will be able to improve the quality of service she offers. Justina is an active hard working person and the money she earns through her copetin supports her family.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and refrigerator

loans.name: Jitaidi Group

texts.en: The photograph, from left to right, features Eva P., Sophia M. and Juma K., who call themselves JITAIDI, meaning "strive high". They each own a different business, but, nevertheless, work in a partnership. Their businesses are located in the Buguruni area of Dar Es Salaam. Juma runs a shop selling used clothing and shoes, while Sophia runs a restaurant, and Eva sells charcoal. Each of them is in need of US$350 to help them boost their business in expectation of the approaching Christmas, since business earnings typically rise around this season.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 43 year-old Joy T..  She is single with one child, aged 10.  In 2000, Joy established a tailoring business and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional material and equipment.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional material, accessories and equipment for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en: Mimin, 35, is married to A. and has 2 children. Every day at her house she makes nutmeg candy in various shapes and colors and also she spreads sugar on it, then she sells the candy, earning about $3 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little candy business

loans.name: Veronica's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old and has a two-year-old child. Veronica owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

Veronica now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Edita, who has a business selling clothes (a "batique").

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara D. is the mother of two children living in Offinsu, Ghana. To support her family, she cooks rice and sells it in front her home. Sara is requesting a loan of $575 U.S. dollars to purchase more rice and a refrigerator, so she can begin selling water as well. With the increased profit, Sara plans on saving it to help pay for her children's education. 

Sara is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (translation: God’s hands is in it).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice and a refrigerator for a food stall

loans.name: Vinarvin

texts.es:
Mr. Vinarvin is 35 years old and lives in the Ameritas neighborhood. He is married and has two children. His wife assists in covering the expenses by doing domestic work in other homes. Vinarvin has been working in an institution that handles government expenditures for four years.

With the requested loan Vinarvin and his wife would like to repair the roof of the porch of their home and prepare for the winter rains.

Vinarvin began his working life selling milk products, but when one of the owners offered him a different job he jumped on it. His living standards have been raised significantly, and in the future he hopes to provide even more for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Vinarvin tiene 35 años de edad, y habita en el barrio las Ameritas no -2, es casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa trabaja como domestica y así ayuda en los gastos. El Sr. M. es trabajador de una institución donde desempeña el cargo de Gastos Fiscales en donde tiene ya cuatro años de estar laborando. Con el préstamo quiere reparar el techo del porche de su casa y estar preparado para el invierno. El comenzó vendiendo productos lácteos y uno de los dueños le ofreció un trabajo diferente. Su nivel de vida ha mejorado a futuro espera a un lograr mas beneficios para su familia.

loans.use: Repairs to his home.

loans.name: Thelma Ivania

texts.es:
Thelma Ivania is requesting a loan to invest in a home improvement project, which is to finish building a kitchen.

She has worked at the Rubén Darío Institute for the past 10 years. Ms. M. is a single mother of two daughters for whom she struggles to give the best she can. The oldest is 14 years old and in the 4th year of secondary school and the youngest is 12 years old and studies sixth grade. In her free time and in the afternoons, Thelma sells cosmetics. She carries out her work with great responsibility and is a woman who wants to advance professionally. She has struggled for her family so that her daughters are not wanting for anything. Her dream is to have work stability and that her daughters study.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Thelma Ivania está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es terminar de construir la cocina de su casa.

Labora para el Instituto Rubén Darío desde hace 10 años; es importante mencionar que la Sra. M. es madre soltera de dos hijas por las cuales lucha para brindarles lo mejor de si, la mayor de 14 años estudia 4to año de educación secundaria y la menor de 12 años estudia su sexto grado; en las horas libres y por las tardes se dedica a vender cosmeticos, doña Thelma desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad , es una mujer que desea superarse en lo profesional, ha luchado por su familia para que a sus hijas no les falte nada, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y que su hijas estudien.

loans.use: Finish building a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta makes wool blankets by hand through spinning and weaving. She has a husband who has a job in selling sand for cement manufacturing (which is considered poorly paid work in the construction sector). The address of the client in this Irpavi II (La Paz), but she is not the owner and thus serves as caretaker.

This is her fifth loan in Impro and her third in Kiva. Her rating is Customer I (Excellent). The loan will be used for working capital to purchase sheep leather, thread and wool.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Modesta elabora mantas D. vicuña, todo esto lo hace D. forma manual, es decir que tiene que hilar y luego tejer. Tiene un esposo que se dedica a arenero (un trabajo mal pagado en el ramo D. la construcción). El domicilio D. la clienta esta en Irpavi II (La Paz) pero ella no es la propietaria por lo que hace D. cuidadora.

Este es su quinto préstamo en Impro y el tercero en Kiva, su calificación es D. cliente I (excelente). El préstamo será destinado para capital D. trabajo (cuero D. oveja, hilos y lana).

loans.use: For purchasing sheep leather, thread, and wool

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 37-year-old married man and father of three children. He lives in a village close to Saida in the southern part of Lebanon. He owns a grocery, house supply, and toy store in the same neighborhood where he lives.

Hassan has been a microcredit client of A. Majmoua for the past two years. He used the previous loans to expand his business by diversifying his store inventory. Hassan now needs a loan of $1200 to complete the payment of a pick-up truck. Once he gets this truck, he will be able to increase his income by selling fruits and vegetables from home to home. Indeed, his current income from the grocery shop is not sufficient to ensure a good livelihood for his family.

loans.use: Complete the payment of a pick-up truck

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret T. is 36 years old and married with two kids. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken when her group was having a meeting. She would be thankful for that support.

loans.use: Margaret would like to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. for her small grocery shop.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos (dos varones de 08 y 04 años de edad y una mujer de 06 años de edad), estudió segundo de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.

Hace 03 años la invitaron a una reunión de amigas en el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz, lugar donde ella se informó sobre los créditos y decidió integrar el Banco Comunal. Con su primer crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles aumentó su capital y compró prendas de vestir para niños y bebes para comercializarlo en la ciudad de Mazocruz.

Doña Elsa formó su hogar a los 19 años de edad, empezando así a vender verduras, frutas, comida, de esa manera fue acumulando capital. Cambió de negocio desde el año pasado, dedicándose a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama y de ovino, también compra y vende lana de ovino, fibra de alpaca, llama y paralelamente tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. 

Con el crédito de S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará carne, lana de ovino, fibra de alpaca y de llama para ser comercializados a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que no se queden atrás, Elsa no pude estudiar porque sus padres se separaron cuando apenas tenía 09 años de edad junto con su hermano menor. Su padre los apoyó hasta donde pudo, gracias a Dios ahora su hermano trabaja en el extranjero”.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27 years old, married and the mother of 3 children (two boys, ages 8 and 4 and a girl, age 6). She studied through the second year of high school and she lives in Jr. Puno s/n, district of Mazocruz, province of Collao, Puno Three years ago she was invited to a meeting of the community bank "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz, where she learned about loans and decided to join the community group. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she increased her capital and bought clothing for children and babies in order to market it in the city of Mazocruz. Elsa started her home when she was 19 years old, beginning with selling fruit, vegetables, food, and in this way she accumulated capital. She changed her business last year and now she buys and sells the meat of alpaca, llama, and sheep, and also buys and sells sheep's wool, alpaca and llama fiber and additionally she has a small grocery store. With the loan of 2,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy meat, sheep's wool, fiber of alpaca and llama to sell to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Her greatest dream is that her children will study and not fall behind. Elsa couldn't continue her studies because her parents separated when she was just 9 years old along with her younger brother. Her father supported them when he could, and thanks to God now her younger brother works outside the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, sheep's wool, fiber of alpaca and llama, etc.

loans.name: Chul

texts.en: Mrs. Phal C. is 29 years old and makes a living selling groceries in her village. She is married to Mr. Phal Cheng and has two children, both of whom live at home in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. To increase their income and better support their young family, Phal and her husband need a loan to buy a store where they will sell pork. They will also use the loan to buy pigs to sell. The loans will help them improve their business and their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a store to sell pork and pigs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hire of a farm worker to help harvest output and plow farmland

loans.name: Yanirys Oneyda

texts.es: La Joven  Yanirys Oneyda S. S., tiene la edad de 20 años habita en el barrio monimbo ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a sus padres, ella es soltera, no tiene hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio e incrementar su inventarios; ella desde hace dos años trabaja como vendedora de zapatos para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a sus padres. Sus sueños de esta joven es llegar a establecer su negocio para poder darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, con esta solicitud es para invertir en zapatos variados, y otros productos que pueda ofertar a sus  clientes En futuro es Poder cumplir sus metas proyectadas y lograr lo que siempre ha deseado.
texts.en:
The young woman Yanirys Oneyda S. S. is 20 years old and lives in the Monimbo neighborhood located in the city of Masaya with her parents. She is single, does not have any children and her future plans are to improve the condition of her business and increase her inventory. For the last two years she has worked selling shoes to be able to help her parents with the household expenses. The dream of this young woman is to be able to establish her business to be able to give her family a better quality of life. This request is to invest in a variety of shoes and other products that she was offer to her clients. In the future she wants to achieve the goals set and accomplish what she has always wished.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Khoái  51 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị Khoái chỉ vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi nhưng đến năm 1998 chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh các mặt hàng thực phẩm khô.  Đến nay sau 13 năm tham gia Quỹkinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Năm 2007 chị đã đầu tư mở thêm một của hàng làm nhôm kính để tạo công ăn việc làm cho con trai. Thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Khoái mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng thực phẩm khô để phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Khoái, 51 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1995. When she first joined, she only borrowed money to invest in raising animals, but in 1998 she boldly took a loan to invest in a new business selling dry goods. During her 13 years of membership in the Fund, the financial situation of her family has steadily improved. In 2007, she opened another shop on the same model in order to provide a livelihood for her son. Currently, the total family income is 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Khoái hopes to borrow 15,000,000 (875 USD) to buy dry goods and other foodstuffs that will meet the needs of local residents during the lunar new year holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dry goods

loans.name: Lesbia Azucena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Lesbia V. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de comida el cual comercializa muy amablemente en su localidad donde atiende todos los días siendo visitada por sus clientes. 

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito se beneficia grandemente y apoya a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua, Lesbia Villaneuva dedicates herself arduously to her restuarant business that she runs very graciously from her locale where she attends every day to be patronized by her clients.

The reason why she has come to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to acquire a loan that will allow her to purchase ingredients to prepare her foods. It is important emphasize that by means of this loan she will see great benefit in that she supports her family who need her support so much.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Muruf

texts.en: Muruf A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells automotive batteries. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN  (about $550 USD) to purchase more batteries to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more batteries to sell

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Караев Рахмат житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 49 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается выпечкой лепешек. Имеет пекарню, которая находится на рынке "Дехкон". Там  же и реализует свою продукцию. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить муку. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahmat Q. lives in Tursun-Zoda. He is 49 years old, is married and has four children. He bakes flatbread. Rahmat owns a bakery that is located at the “Dehkon” market. He also sells his products there. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase flour. He will be able to pay back his loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: Marbely F. tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan, actividad que realiza desde su casa, ella tiene la ayuda de una empleada para la fabricacion de su producto, este lo distribuye en diferentes negocios, con los ingresos que genera le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta actividad la aprendio de su madre y le ha servido para toda la vida, ya que este oficio le ha permitido satisfacer sus nesesidades a apoyar a su esposo, ella nos comento que sueña con tener una fabrica que le permita producir mas pan y emplear a muchas personas ya que aqui en esta zona el empleo es muy poco y asi ella puede abrir oportunidades para mucha gente, el sueño de ella es que su producto se pueda vender en todo honduras.
texts.en:
For more than ten years, Marbely F. has been making and selling bread from her home. She learned how to do this from her mother and she has done it all her life. She has one employee who helps her produce her products which are distributed to various businesses. She has three children. This trade has enabled her to satisfy her desire to help out her husband and with the income from this she is able to help him with the household expenses. She told us she dreams of having a bakery where she could produce a lot of bread and employ many people. In this area there is not much employment and this would allow her to create opportunities for many people. She dreams of being able to sell her products throughout Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lard, flour, eggs, margarine, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрор Кахоров 1980 года рождения . женат имеет 2 детей. Кахор закончил всего лишь 10 классов в школе. закончив школу он учился у дяди  мясника. Откормив скот он продавал мясо по рыночной цене.  Сейчас он  продолжает  своё дело. Покупает корову или быка через пару месяцев продает мяса.  Также его приглашают резать коров. Дома содержит скот  около шести лет. На кредит от КИВА и построил расширил свой коровник.
texts.en:
Asror K. was born in 1980, he is married and has 2 children. Asror finished just 10 grades in school. Having finished school he studied with this uncle, a butcher. After fattening livestock he sold meat at market prices. Right now he continues his business. He purchases a cow or a bull and after a few months sells the meat. He is also invited to butcher cows. He has been keeping livestock at home for around six years. He used his KIVA loan to build/expand his cow shed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening livestock

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes.
Roxana es casada tiene 41 años, tres hijos de 24, 15 y 10 años, los menores están estudiando en la escuela estatal  
 Estudio cosmetología, y trabajo en una peluquería, decidió  estudiar repostería, y se especializo en buffet, al tiempo tuvo que dejar la peluquería por que el buffet le demandaba más tiempo y le rendía más económicamente, actualmente solo se dedica al servicio de buffet.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de menajes de cocina y telas para  hacer manteles.
Desde que está en Finca  aprendió la responsabilidad y ahorrar para llegar a cumplir su sueño. 
El sueño de Roxana es tener su local de buffet, donde atienda al público, y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the bank "Bancocomunal Mujeres Independientes". Roxana is married, 41 years old, and has three children aged 24, 15, and 10. The youngest children study in public school. She studied cosmetology and worked in a salon. She decided to study pastrymaking, specializing in buffets. The time came when she had to leave the salon because the buffet was demanding more time and was producing better financially. Now she only dedicates herself to servicing the buffet. Roxana needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of kitchenware and fabric to make tablecloths. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she learned to be responsible and to save to achieve her dream. Roxana's dream is to have her own local buffet, where she services the public, and also to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roxana needs a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase kitchenware and fabric to make tablecloths.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Thaer has been making and selling sculpture for eight years. Thaer requested a loan of 600 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his sculptures. This is the first time that Thaer has requested a loan. 
Thaer is speciA. in his work because of his creativity. His clients are engineers and graphic designers. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash. Jihad decided on doing his business because he took after his father’s business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by making himself known even outside his region.

loans.use: Thaer will use the loan to purchase materials for his sculptures.

loans.name: Sapa Group

texts.en:
Here are Hawanatu T., Abibatu S., Adama K., and Fatmata F.. They are businesswomen in Waterloo small-town, about twenty miles from Freetown city. They named their group Sapa. This is the first loan Sapa group members are receiving from SMT, a Partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to help them develop their businesses. 

Hawanatu T. (left) is the leader of the Sapa group. Hawanatu is twenty-six years of age, single with one child who is still in nursery school. She was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. She now lives in Waterloo as a result of the ten-year-long civil war.  Hawanatu has been a businesswoman for three years now. She sells lace, cotton, and uniform materials. She will invest this loan into her business so that it will grow. Hawanatu’s ambition is to become an international businesswoman, she told me.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont toutes des femmes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir réaliser leurs activités hivernales. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir 9 hectares.
Après la récolte  la production sera vendue dans les marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes généralement au comptant. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17.500FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et ambitionnent avoir des montants plus élevés.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are all married women, who average 50 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the village of the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 9 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, usually for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 17'500 (ca US$ 35) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 1 group wish to pursue their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and ambition to obtain higher loans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 9 hectares

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 32 years old and she is single. She is a nurse by profession and she also has a store where she sells medicine.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Ipogolo D Group

texts.en:
Edina is a member of the Ipogolo d borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 20 and 18 years.

Edina Started her own clothing business 6 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tsh.

This is Edina`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Edina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Leonida is also a member of the same borrower group,she also requested loan amount 250,000 Tsh in order to expand her own food business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Aurea es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Aurea viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y panes, y de las ferias compra cereales, animales, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
El sueño de Aurea es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Aurea, 45, is married and has seven children. Aurea travels to different regional fairs to sell vegetables and bread. At the fairs she buys grains and animals. She then sells them in an ambulatory manner at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Aurea needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy grains. Aurea’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Abi

texts.fr: Mme Abi est mère de 02 enfants, et est mariée. Elle a appris le métier de couture ; en 2002, elle a ouvert sa boutique de couture dans le quartier d’Ablogamé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Elle a appris la haute couture, activité qu’elle exerce dans la perfection, ce qui lui permet de fidéliser sa clientèle. Elle dispose aussi des apprentis couturières qui l’aident dans sa tâche. Actuellement elle est débordée dans sa tâche, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre Janôme, afin de pouvoir répondre à temps aux commandes de ses clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abi is the mother of 2 children and she is married. She learned to be a seamstress and in 2002 she opened up a sewing workshop in the Ablogamé neighborhood in Lomé. This business allows her to contribute to supporting her family. She learned 'haute couture', which she is very good at, and that keeps her clients coming back. She also has apprentice seamstresses who help her. Presently, she is overwhelmed with work so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a new sewing machine (Janôme brand) so that she can get customers' orders ready on time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his mill

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 44 years old and happily married with five children. She sells groceries and plastics in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a year.

Joy is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more groceries and plastics to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and plastics to sell

loans.name: Catherine Nafula

texts.en:
Catherine M. operates a cereal business. She buys cereals from different farmers and sells them at a profit. Catherine is 32 years old, married and has been blessed with seven children. Her business is located at Kona in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by a neighbour who was a client. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy more maize stock. Her dreams for the future are to improve her business and further educate her children.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants a rice crop to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a local building worker who travels everywhere around his commune to work in construction. They have been married for years and are the parents of three children, all of whom are students. The rice harvest season approaches; Ngin S. is looking for capital to buy rice in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to resell for profit

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 39 years old and married with five children aged between 10 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three room house where she is staying with eight people. Jane takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She has a stall selling all food stuffs like bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes in Mengo mackay. She pays dues of 1000/= per day. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 40 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children and rent for her business premise. Her major business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season which hinders her to reach her customers. She has been in this business for eighteen years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Jane joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grower bigger and start going directly to farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and irish potatoes

loans.name: Look To We Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Look To We' group. These women are petty business people in the small town of Waterloo, located near Freetown, the capital city. They have been in business for many years now but due to the lack of sufficient working capital, their businesses have not been performing in an encouraging manner. This has therefore led them to SMT/'Shine on Sierra Leone' to apply for a loan of SLL 600,000 each. With this loan at hand, they can expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality.

The group’s leader is Isatu A. K. on the left of the photo. The 41-year-old sells peppers, green leaves (used in cooking), green seeds, okra (used in sauce) and other market food. Isatu A. K. who was born in Makeni city is now residing and doing her business in Waterloo. She has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy four bags of peppers and twenty dozen green seeds. She sells the seeds to farmers for planting. With the help of this loan, this mother of four, together with her pepper-selling husband, can render great support to their children and in running the home.

loans.use: Buy four bags of peppers and twenty dozen green seeds

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola has two businesses: she sells both clothes and eggs. She has been running these business since 1995 and they are her primary source of income.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more clothes and eggs to sell. With the combined businesses, she is able to provide for her family's basic needs to afford other necessities. With the loan, she plans to expand her businesses, which are now thriving. With this kind of business, she hopes to increase on her earnings in the long run and to be better able to provide for her children's education. She sends her thanks to all her lenders.

Bola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are doing well in school.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and eggs for sale

loans.name: Retoño Group

texts.es: El banco  comunal "Retoño" esta representado por la señora Jenoveba y conformada por 14 miembros que van cursando juntos un tercer ciclo demostrando unidad y solidaridad con sus compañeros, son un grupo alegre y muy cumplido por lo que se les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y desarrollando un capital D. trabajo suficiente para mejorar su calidad D. vida. Una gran Mayoría D. los socios se dedica al ámbito comercial como la venta D. refrescos, venta D. comida, venta D. ropa para niños y jóvenes y venta D. perfumes (Avon, Esika y Ebel), otros se dedican a prestar servicios como el transporte, peluquería, odontología, costura y mecánica dental. Todos se dedican muy conscientemente a sus negocios y saben lo importante que es  tratar bien a los clientes ya que esa es la diferencia con sus competidores. El des tino del financiamiento es para la inversión en sus fuentes D. trabajo como la compra D. insumos, materiales D. trabajo y herramientas mas modernas para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Entre las expectativas D. los clientes esta la educación D. sus hijos que es primordial para cada uno D. los socios así como el deseo D. la superación personal con cursos y negocios mas fructíferos que brinden una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank "Retoño" is represented by Mrs. Jenoveba and is maD. up of 14 members who are completed a third cycle together showing unity and solidarity with their partners. They are a happy group and reliable with their payments which is why they were offered new economic support so that they can continue to grow and develop sufficient capital to improve their quality of life. A large majority of the members work in the commercial sector selling drinks, food, children's clothing, and perfume sales (Avon, Esika, and Ebel). Others work in the service sector in areas like transport, hairdressing, dentistry, sewing, and dental services. They are all conscientious workers with their businesses and they know how important it is to treat the clients well because that differentiates them from their competitors. The loan will be used to invest in their different businesses by purchasing supplies, work materials, and modern tools in order to offer better service to their clients. The primary hope of the group is good education for their children as well as personal improvement and more profitable businesses which will proviD. a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations (sales and services)

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar M. is 28 years old and lives in Sevan with her husband, mother-in-law and two sons. One of her sons is school-aged while the other goes to kindergarten. Gohar is a teacher and worked in this profession for several month before leaving in order to take care of her children. In 2009, Gohar set up her own business in a rented space. She sells women's, men’s and children’s clothes. Gohar is requesting a loan of 800,000 AMD to expand her business by buying spring clothing to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring clothing to resell

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia.  Her two children go to secondary school. Her husband operates a taxi service with his own car. They bought their plot of land with a fence and a ger (a traditional Mongolin housing tent), where they have been living since 2009.  

Bayarmaa and her husband bought their car and plot of land using the profits from their businesses. During the day, she has been renting a room in the Urgoo trading center, near the Ganbogd market, for her hairdressing business. She started working as a professional hairdresser and started her business in 2000. She says, “I would like to establish my own workplace.” She is requesting a 120,000 tugrug loan to purchase products such as hair cream, hair dye and shampoo.

loans.use: To purchase products for hairdressing business

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	En la comarca las mariitas sector el nance dulce, la señora Inocente C. M., se ha dedicado a la producción agropecuaria donde ha desarrollado actividades como la crianza de ganado y establecimiento de cultivos agrícolas de subsistencia, dentro de estos rubros están la crianza de ganado bobino y porcino y los cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y en algunas ocasiones frijoles, dichas actividades le aseguran sus alimentos y algunos ingresos para su mantención familiar, doña Inocente C. ha proporcionado con estos rubros lo necesario para la crianza y educación de sus cinco hijos, los que le ayudan en sus actividades diarias, con el crédito pretende comprar alambre para realizar la mejora de sus fincas y la compra de una vaca parida con la que espera mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Inocente C. M. raises livestock and farms in the Las Mariitas region of the Nance Dulce sector. She raises cattle and pigs. She grows crops like corn, sesame, sorghum, and sometimes beans. These activities assure her food and some income to support her family. With these activities Inocente C. has provided the necessities for raising and educating her five children. The children help her everyday. With the loan she plans on buying wire to make improvements on her farm. She will also buy a dairy cow in the hopes of improving the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wire and a dairy cow

loans.name: Ngourn

texts.en:
Ngourn M. is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children.

M. is engaged in growing bananas on her own plot of farmland, earning an income of 2.50 USD per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband operates his horse and cart in the village to provide transportation services and buys bananas for resale, earning an income of 4.80 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses.

M. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy bananas to stock for sale when the price is good. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy bananas to stock for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria S. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married with four children. Victoria operates a business which is sari sari (variety) store and her husband is a farmer and sometimes a tricycle driver. She earns approximately earns 5,000 a month from her business. Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financing and to engage in other business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 from PMPC.This previous loan was used for the expansion of her business. As of now, Victoria has a new loan of 25,000 from PMPC and this loan is intended for the repair of her house. This is her 4th loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house repair and as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Modi

texts.en:
Modi H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood at home and is requesting a loan to help her stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Modi is thirty-five years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children, who are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward assisting returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcaol to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Progress People Group

texts.en:
Augustus F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Progress People. He is 22 years old, single and a sophomore student in high school.

For 3 years, he has been selling phone cards and petroleum products (gas) in Gardnesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with 500 Liberian Dollars that his mother gave him.

He plans to use his 7,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 33,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards and petroleum products (gas).

His dream is to grow his business, make a profit, save, and be able to go to college so that he can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards and petroleum products (gas)

loans.name: Shahida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida Perveen lives in the second-largest city of Pakistan, named Lahore. She has three children, and her husband has his own shuttering business. She is applying for a loan for her husband’s business so that he can buy more shuttering materials such as timbers and ropes for his shop.

It is always important in any business that you always keep available stock to fulfill the needs of the clients on the spot. Her husband will do the same with the help of the loan to make sure that he doesn’t face any problems of material shortage.

Shahida perveen couldn’t educate her first two sons but she wishes her youngest son will complete his education; he is in 5th class. She is hopeful that an investment in her husband’s business will enable him to increase his income which will bring new happiness to the family and help her son to complete his education.

Note: The women behind these five ladies are not connected with this group.

loans.use: To purchase more shuttering materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda W. is currently in the business of making local Sudanese bread cooked in oil and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil .  Roda is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie A. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 young children. Winnie owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Winnie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Winnie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Winnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Winnie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is from the village of Upperville, Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business buying and selling of fish as well as dried fish  as her another business aside from doing manicure and pedicure  in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amintor Mariano

texts.es:
Amintor de 45 años, el es vendedor de ropa y accesorios, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 1 años. 

Cuando era joven el trabajo como mensajero en el ejercito, un día el papa le regalo un reloj que valía en ese entonces $250 sucres (moneda antigua Ecuatoriana),  Amintor al dirigirse a su trabajo se encontró con un amigo que le ofreció $ 800. sucres por el reloj que estaba utilizando, así que lo vendió y consiguió otros para venderlos. Con ayuda del papa que era comerciante de relojes el comenzó a venderlos y comprarlos. Ahora el es comerciante de relojes, ropa y  accesorios.

Para el continuar vendiendo su mercadería quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y accesorios, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Amintor, 45, sells clothing and accessories. He lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil and has 2 children - 10 and 1 years of age. When he was young Amintor worked as a courier for the army. One day his father gave him a watch that was valued at 250 sucres (the old Ecuadorian currency). While making his way to work he bumped into a friend who offered him 800 sucres for the watch he was using, and so he sold it and found others to sell. With the help of his father, who was a watch salesman, he began selling and buying them. Now Amintor is a watch, clothing and accessories salesman. To continue selling his merchandise he wants to use this loan to purchase clothes and accessories. In the future Amintor would like to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and accessories

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur AMADOU K. est marié à deux  femmes et est père de 2 enfants (1garçon et 1fille). Il est né vers 1971 à KARAGOUAN un des villages de la commune de la préfecture de Kadiolo, (3eme région administrative du Mali).  Il vit dans sa maison avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à KADIOLO.
Il fait commerce général depuis 2 ans  avec la vente de céréales et d’articles divers de boutique qu’il fait durant toute l’année. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Il affirme que cette collaboration  lui sera d’un apport considérable car le montant obtenu lui permettra de satisfaire la demande d’assez de ses clients. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt deux tonnes de maïs, il s’approvisionne à KARAGOUAN et dans les villages avoisinants de KADIOLO.
Il vend au comptant, souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Souvent il vend ses céréales sur commande.
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à KADIOLO ville.
texts.en:
Mr. AMADOU K. is married to two women and is the father of two children (a boy and a girl). He was born around 1971 in KARAGOUAN, one of the villages in the commune of the Kadiolo prefecture (3rd administrative region of Mali). He lives in his house with his wives and their children in KADIOLO . He has been in general commerce for 2 years, selling grains and a variety of items that he makes during the year. Experienced from his years in business, he has a great deal of success. This is his first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He declares that this collaboration will be a significant benefit to him because the amount obtained will enable him to adequately satisfy customer demand. With his loan, he plans to buy two tons of corn. He gets his supplies in KARAGOUAN and in the neighboring villages of KADIOLO. His sales are in cash, often by credit (wholesale and retail) to a clientele composed of men and women. He often sells his grains on order. He foresees making a monthly profit of 80,000 CFA, some of which will be used to increase his working capital and the remainder put into savings because he hopes to build a house to live in the town of KADIOLO.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains

loans.name: Laura Alfonsina

texts.es:
Laura de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Cuando ella era pequeña su familia tenia una tienda. Ella quiso seguir los mismo pasos de ellos y tener su tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo compro algunos víveres y los ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para la tienda quiere el préstamo por eso quiere  comprar  arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Laura, age 49, live in a periurban area called Fortín. It is characterized by its dirt paths and hills. She has a grocery store in the front part of her house. When she was little her family had a store. She wanted to follow in their footsteps and have her own store. Little by little, and with hard work, she bought some groceries and set them up in the front part of her house. She now works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants to expand her business and have a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Blanca Ofelia

texts.es:
Blanca T. A., trabaja en su negocio desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde junto con sus hijos y esposo en el sacado de las piedras cantera.
Ha trabajado alrededor de 19 préstamos con ceprodel.
 
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de una camioneta para el traslado de las piedras canteras, (complemento).
 Tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos trabajan por cuenta propia y los otros dos trabajan con ella.
texts.en:
Blance T. A. works in her business from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. with her children and husband in the excavation of quarry stone. She has worked with 19 loans with Cenprodel.

The requested loan is for the purchase of a truck for transporting the quarry rocks. (complement) She has four children two of who work independently and two who work with her.

loans.use: The purchase of a vehicle(COMPLEMENT)

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is 55 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. His farm is currently producing milk at a low quantity which is only enough for the family's consumption. He also earns income from his spare-parts shop.

Abdallah has requested this loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business. He says that the proceeds from his poultry business will go towards the education of his children. He says that his major challenge has been disease which is too expensive to treat. In the future, he would like to expand his farm and venture fully into dairy farming.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Luisa Lilliam

texts.es:
La señora Luisa se ha destacado por vender frutas y verduras en el M. Mayoreo donde a diario ofrece los productos a todas las personas que visitan el M.. Ella lleva al sustento a su hogar y también es importante destacar que mantiene a tres pequeñas nietas por lo que duplica sus esfuerzos para obtener dichos ingresos y así sustentar su núcleo familiar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de las frutas y verduras en especial en la compra de naranjas. Ella confía que el crédito le será proporcionado y así venderá dichas naranjas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa has been known for selling fruits and vegetables at the Wholesale Market where she offers her products every day to those who visit the market. It is important to note that she has to support her household, which also includes three young granddaughters. Therefore, she must double her efforts so that she can generate income to provide for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits and vegetables, especially oranges. Luisa hopes that her loan will be granted so that she can sell these oranges to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase oranges to sell

loans.name: Ashra's Group

texts.en: Ashra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s construction supply business. With the loan he will buy cement, bricks, etc in bulk that will help him to fill larger orders on time. Ashra hopes that her husband’s business will improve with this loan, which will result in improving her family’s lifestyle. Ashra got married 12 years ago and became the mother of two sons. Her financial condition is not good enough to send her children to school yet, but she hopes that her husband’s improved business condition will enable her to send them to school in the near future. Ashra lives with her family in Mianchannu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and pays her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a construction supply business

loans.name: Santiago Leonardo

texts.es:
Santiago Leonardo M. T. tiene 22 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene  hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Santiago    se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Santiago Leonardo  M. T. is 22 years old.  He is single.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the community bank 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) is located in  Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Santiago has been growing corn, rice and beans for 3 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan would help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  His dream is to have his own home.  Santiago likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
K. Sherali is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He has spent many years growing wheat and vegetables on land that was given to him by his father.  Together with his wife and brother, he works hard in the field so that he can send his children to school in the future when they are older. Sherali says, "Life in the field is never easy. I plow using the traditional method all day, not minding the heat of the sun because I have an ultimate goal for my kids, and that is to give them a better future." 

Sherali is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you’re giving him.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Guapa, se conformó en  agosto de 2.010, en la ciudad de Carmen del Paraná y renuevan en el 2do ciclo, con 10 integrantes. En el primer ciclo estaban 19 integrantes en el comité, y por una cuestión de diferencia de puntos de vista decidieron dividir el grupo y quedarse  entre las que mejor trabajaba. 

Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo, pesca y venta de pescado, fabricación y venta de ladrillos, al comercio, entre otros. 
La directora general del comité, Ramona A. tiene 56 años de edad  y junto con su marido Juan V. tiene una fábrica de ladrillos en su residencia. Juntos tienen 2 hijos.

Doña Ramona es una señora muy sacrificada y trabaja a la par de su marido para ayudar en la fábrica que tienen juntos. 
Fue beneficiaria de una casa construida por la Entidad Binancional Yacyreta, con lo que pudo acceder a un mejor conford en su vivienda. 
Solicita el préstamo para la  reparación del horno donde se realiza la cocción de los ladrillos.

El comité es nuevo y estan aprendiendo y tomado conciencia de la importancia de trabajar en equipo, además de ser concientes de la importancia de desarrollar el espiritu emprendedor para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Women's Committee was founded in August 2010, in the city of Carmen del Paraná and they are now in their second loan cycle with 10 members.  There were 19 members during the first loan cycle but, owing to some differences of opinion, they decided to split the group up and retain the  members who worked best.

The ladies' business activities are varied and include fishing and selling fish, making and selling bricks, and sales.

The head of the committee is Ramona A. who is 56 years old.  She and her husband Juan V. have a brick factory at their home.  They have 2 children together.

Ramona is a very selfless woman who works with her husband, helping in their factory.  She was the beneficiary of a house built by Entidad Binacional Yacyreta and this provided her with more comfort in her home.  She is requesting this loan to fix the oven where she bakes her bricks.

This is a new committee and they are learning and becoming aware of the importance of teamwork and the need to develop their entrepreneurial spirit in order to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy clay

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man H. is 52 years old, widowed, and has eight adult children, two of whom are married and six of whom are single.  She lives in Phnom Penh City. Man H. has been earning her living by selling fish in her community since 2005. She sells fish that she buys from her supplier. She also rents her house to make additional income. Presently, Man H. hires motor taxis to pick up her fish for sale in her village, which costs her a lot of money.  Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her fish to sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shoe repairing materials

loans.name: Ne'matullo

texts.ru: Хакимов Неъматулло проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 43 года. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Неъматулло имеет высшее образование, педагог. Он более 15 лет проработал в средней школе. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на рынке Саховат. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Ne'matullo H. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Ne'matullo has a higher education as a teacher.  He spent 15 years working at a secondary school.  Today, he is involved in retail sales at the Sahovat market.  He has a store, where he sells food products.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  Ne'matullo is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 42 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de chincheros, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa unión tiene  6 hijos, ella nos cuenta que en la ciudad de chinchero se encuentra una de las más importantes ciudad arqueológicas del Imperio de los Incas y por ende las mayoría de los pobladores se dedican  a la elaboración, venta y compra de artesanía.  Celia pertenece a la Asociación de Artesanos de “AyawasiTocapo” de la ciudad de Chinchero. 

Celia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas, guantes, chullos y chalinas hechos en base de lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old and was born in the city of Chincheros. She is married and from this beautiful union she has 6 children. She told us that in the city of Chinchero you can find one of the most important archeological cities of the Incan Empire, and because of this, most of the residents work making selling and buying handicrafts. Celia belongs to the Artisan Association of "AyawasiTocapo" of the city of Chinchero.

Celia at this time requires a loan to buy materials to make handicrafts such as sweaters, gloves, caps, and scarves made of alpaca wool.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Тошпулатова Обида проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 54 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Сыновья занимаются растениеводством. Сама Обида работает на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Этим видом деятельности занимается 3 года. Кредит берет для покупки апельсинов, бананов и киви.
texts.en: Obida T. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 54 years old. She is married and has three children. Her sons are doing agriculture. Obida works on the market where she rents out a vendor space where she sells fruits. She has been in this business for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy oranges, bananas and kiwi.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and kiwi

loans.name: Fadela

texts.en:
Fadela is a 52-year-old widow and the mother to two children. She has worked at selling clothes since 2008 to keep herself and her children living after her husband's death. She describes life as harsh, because she has to struggle for living and providing the best she can for her children when there's no one to turn to or rely on.

She owns a small business, and wants to improve it through a second loan she requested from Al Majmoua. Her previous loan was effective and helped a lot in improving her social and financial situation. With this loan she plans to buy a new spring/summer clothes collection, in addition to starting a new business for her son. She wants to help him to open his own bakery and hopes he succeeds and helps her with their income and providing their needs. 

Fadela hopes to open a real shop one day, unlike the small table she uses now to put her merchandise on.

loans.use: to buy a new clothes collection to resell

loans.name: Lucy Maribel

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Lucy cuenta con grado de instrucción educación superior. 
La señora  se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes, trabaja  con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de abarrotes.  Trabaja junto con su esposo;  También cuenta que es profesora.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 550.00 nuevo soles comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, etc., para poder abastecer su tienda.
Su sueño es crecer y superarse en el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir ideas con las socias y ser solidaria.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the community bank "Dulce Amanecer", located in the Puno district, province and department of Puno.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children.  Lucy has one year of higher education instruction.  

She sells groceries.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used the money in her grocery business.  She works with her husband.  She is also a teacher.

With this new loan of 550 nuevos soles, she will purchase rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, and other items to stock her store.  Her dream is to grow and improve the business.

The thing she likes about the community bank is sharing ideas with other members and being supportive.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, and other items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elenn Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Elenn Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, D. los cuales los dos mayores son varones y ya son independientes, solo la menor D. 16 años depenD. D. ella y es estudiante del nivel secundario.

La idea del negocio nace a raíz D. las investigaciones que ella realiza por el internet D. la importancia que le está  tomando la gente a los productos naturales y es así que con el apoyo D. su esposo, que estudio administración, se pusieron a realizar estudios D. mercado sobre productos naturales y se decidieron comprar al por mayor el café saludable (Lingzhi) y venderlos en los principales autoservicios y mercados del Distrito D. Tarapoto.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, comprará un ciento D. cajas D. café orgánico natural para poder expandir su mercado a nivel Regional que día a día viene ganando mas clientela y ella considera que es importante mantenerlos satisfechos. 

Elenn Rosario, mujer creativa, soñadora se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización D. sus sueños y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Elenn Rosario, age 48, is a member of the communal bank “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”; the bank is located in the Tarapoto district of the San Martin province, which is located in the department of San Martin. Elenn is married and has three children: two sons are already grown and independent; only the younger 16-year-old daughter is in her care and is currently in secondary school.

Elenn had the idea for her business as was researching on the internet topics regarding the importance that people give to natural products. Following up on this with the help of her husband, who studied business administration, Elenn researched the market and decided to do a wholesale purchase of healthy coffee (Lingzhi) in order to commercialize it to auto service stations and various markets in the Tarapoto district.

Elenn will use the loan of 2,500 soles to purchase a hundred boxes of organic natural coffee in order to expand her market to regional level. She is gaining new clients every day, and it is very important to her that they remain satisfied with her services. Elenn is a creative woman and a dreamer. She feels happy about  continuing to work in order to realize her dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for providing help and development opportunities to women like her.

loans.use: to purchase natural organic coffee

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona tiene 45 años, es una mujer luchadora y que le gusta trabajar de manera humilde.
