Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 10 años que inicio con esta actividad con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues algunas veces no vende muchos productos, pero ella sale de manera ambulante a ofrecerlos. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, perfumes, body, cremas y tratamientos. El sueño de Pabla es que sus hijos sigan adelante con este negocio que es su medio de vida.
texts.en: Pabla is a 45-year-old woman who is a fighter and enjoys humble work. She makes a living selling cosmetics, which she started doing more than 10 years ago with the objective to make headway for her children. There were some times she did not sell a lot of products, but she went out to the streets to offer them. She is requesting the loan to purchase powders, lipstick, perfumes, body wash, creams and other treatments. Pabla's dream is for her children to keep moving forward with the business, which is their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase powders, lipstick, perfumes, body wash, creams and other treatments.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen, 55, works in the garment industry in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh City. She has been working in this field since 2008, and receives a formal salary every month. She is married to Tuy who is a domestic rice farmer who spends most of his time working in the field. They depend on their three children who are employed in diverse jobs; two of them also work in the garment factory, one is employed as a car repairer. Khen would like to request some funds to buy a motorbike for riding to work as well as to go everywhere else.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for riding to work.

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Fatemah is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has worked since 1997 at selling baby diapers and sanitary napkins from her house. She intended to work from her house in order to stay next to her children. Taking good care of them at the same time made for the best management of her business.

This is Fatemah's eleventh cycle with Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital through buying big quantities with special prices. In addition, she will help her son in building his own house, through a small payment she will give him.

Fatemah is encouraged by most of her customers, neighbors and family, and this what has helped her to stay this long and expand her business. She hopes to open a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying big quantities at special prices.

loans.name: Polo

texts.en:
Polo and his wife, Srong, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have three sons and one daughter. 

Polo and his wife are vegetable farmers. He is asking for his second loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

Photo: Polo and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is a hardworking man. He is married and the loving father of one child. 

Firuz has been engaged in selling sausages for the last six years. He purchases his products from Khujand and transports them with his own car. He distributes the goods to the local shops in Isfara city. 

He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital to buy more sausages to sell in order to make a good profit for his child. He wishes to give a good education to his child to provide him with the bright future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sausages to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria , es habitante del municipio de  Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo que trabaja para poyarle con los gastos de la casa ya que tienen hijos que actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de y poder brindarle estudios a sus pequeños pata que logren realizar una carrera profesional , doña Maria  desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo  de piña , la mayor  afectación que se le presenta son las plangas que invaden el cultivo ,  lo cual provoca una mala cosecha y grandes pérdidas del producto . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva , ya que siendo una persona humilde y de bajos recursos la apoyen para poder mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe, where she lives with her husband who helps with the household expenses. They have children who are currently in school. The plans for their family are to improve their conditions and to provide an education for their little ones so that they can pursue a professional degree. Doña Maria has been growing pineapple for several years. Her greatest challenge is when diseases impact her crops, which results in a bad harvest and large product losses.

Maria is grateful for the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds. She is a modest person with limited resources, so this support will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Yris Madeleini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Yris; la socia es casada y tiene 35 años de edad, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad; la socia trabaja en una institución  pública ella es asistenta social; la socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa de campo que tiene entre Pisac y Calca y para ello la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en los acabados de esta casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa de campo.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" communal bank which is located in the Huanchac District in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Yris, 35, is married and has two children, 19 and 12.  She is a social worker at a public institution.  She is requesting a loan for the construction of her country home between Pisac and Calca.  She plans to use it to finish the house.  

She is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To finish construction of her country home.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Cynthia has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Confianza Y Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Confianza y Fe” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, comercio ambulante, venta de perfumes y venta de abarrotes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Alma quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila del grupo, vistiendo una capa color azul y su cabello es corto ondulado. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años. Específicamente se dedica a vender productos de confitería, además cuenta con máquinas de juego. Su negocio está ubicado al interior de su casa, en una habitación que habilitó para instalar su confitería. 
Comenta que le ha ido bien en su negocio y que las ganancias le han servido para costear los estudios de sus hijos e invertir en su confitería, ya que hace un tiempo instaló vitrinas para su confitería.
Su mercadería la compra a proveedores directamente.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su confitería, específicamente galletas, chocolates, jugos, leche, entre otros productos. 
Sus metas en su negocio son abastecer aún más su negocio, para captar un mayor número de clientes. Para esto necesita comprar una congeladora en forma de refrigerador para mantener los helados, bebidas y yogurt. 
Alma vive junto a uno de sus hijos quien anhela estudiar una carrera universitaria, para ser un profesional. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo esperanza. Se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal, ya que realizan actividades juntos y esto ha generado una muy buena relación entre ellos.  Respecto a las capacitaciones estas le han servido para desempeñarse de mejor manera en sus negocios.  
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “Confidence and Faith,” is composed of 19 entrepreneurs dedicated to different trades. Among them you will find a used clothing merchant, a street vendor, a perfume seller, and a grocer. They all come from the city of Temuco.

Alma, is in the second row in the photo, wearing a blue cap and has short wavy hair, She has been a merchant for 10 years. Specifically, she has a candy store with some game machines. The store is located in her house, which was modified to include her store.

She comments that the business has been doing well and her earnings have served to pay for her children's studies and invest in the candy store. Some time back, she installed glass cases. She buys her merchandise directly from proveyors.

With this loan she will buy merchandise for the candy store, specifically cookies, chocolates, juices, and milk, among other products. Alma's goal is to increase the store's merchandise in order to capture a larger number of customers. To do this, she needs to buy a refrigerator with a freezer to keep ice cream, drinks, and yogurt.

Alma lives with one of her children who hopes to pursue a university career and become a professional.

She is very content and grateful for the aid offered by the Esperanza Fund. Alma is very comfortable with her communal bank group. They carry out activities together and this generates good relations among them. The training sessions have served to better prepare them to run their businesses.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanian region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago, the captail of Chile. In the surrounding area there is a series of hot springs (including Pucon, Villarrica) and a very attractive native flora and fauna, concentrated in nature parks nearby. It's worth mentioning that 50% of the regions' residents are Mapuche, an indigenous people of our country.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store; especially cookies, chocolates, juices, and milk, among other products.

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 
Nick has a shop that sells firewood & coconut charcoal. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy firewood to sell.
Nick is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nick hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Manuel Salvador  se ha  caracterizado por ser una persona  muy trabajadora y se desempeña como ayudante fontanero en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace tres años. Es acompañado y con tres personas a su cargo y para brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. 

El  señor Manuel Salvado  ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para pagar deuda pendiente  con una institución bancaria referente a una tarjera de crédito ya que lo intereses se le ha incrementado y quedarse con una sola deuda.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador is a hard-working person who works as an assistant plumber for a state institution in the Managua municipality.  He has been doing this work for three years.  He has a life partner and three people under his care, and he wants to give them a better standard of living.

Manuel Salvador has come to Ceprodel to request a loan.  The loan is to pay a pending debt with a banking institution relating to a credit cart.  The interest has increased, and he wants to be left with only one debt.

loans.use: to pay a personal expense.

loans.name: Saby Carol

texts.es:
Saby es socia del Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro” de la ciudad Puno en el departamento Puno. Vive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos de 9 y 11 años. 
Saby confecciona y vende artículos deportivos en una tienda que es suya y que mantiene desde hace más de cinco años. Aprendió a confeccionar gracias a sus padres y también ha heredado las ganas de hacer negocio, como nos cuenta. Inició este negocio por idea propia y sólo con la ayuda de su pareja. Él se encarga de hacer las costuras y estampados, mientras que ella hace las compras y atiende a los clientes. 
Iniciaron su negocio con un capital de S./ 500,00. Saby lleva un año con Manuela Ramos y su nuevo préstamos será de S./ 1,000.00. dinero que invertirá en la compra de telas para los polos y pelotas que confeccionará.
Su meta es tener una máquina bordadora para facilitar el trabajo y ahorrar tiempo. Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos son las capacitaciones y las reuniones donde las mujeres comparten anécdotas.
texts.en:
Saby is a member of the communal bank Semillas del Future (Seeds of the Future) located in the city of Puno in the department of Puno. She lives with her partner and they have two children 9 and 11 years old.

Savy makes and sells sporting goods in her own store that she has had for more than 5 years. She learned this occupation from her parents and also she inherited from them the desire to be in business, so she tells us. 

It was her own idea to begin this business only with the help of her husband. He is in charge of sewing and the patterns, while she takes care of purchases and assisting clients.

They began their business with 500 soles. Saby has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year and her new loan will be 1,000 soles that she will use in the purchase of materials needed to produce sport shirts and balls.

Her goal is to have an overlapping embroidery sewing machine to make their work easier and to save time. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the training and the meetings where women get together and share their stories.

loans.use: to buy material at wholesale prices

loans.name: Turaje Group

texts.fr:
Concilie est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de la bière locale  depuis 28ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’alphabétisation. Elle est mariée a Melchiade ; un maçon et ont ensemble 5 enfants qui étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Turaje»
texts.en:
Concilie, aged 42 years, is a merchant who lives in the town of Kibimba, in the province of Gitega, in the center of the country.  She has been in the business of selling local beer for 28 years.  She is also a farmer.  She has had enough schooling to be able to read.  She is married to Melchiade, a mason, and together they have 5 children who attend school.
The Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that she will get will increase her working capital and allow her to buy large quantities of local beer to sell in order to make good profits. 
She is a member of the community group “Turaje.”

loans.use: to buy large quantities of local beer to sell in order to make good profits.

loans.name: Alexis Bladimir

texts.es:
Alexis, es empleado y vive con su esposa y su hija, él es vendedor en una empresa pero trabaja en agricultura siembra de granos básicos como: frijoles y maíz el contrata a personas para el trabajo no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, semilla, herbicidas para obtener mejores cosechas y estén libres de plagas para luego venderlo obtener mejores ingresos y dejar una parte para su familia.
El objetivo de Alexis es que a su familia no le falte nada que tenga el sustento diario y poder darle lo mejor a su esposa y a su hija .
texts.en:
Alexis is an employee and lives with his wife and daughter.  He is a salesman for a firm but also works as a farmer growing basic grains like beans and corn.  He hires helpers to do the work and does not have a fixed work schedule.

He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and herbicides to obtain better harvests that are pest-free to then sell and obtain better income and to keep part of it for his family.  

Alexis’ goal is that his family lack nothing and has daily nourishment and to be able to give the best to his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sun is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Sun is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase ducks to raise for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Akodjenou Pierre

texts.fr: Akodjenou Pierre est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Akodjenou Pierre est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akodjenou Pierre exerce depuis une vingtaine d’années le métier de menuisier dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Akodjenou Pierre  est un éleveur de porc. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ces activités, Akodjenou Pierre contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Akodjenou Pierre sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Akodjenou Pierre ont été biens remboursés.
texts.en:
Akodjenou Peter is 41 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a retail merchant named Jeanne. The couple has four children all in school and under their care. In addition to their children, they have three other children to care for. The children live together with their parents and the couple shares responsibility for dealing with various household expenses.

To support himself and his children, Peter Akodjenou has worked as a carpenter in his area for the past 20 years. Secondarily, he is also a hog farmer.

With the income generated by these activities Akodjenou Pierre contributes towards his family's various expenditures.

To meet the needs of a steadily growing number of clients, Akodjenou Pierre is requesting for the third time a credit loan from ALIDé. The two previously granted loans were promptly repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy woodworking materials (beams, etc.)

loans.name: Jenni Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a Jenni, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en un bus de transporte de la localidad.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad los tres últimos días de la semana, ya que en esos días ella consigue a todos sus clientes en sus casas y es más fácil vender sus productos, además en esos días cobra ya  deja sus productos a crédito. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le encanta lo que hace ya así conoce muchas personas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas, y bisutería más que todo los de oferta ya que luego los vende al precio normal y así le queda más ganancias. Lleva más de 4 años en el  Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedora De Los Cerezos" ["Entrepreneur of Los Cerezos"] communal bank meets twice a month in the Los Cerezos area of the city of Portoviejo. This is a highly populated area on the edge of the city.

This is where we meet Jenni.  She is 42 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children.  Two are adults, while the two aged 12 and 10 years attend school.  Her husband works in bus transportation in the area.

Jenni is a great housewife who also works in retail selling Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things).  Her sales approach is going door-to-door and on request.  She travels her area the last three days of the week, as on these days she can find all her customers at home, and it is much easier to sell her products.  It is also on these days that she collects payment and delivers products that have been bought on credit.  She has been doing this work for four years, and she loves what she does as she has gotten to know many people this way.  

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry mostly for her supply, so she can sell them later at the regular price and so make more profits.

She has been in the communal bank for more than four years, and is the president of the bank.  She likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Her dream is to give nothing but the best to her young children.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a farmer who lives in Roma Norte in the province of Cagayan, together with his wife and two children. He has been growing rice for more than 10 years now. He plants and harvests the rice until maturity and sells them to local traders in the village where they live. He needs to improve his crop production so that he can meet all the needs of his family, especially for his children's allowances and tuition fees. As of now, he had insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides use in farming. According to him, crops can produce abundant harvest if fertilizers and pesticides are applied. 

In the future, Alexander would like to earn good income to meet his goal in raising his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 43 years old and is married with two children. She is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a bakery, selling baked goods in the local community. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. Leonila joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Leonila is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients to bake bread. She plans to use the income generated with her loan to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Ursalina

texts.en:
Ursalina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ursalina has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Ursalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ursalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years, married with six children who are all in school.
He deals in coffee farming and trade. He has requested for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings to help him purchase more coffee to sell in his business. He hopes this will increase his cash flow. His future plans are to construct a permanent house for his family. His major challenge is poor storage and processes which affect the quality of his coffee thereby lowering its prices.
Despite these challenges, Charles has tried to employ local storage measures and as a result of those efforts, he has a permanent flow of customers.

loans.use: to purchase coffee to sell.

loans.name: José Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Martinez has already 9 years working as a technician in refrigeration and air conditioner. Mainly he repairs the air conditioner of the cars and the electrical system. Mr. Martinez takes care of his son, his wife died recently; although his son helps him but just a little time because he studies. Mr. Martinez is asking for a loan of 2,000.dllrs to buy compressing equipment and a computer for fuel codes injection. \"It will help me to give service to all type of vehicle and I will have more clients”. My main objective is to support my son on college because he wants to be Automotive Engineer, like I sometime wanted it to be.

Español

El Sr. M. tiene ya 9 años prestando sus servicios como técnico en refrigeración y aire acondicionado. Principalmente repara aires acondicionados de autos y el sistema eléctrico. El Sr. M. quedó viudo hace poco tiempo teniendo a su cargo un hijo; aunque su hijo le ayuda por poco tiempo pues estudia. El solicita un crédito de 2.000 dlls. Para comprar un equipo de compresora y una computadora para códigos de fuel injection. “Me ayudará para dar servicio a toda clase de vehículos y así tendré más clientes. Mi principal objetivo es lograr que mi hijo sea un profesionista, quiere ser Ingeniero Automotriz, como yo alguna vez lo quise ser”

loans.use: Un equipo de compresora y una computadora para codigos de fuel injection.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Sokodé, Miss Chantal T. is single and has no children. Not having finished her secondary education due to a lack of means, she quickly launched herself into the sale of beauty products and baby outfits.

To increase her income in order to obtain maximum profits, she is asking for a loan of $400 to stock up her store.

She is a very dynamic young woman whose dedication and rigor need no demonstration. This loan will give her a second wind on the economic front.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1981 à Sokodé, Mademoiselle Chantal T. est célibataire sans enfant. N’ayant pas fini ses études secondaires faute de moyens, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce des produits de beauté et de trousseaux bébé.

Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce en vue d’un bénéfice maximum, elle sollicite pour cette fin un financement de $400 pour l'approvisionnement de sa boutique .

C’est une jeune femme très dynamique dont le dévouement et la rigueur ne sont plus à démontrer. Ce financement lui donnera un second souffle sur le plan économique.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products and baby outfits

loans.name: Nelly Morelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly is 40 years old. She is married, and she has a daughter aged 12 and two sons aged 22 and 17. Her husband Miguel is a night watchman and earns a low wage, which is not enough to pay for all the expenses of their home.

In order to help her husband with the family's expenses she decided to go to beauty school and opened her own beauty salon 5 years ago in Merida Yucatan, where she is from. Little by little she has been conditioning the business to offer a better service to her clients.

Now Nelly needs $375 to buy the supplies necessary to offer her services such as sprays, hair coloring and perm liquid products, etc.

Today you can help improve the life of this family. Nelly and her family appreciate your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Nelly tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 12 años y dos hijos de 22 y 17, su esposo Miguel es velador y recibe un salario muy bajo, insuficiente para solventar los gastos de su hogar, como una manera de ayudar a su esposo en el gasto familiar decidió tomar cursos de belleza y hace cinco años inicio su propia estética en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán de donde es originaria, poco a poco ha ido acondicionando su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus cliente.

Ahora Nelly necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares con lo que comprará artículos necesarios para ofrecer su servicio como fijadores, tintes, compra de líquidos para permanentes, etc. Hoy tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Nelly y si familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is married with two children. She lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She runs a food vending business in a busy area of Kigamboni. Mwasiti thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan, she was able to purchase a blender so that she can offer fresh juice to her customers. She also purchased a deep freezer so that she is now able to keep more fish and juice in stock. She is very delighted with these purchases because they have helped her increase her revenue.

Mwasiti has started to build a permanent structure where she can conduct her business. She is requesting a loan worth USD1200 for finishing the structure and buying tables, chairs, food serving dishes, food display cages and ceiling fans.

loans.use: To buy building materials, tables, chairs, and food serving dishes.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Aziza D. was born in 1956 in Aksu. She is married and has 6 children. Aziza started her business to provide for her family. She rented a space at the central market where she sells fruits and vegetables. Normicro helped her with $500 loan. Now, Aziza wants to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азиза Джафарова, родилась 1956 году в городе Аксу.Замужем имеет шестеро детей. Чтобы обеспечиват семью она начала заниматься бизнесом. Центральном рынке в городе Аксу арендовала место для продаж фруктами и овощами. Она обратилась за помощью Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Взяла кредит 500$.Теперь Азиза хочеть расширят свой бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ni Luh Suryaningsih

texts.id:
Although a teacher's wife, Ni Luh Suryaningsih is definitely a persistent lady worker. Ni Luh Suryaningsih is helping her husband by opening a retail stall in her house. Besides economical needs, this business is worked on to help paying for education cost of her 9th grader child. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (about US$110), Ni Luh Suryaningsih sells various sales items, like light food, cold drinks, and also vegetables. Ni Luh Suryaningsih opens her stall in the moring 06:00 AM unitl evenings 6:00PM. In the afternoon, Ni Luh Suryaningsih is helped by her husband after coming home from work to wait for the stall, so that Ni Luh Suryaningsih could rest a while. Day's profit could reach up to Rp50,000 (about US$5.50). Ni Luh Suryaningsih hopes that Dinari's loan could be used as additonal capital of her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang Guru, Ni Luh Suryaningsih memang seorang wanita yang ulet bekerja. Ni Luh Suryaningsih membantu suaminya dengan membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Disamping untuk memenuhi kebutuhan ekonomi, usaha ini ditekuninya untuk membantu menambah biaya pendidikan anaknya yang sudah duduk di kelas 3 SMA. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Ni Luh Suryaningsih menjual berbagai macam dagangan seperti makanan ringan, roti, minuman dingin , dan juga sayur mayur. Ni Luh Suryaningsih mulai membuka warungnya dari pagi hari jam 06.00 sampai jam 06.00 sore hari. Kalau siang hari, Ni Luh Suryaningsih dibantu suaminya yang sudah pulang kerja untuk menjaga warungnya sehingga Ni Luh Suryaningsih bisa istirahat sebentar. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dalam satu hari sampai Rp. 50.000,-. Ni Luh Suryaningsih berharap pinjaman dari Dinari bisa dipakai sebagai modal untuk tambahan usahanya.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: Tawa S. is a 40-year-old mother of 4 and hails from Ajamgbadi in Lagos, Nigeria.   She sells frozen food, drinks and pure water. She has being in this business since 1997. She requests a loan to buy more frozen food and drinks to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food, drinks and pure water

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mr. H. Pheng, 37, and his wife, Mrs. Noun Kan, 28, have been married since 1995. Pheng and his wife have a restaurant in the village, and sell Chinese noodles, food, coffee, and drinks (pictured with their son in front of restaurant).

They have two children-- one son, one daughter. Their children are studying in the local school. Pheng and his family live along National Road number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pheng is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA for $1,200. He plans to use this loan to expand his restaurant adding more tables and chairs so he can seat more customers. He will also add items to the menu, such as beer and wine. He needs to purchase kitchen equipment and tableware as well. By offering these specialty items, they will be able to earn a higher profit for the family.

loans.use: For improving restaurant

loans.name: Satnah

texts.en: Satnah, 48, is married to D. and has 5 children. She has a small shop in front of her house where she sells snacks, groceries, etc. She makes $15 a day. Since joined MBK her shop has grown. She is asking for a loan of $125 to add her business capital so she can increase her income to pay for her children's education. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Asha's Tupendane. Group

texts.en:
Asha is 33 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 7 and 3 years . Asha started her small food store in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, May, who sells items in a shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is the widowed mother of eight children and she has six grandchildren.     Four of her children are still in school, while four of them have completed their schooling and are raising families.  She wants to use the proceeds from her business to begin saving to build a house to support her grandchildren.  Afia sells cloth, scarves, and saucepans.   She travels to Tema, Ghana’s major port town, to purchase her products and then returns to her village of Akom.    

Afia is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God).    The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans and cloth

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. N. is 26 years old living in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have complimentary businesses revolving around sugar palms. Sugar palms are a unique breed of palm tree specific to Cambodia. Her husband, Yon Nal, is a professional palm tree climber of sorts. He collects the raw palm juice from the top of each tree and gives it to his wife who sells the juice and also distills it into palm wine. Their combined revenue amounts to 5 US$ per day. As they already live out in the rural country side, and currently do not have any children, Seng S. N. would like to invest in a second business as a yam farmer. She would use this loan to start up this business and buy land.

loans.use: To rent farmland.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo is 30 years old and lives with his partner, Blanca Otazú, who is 22 years old. They have their own house. Evarista started working with his father as a vendor when he was very young. Later he acquired a motorcycle and started to work on his own over 10 years ago.

He makes his sales going door to door on his motorcyle, covering many kilometers each day.

Two nephews and a cousin work with him and he pays them for the sales they make.

He needs a loan for the purchase of merchandise like bedspreads, quilts, and sheets, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Evaristo tiene 30 años de edad, vive en pareja con Blanca Otazú de 22 años de edad, tienen casa propia.

Evaristo empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor, luego adquirió una moto y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace ya más de diez años .

Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios.

Trabajan con él dos de sus sobrinos y un primo a quienes les paga por las ventas realizadas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como colchas, edredón, sábanas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of quilts, sheets, bedspreads, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Masuma

texts.ru:
Masuma is a businesswoman with 2 years of experience. She is 33 years old and has two children. Three years ago tragedy struck - after a long illness her husband passed away. Left with two children Masuma had no idea how to move forward. Little work is available in the area where she lives, so with the help of her older sister she decided to start a business. Using her savings and aided by her sister, she rented a small place at the bazar, and started buying and selling children's clothing. What money she made became the only source of income for the family. She lives with her mother-in-law. The children are growing and she needs to be selling at the bazar every day. She has been involved with Microinvest for over a year. She has been an exemplary client during this time. Now the summer clothing season is approaching, and Masuma would like a new loan to expand her selection of summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Масумахон предприниматель с 2-х летним стажем. Ей 33 года, у нее 2 детей. 3 года назад у нее случилось несчастье. После продолжительной болезни у нее умер муж. Оставшись с двумя детьми Масумахон не знала что делать дальше. Особой работы в районе ее проживания не было и она при помощи старшей сестры решила начать заниматься бизнесом. На свои сбережения и с помощью сестры она арендовала маленькое место на базаре, стала заниматься куплей продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным в ее семейном бюджете. Проживает она со своей свекровью. Дети растут и она вынуждена быть каждый день на базаре и торговать. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает больше года. За это времы показала себя образцовой клиенткой. Сейчас наступает сезон летней одежды и Масумахон обратилась за новым займом для пополнения ассортимента летней одежды.

loans.use: To expand the summer clothing selection

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria Q. V. lives with her 15-year old daughter in the zone of V. Salome, a suburban area of La Paz.

Gregoria works in public administration and with her savings she was able to buy her house, but the home only consists of a bedroom and a bathroom. Because of this, the loan she’s requesting will be used to build a multi-use room (that is to say, a room that can be used for a living or dining room, or a kitchen, as required).

This is the first time she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out favorably qualifies her, and so make her eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria Q. V. vive en la zona de V. Salome, -área suburbana de La Paz- con su hija de 15 años.

Gregoria trabaja en la administración pública y con los ahorros que tiene pudo comprar su vivienda, pero esta solo cuenta con una habitación y un baño por lo que el crédito solicitado será destinado para construir una habitación múltiple (es decir, que pueda usarse de living, comedor o cocina, según la ocasión)

Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a Room

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing A. is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in Iyano-era, Lagos State, Nigeria. Blessing has been selling palm oil in gallons for the past five years. Twice a month, she travels four to five hours by bus to the eastern part of Nigeria (Imo State) to buy gallons of palm oil to resell.

Blessing is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more gallons of palm oil at one time, so that she can cut her traveling costs from twice a month to once a month.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Oscar Carrión se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio de trabajo en aluminio y vidrio elaborando vitrinas y a la vez reparándolas.

Es de necesidad destacar que el señor Oscar C. es padre de tres hijos por los cuales tiene que velar y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios. Según comenta ellos son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. Por esta razón es que se dedica a su trabajo con mucho amor y sacrificio.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra del material de trabajo en aluminio y vidrio y espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar Carrión works very hard as the owner of a business making and repairing windows made of aluminum and glass, in the Ciudad Sandino district of the city of Managua. It's essential to note that Oscar is the father of three children, whom he must take care of and provide with the conditions they need to continue their studies. According to Oscar, his children are the reason for his efforts and the reason he has dedicated himself to his work with such love and sacrifice. Oscar recently has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase the materials he uses in his work -- aluminum and glass -- and he hopes that the application will be approved so he can continue operating his business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials (aluminum and glass)

loans.name: Phim

texts.en:
Phim R. is 53 years old, a widow, and lives in Siem Reap Province with her three children. She has been working as a grocer, selling goods out of her house since 2000, earning about US$ 3- 4 per day. Her three children aged 26, 23, and 17 all work. One daughter has her own business in Phnom Penh, the other daughter has a business making and selling desserts, and her son works in construction. 

Phim R.'s store is located at her house. The requested loan would help her increase her inventory and attract more customers.

Phim R. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate.  Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at 

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
In the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, lives a certain Mrs. Rosenda H. C., 39 years of age, married with 3 children. Her husband is a mere farmer tenant on the land which he inherited from his parents, because he has no choice, his parents were unable to send their children to school due to financial incapacity. Mrs. Rosenda C. realized that her husband's income is not sufficient for their daily needs.

In her own little way, she decided to make a backyard garden for their own consumption, but then their neighbors wanted to buy their vegetables. This being the case, she decided to expand her area, but unfortunately, she had no money to finance expansion.

She heard from a radio advertisement that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is offering a micro-finance program for marginalized people. She became a regular member April 11, 2000, received a loan amounting to PHP 5,000, and was able to expand her vegetable garden.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for her 5,000 square meter garden. The loan is intended for purchasing fertilizers & pesticides for her vegetable garden.

Aside from financial assistance given by PMPC, Rosenda learned new technologies for vegetable production & capability-building, including savings mobilization. In the future, she and her husband dream of sending their children to college and of acquiring a parcel of land for their own.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers & pesticides for her market garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Née en 1970, Mme D. Georgette est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est couturière de métier et exerce actuellement à Gapé. Courageuse et honnête, elle emploie cinq (05) apprenties couturières, ce qui engendre un manque cruel de matériels de travail, notamment les machines à coudre. Pour mettre à la disposition de tous ses apprenties le matériel de travail indispensable, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter de nouvelles machines à coudre. Cela va lui permettre de répondre satisfaire rapidement ses clients et d’accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1970, Madam Georgette D. is married and a mother with one child. She is a dressmaker by trade and currently works in Gapé. A courageous and honest woman, she employs five apprentice dressmakers, and so there is a terrible lack of supplies and equipment, notably sewing machines. To provide what is indispensible to the work of her apprentices, she is requesting financing to buy new sewing machines. This will enable her to satisfy her customers quickly and to grow her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines for her workshop

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: ANA CECILIA M. D. A., vive en la ciudad D. Soyapango a las afueras D. la capital D. El Salvador, a sus 50 años D. edad vive con su madre, esposo e hijos. Debido a que solo consta con educación media, Ana Cecilia montó una pequeña tienda en su propia casa, en la cual se encarga D. vender productos D. primera necesidad, tales como huevos, sopas, comida enlatada entre otros productos. A pesar que sus ventas son muy buenas, Ana Cecilia necesita aumentar los productos D. su tienda y poder percibir mejores ingresos para suplir todas las necesidades D. su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cumplir su deseo D. incrementar el inventario D. su negocio, percibir más ganancias y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
ANA CECILIA M. D. A., lives in the city of Soyapango, on the outskirts of the capital of El Salvador. At 50 years of age, she lives with her mother, her husband, and children. Thanks to a middle education, Ana Cecilia began a small store in her own home, where she works to sell products of basic necessity, things like eggs and soap, food mixed with other products. Because of this her sales are very good. Ana Cecilia needs to augment the products in her store and to be able to get better income in order to meet all the needs of the household. Since she doesn’t have the necessary resources, she is asking for a loan in order to be able to complete her desire of increasing the inventory in her business, to get more profits and to be able to improve her family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory in Ana's Store

loans.name: Jide

texts.en: Jide A. is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has a small poultry farm where he rears poultry birds. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds and poultry feed. He says (thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds and poultry feed

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
U. Sulton is dedicated to agricultural work, which is his only income source to support his family, composed of his wife and 4 children. He has been dedicated to this business for several years and over time he has gained experience in cultivating crops. Today Sulton has come to IMON International with the proposition of obtaining a loan to purchase potato seed and fertilizer for planting. It is necessary to point out that in order to carry out the first planting you need to purchase the supplies and it is for this reason that he is confident that his loan request will be successfully granted and he will achieve his objective of having a good harvest to improve his economic situation.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Omar Alfonzo

texts.es:
Omar M. L. tiene un restaurant de comida oriental desde hace 8 años operando bajo el nombre de China Town, su negocio es unico de su especie en el municipio de trojes, lo que lo hace muy popular en la zona, ya que mucha gente va a comer a su restaurant, nos comento que su arte culinario lo aprendio hace mucho tiempo ya que el laboro para restaurantes chinos de mucho presigio en la ciudad de tegucigalpa y san Pedro Sula, su estado civil es casado y tiene 2 hijos a cargo, uno de ellos cursa la primaria en una de las escuelas publicas de la zona, uno de sus sueños es expandir su negocio y tener su propio local donde sus clientes puedan degustar sus suculentos platillos.
necesita el credito para comprar comida para hacer sus platillos especiales.
texts.en:
Omar M. L. has run an oriental restaurant, China Town, for the last 8 years. His is the only one of its kind in the Trojes municipality and is therefore very popular among the locals, many of whom go to eat there. He tells us that he learned to cook this type of food some time ago, as he worked for very prestigious Chinese restaurants back in Tegucigalpa and San Pedro Sula. He is married with 2 children, one of whom is a primary student at a local public school. One of his dreams is to expand his business and have his own premises where his customers can sample his delicious cuisine. He needs the loan to buy food for making his special dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish, shrimp, snails, lobster, octopus, chicken, oil, vegetables, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a child. She is an entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. Irina sells household items in the central marketplace of her home town. A wide assortment of merchandise and loyal clientele help her keep up a high demand. Irina launched the venture six years ago. Currently, she has 16,000 Hryvnia in turnover. Income amounts to 2,200 Hryvnia a month.

Irina has a good credit history and a positive reputation among other market vendors. This time she is seeking a loan of 9,000 Hryvnia to purchase additional merchandise in bulk for her vending kiosk. She is achievement oriented and has confidence in her abilities and powers. We believe these crucial characteristics that Irina possesses will secure further growth of her trade and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: el sr. Mario Z. se dedica a la compra/venta de madera, leña y materiales de construccion como ser cemento, arena, piedra, cal, etc. desde hace 10 años,  lo que le ha generado ingresos para apoyar a su familia financieramente y cumplir con los todos los gastos de su hogar, el en estos momentos necesita reparar su vehiculo que es su medio de trabajo, con este pickup el hace todos sus trabajos y es su herramienta numero 1 para realizar su trabajo, por tal razon solicita el credito para poder arreglarlo.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Z. has been buying and selling wood, lumber and construction materials such as cement, sand, rock and lime for the past 10 years. This has been his source of income as he has financially supported his family including all household costs. Currently he needs to repair his vehicle, as this truck is his main tool for getting all of his jobs done, which is why he requests a loan so that he's able to fix it.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement car parts

loans.name: Foni

texts.en:
Foni M., 42, is widowed and has 4 children who all attend school. She earns income selling foodstuffs, including cooked rice, beans, and meat, at her resturant and currently needs a loan to increase the stock of beans, rice, and meat, so that she is able to expand her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs when measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, meat, and rice for a resturant

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is a domestic fisherman in Abotoase near Hohoe. John has received primary school education.  He is married and has 5 dependants. His wife is a trader whose income is too small to take care of the family. John is responsible for the financial welfare of his dependants and the family as a whole. His loan will be used to buy a motor for his fishing boat since he has been depending on his strength to paddle the canoes. He hopes to reinvest the profit from his business.

loans.use: To buy a motor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Sabougnouma  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma  2 est constitué  de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commue rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture  de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 18 hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma 2 group is composed of married women who average 29 years of age and 3 children. They live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 18 hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 18 hectares

loans.name: Osasunmwen

texts.en:
Osasunmwen is 52 years old and she is married with six children. She sells palm oil in wholesale and retail.

Osasunmwen hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She is saying thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: N. Fatuma is a 32 year old business woman. She has a charcoal business. She brings charcoal from villages and sells to customers in town. She has been doing this business for over seven years. She plans to use the loan for purchasing more bags of charcoal and expanding her business. She has two children who are going to school. She hopes to construct rental houses for future financial support.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion O. is from the village of Taboo-o,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Consolacion is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Consolacion owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling sea foods. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sea foods to local community members. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Consolacion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing boat. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Consolacion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing boat

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Mrs. Jonalyn O. is 32 years old and lives in the village of Sitio Serena Enclaro, in the town of Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She is married to Diosdado O. who, because of a lack of employment opportunities in their town, is presently employed as a security guard in Manila, leaving her to fend for their five young children who range in age from the oldest who is just 8 years old to the youngest who is just a week old. Finding herself in a situation where she is a single-parent of five very young children, and the wife of an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), albeit without the perks of a dollar remittance, she was forced to think of ways to support her family because the money her husband sends home is just not enough for the needs of the family. At first, Jonalyn started helping in her mother's candy-making business, and distributing the finished products to various general stores in her community and in the neighboring towns. As she proved to be a good businesswoman, her mother handed the reins of the candy business to her. Gaining confidence from her success in the candy business, Jonalyn started looking for other business opportunities within her area of expertise and she thought - why not try baked goods? But Jonalyn did not have enough capital to start a bakery business, so when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007, this was the business venture she wrote in her business proposal for her first loan. And even with just a very small loan, she was able to buy materials and equipment to start operations. Now, two years later, she is happy because she is now able to provide employment to eight people in her neighborhood whom she hired to help her in her bakery. Her success has not stopped Jonalyn from looking for more income sources - she also does direct-selling of beauty products in her community, and these activities earns about PHP 22,000 per month - enough to support her family, pay for her loan, and have enough left for savings for the future needs of her children. Her last loan of PHP 20,000 was fully paid on time, and without any delays. Now on her 9th loan, Jonalyn wants to borrow PHP 23,000 so that she can infuse additional capital into her bakery and other business ventures. She plans to use the income to invest back into the business while setting aside some money for the education of her young children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Reina Blanca

texts.es:
Reyna de ocupación productora de Pan de Laja, este producto lo comercializa en El Alto y en distintas ferias populares en las comunidades vecinas, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus Padres ubicado en la comunidad Laja Prov. Los Andes.

El crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital de inversión, compra de Harina al por mayor así poder incrementar su producción de Pan.
 
Es el tercer crédito, los créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Reyna.

loans.use: COMERCIO

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Mrs. Ren H. lives in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Min Virak, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Ren H. wants to expand her business by purchasing more grocery products. She will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 22 years old and the mother of three children. One of them attends the local school and the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and fertilizer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 31 years old and is married with five children, their ages ranging between 5 and 14 years old. Florence lives in the Kicukiro district which is in the capital city of Kigali.

Florence has a shop where she sells a variety of dishes and kitchen products located in this area. She has been in the business of selling housewares for the past five years. However, she is a relatively new entrepreneur, having been in business for herself for only one year. Florence has a helper who works with her in the shop from seven in the morning until six at night.

Florence is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing a variety of attractive dishes in order to attract more customers and please her current ones. If successful, this will result in greater profits which she will likely reinvest in the business as well as take care of her children and begin to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of attractive dishes and home products

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Raimundo M., nasceu em Manica, província de Manica, tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos com 06, 03 e 01 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Frequenta 10ªclasse na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano e pretende continuar com estudos no nível superior. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta também um irmão que vive com ele.

Saiu de Manica para província de Maputo em 2002 com intenção de iniciar uma actividade comercial mais tarde foi buscar a sua família que residem juntos em Boane. Actualmente trabalha numa empresa de segurança (G4), faz cerca de 8 horas por dia e aufere um salário de 4.200.00mt por mes, poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 8.500.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, para poder concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Raimundo M., was born in Manica, province in Manica, he is 29 years old, is married and has 3 children who are 6, 3 and 1 years old, the first one goes to school. Raimundo is on the 10th grade of Joaquim Chissano High School and wants to continue studying and go to college. He lives in his own house and besides his family, he supports a brother who lives with them. He left Manica in the province of Maputo in 2002 in order to start a commercial activity and then he went to look for his family and they live all together now in Boane. Currently he works in a security company (G4), he works close to 8 hours a day and earns a salary of 4.200MT a month, and is able save some money in his bank account. He never had loans with other institutions, and learned about Hluvuku thru friends. This is his 4th loan for 15.000MT, that he expects to use to buy construction material (cement, iron, doors and others) to keep on building his house. The previous loans were for 6.000MT, 8.000MT and 8.500MT, all for the same activity. In the future he expects to request more loans to finish his house and offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron and others)

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Maria Antonia trabaja en servicios domésticos, desde hace cinco años, trabajo cansado, y gana poco, madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales dos emigraron a Costa rica por la mala situación  económica del país, el desempleo, y pagas muy bajos. el pequeño de 7 años lo tiene estudiando su segundo grado en la primaria, Su casa es pequeña y con la necesidad de ganar dinero tomo la iniciativa de alquilar un  cuarto para poder ayudarse con los gastos básicos de agua y luz. Con el crédito anterior lo termino de construir y acondiciono. Y con este financiamiento construirá otro cuarto el cual comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines con el fin de  poder ahorrar para un futuro. Ya que tiene 52 años de edad, y siente cansada. Agradece Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos a mujeres pobres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Antonia has been working in domestic service for five years, a job that is tiring and low-paying. She is a single mother of three children, two of which immigrated to Costa Rica because of the high unemployment rate, low pay, and bad economic situation in the country. Her youngest child is 7 years-old and in second grade in elementary school. Maria Antonia's house is small, but because of the need to earn money she took the initiative and decided to rent out one room to help with the basic costs of water and electricity. With the previous loan she finished building and furnishing the room. With the funds from this loan she will buy the materials to build another room: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams, all with the goal of saving for the future. Maria Antonia is already 52 years-old, and she feels tired. She is grateful for Afodenic and the support their loans provide for poor women.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to build a room to rent.

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Abieyuwa sells dried pepper at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this line of business for a long time. Dried pepper is used as a soup ingredient in Nigeria. The demands for her dried pepper are high and she hopes to meet this demand. She is 42 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a civil servant, and he also supports the home. She says her major challenge in her business is insufficient funds. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more dried pepper to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried pepper to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, age 40, sells cosmetics. She has been in business for the past 20 years. She is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, and she is married with two children.

She wishes to expand her business by increasing her stock as the demand for cosmetics is high. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,00, which she will use to purchase more cosmetics items to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: 30 De Enero Group

texts.es: E. grupo “30 De Enero“ esta representado por la señora Brigida y conformada por 12 miembros que van empezado en su 2do  ciclo, la mayoría son de la misma zona y se conocen bastante bien de manera que es un grupo muy solidario por que entre todas se ayudan para que E. banco marche bastante bien, los integrantes son personas mayores y responsables. Entre las actividades que realizan las socias esta la presidenta  que es una persona que se dedica a su negocio de venta de cosméticos  ambulando de donde le generan buenas ganancias las demás personas se dedican a la venta de comida en sus hogares, elaboración y distribución de empanadas, refrescos, venta en ferreterías, servicio de empleo domestico y los entre los hombres se dedican al transporte en moto taxis. La competencia de las socias esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta de cosméticos, comida y en E. transporte pero saben como salir adelante con entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar. E. destino dE. crédito es hacer crecer sus negocios,  llegando a surtir su mercadería y con la adquisición de insumos  incrementando sus ventas y ofreciendo mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro puedan darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y  una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “30 de enero” is represented by Ms. Brigida and is made up of 12 members who are starting their second loan cycle. Most of the members are from the same neighborhood and know each other well, which makes them a united group that works together to keep the bank running smoothly. The members are all responsible adults. Among the different jobs of each member is the president, who works as a traveling cosmetics saleswoman, which generates a good income for her. There are also members who sell food from their homes, make and sell empanadas, soft drinks, members who work in hardware stores, housecleaning services, and some of the men work as moto-taxi drivers. Competition is very tough for the members, especially in cosmetics sales, food and transportation services, but the members know how to keep moving forward with enthusiasm and hard work. The loan will be used to grow their businesses, increase their sales and offer better service to their customers, so that in the future they will be able to give their children a good education and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by RachE. Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operational capital

loans.name: Asma'

texts.en:
Asma' M. is an ambitious young woman from Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip, who started her own project at her house. In the photo she is standing in her workshop in front of her sewing machines.

Asma' purchases cloth for sewing long robes which Hijabi Muslim women wear. This type of robe sells well in Gaza Strip.

Asma' started this project recently to help her husband who works for the local authority in Rafah and receives a small salary. Their combined income would provide the family, which consists of a one son and one daughter, with all that they need.

The project is succeeding due to the high demand for such robes. Therefore, Asma' has requested $1,500 to purchase the needed amount of cloth.

Please note that Asma comes from a religious family, therefore she covers her face in the picture shown here.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to sew

loans.name: Awe

texts.en:
H. is a member of LAPO with a good repayment record. She owns a hairdressing saloon shop where she sells hair cream and hair extensions and braids hair for her customers. She manages the business with her three children who come from school to assist her at the shop. 

The income from her business enables her help her husband feed their children and pay for their education.H. is very determined and wants to expand her business. She would like to have an additional store where she can sell hair extension and hair cream and make more profits.

She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extension. This will help her implement business expansion plan, attract more sales, and increase her profits.
  
H. is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She sends a very big "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more hair cream and hair extension to sell

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Ernesto P. labora en la actividad de Operador de consola en el Banco Central de Nicaragua desde hace 8 año el cual con este trabajo sustenta a su familia y ha luchado por mejorar su vivienda, empieza a laborar de 9am a 9pm .  

Este crédito que solicito es para Mejor su Vivienda reparación de cuarto y el plan de inversión es Compra de Materiales de Construcción como es cemento, hierro,perlin, zinc, arena, Bloque, cerámica, piedrín
texts.en:
Luis Ernesto P. has worked as a computer operator in the Banco Central de Nicaragua for 8 years. This employment makes it possible for him to support his family; he works from 9am to 9pm. He has struggled to make home improvements. The loan will be used to make home improvements, to repair a room. He intends to buy building materials like: cement, iron, zinc metal sheeting and tubing, sand, concrete blocks, tile, gravel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ngourn

texts.en: Ngourn C. T. lives with his wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has a business as a phone seller and repairman, earning an income of USD 18 per day.
