His wife helps with the business which they have had since 2008 and which has improved their standard of living. T. is requesting a loan of  $1,000 to buy a computer and phone repair equipment to expand his business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, in partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: buy a computer and phone repair equipment

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mr. Hai H., age 62 and his wife, Mrs. Choem Laisorng, age 58, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have two married children: one son and one daughter. One of them lives in separate home and another one lives in the family home. Hai was available for the photo, his wife is pictured instead. 

Hai has been a rice farmer for twenty years. Besides farming, he is a horse cart driver as well. His wife has been running a grocery store in front of her house for eighteen years. He is requesting his first loan of $700 US to purchase a trailer to connect to a motorized hand tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to a motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 21, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells fish for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband helps his wife with her business of selling fish, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more fish for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to buy a stand at the market to sell fish.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and child. Both she and her husband work to support the family. She has been working as a farmer since 2007. She owns the land she works on. Although women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, their presence is continuously growing. Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. offers special incentives to loan officers who recruit female clients.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a water tank for her farm. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for her farm

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S., 48, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Rolando S., an employee, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own direct selling business for quite some time now.

Teresita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct selling business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders of toiletries, cosmetics and clothing that have been ordered by her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: home products inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman, aged 32 years, and has three children aged 12, 6 and 3 years. She and her husband share the responsibilities of their home of seven people.

Agnes operates a drug shop in Masindi, Uganda, and has been in the business for seven years now. After working in other people’s drug shops she decided to open up her own with the little capital she had.

Agnes maintains that a lack of capital and disruption by the government officials are the issues that affect her business sector but adds that she has a dream of having a big drug shop one day. In Uganda, most people find it easier buying drugs from drug shops and sometimes the regulations in the sector are not easy to meet, as sellers like Agnes say.

This is Agnes’s third loan and she is to use the loan funds to buy more drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell in her drug shop

loans.name: Nou Vle Chanje De Grand Bassin 1,2,3, & 4 Group

texts.en:
Roseguerda is the coordinator of her group, NOU VLE CHANJE DE GRAND BASSIN (New Change in Grand Basin), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in Grand Bassin, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and child.

Roseguerda is excited to be seeking her second loan with Esperanza. Notably, she already successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Specifically, she sells soft drinks to earn a living, so the loan would be used to purchase drinks and ice (to keep the drinks cold). She will use the profits to invest in completing her home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To further expand her business by purchasing additional soft drinks and ice

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en:
Nelius is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are adults and one attends school. She has been operating a business selling fresh water, charcoal and green vegetables from her home to her neighboring community for the last year. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of charcoal and a sack of green vegetables. She earns her other source of income from the rental houses. 

Nelius' major challenge is seasonality. She hopes to have two rental houses and open an M-pesa mobile money transfer in the future. She decided to work with Yehu to get financial services to boost her business. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and green vegetables.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en: Mrs. Seab S. is a 38-year-old married woman and a villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of farmland that she uses to grow different kinds of crops. She is married with two school-aged children and her husband works on the farm with her. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, Seab S. does not have capital to use on her farm. Seab S. is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Seab S. was not available when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro tienes 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Mercedes Umaña, Departamento D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos D. la edades 18 y 22 años los cuales dependen económica mentes D. ella, la cual posee un taller sastrería ( fabrica ropa).
El negocio lo inicio atreves D. la madre quien le enseño atienD. el negocio D. lunes a Domingo es cual está ubicado en el lugar D. residencia, actualmente trabaja en la elaboración D. uniformes escolares, ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra D. tela D. diferentes colores, hilos y materiales necesarios para la fabricación D. uniformes; este préstamo contribuirá a solventar gastos familiares, que son solventados por el negocio, permitiendo continuar con el negocio.
Las aspiraciones D. milagro son apoyar a los hijos con el estudio, con las ganancias del negocio comprar otra máquina D. coser.
texts.en:
Milagro is 41 years old and resides in the town of Mercedes Umaña in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 22, who are still financially dependent on her. Milagro owns a sewing workshop where she makes clothing.

This business started as a result of learned the traD. from her mother. Milagro operates her business Monday to Sunday from her home. She currently makes school uniforms and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics in different colors, thread, and other materials needed to fulfill her orders. This loan will enable her to contribute to the family expenses by continuing her business, thereby generating income.

Milagro says her aspirations are to support her children with their studies and use her business earnings to buy another sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, and other materials for making uniforms

loans.name: Aminosse Alberto

texts.pt:
Aminosse Alberto J. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, não tem filhos ainda, freqüenta 12ª classe, vive na casa dos pais e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha como monitor de informática e criador de aves ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de outros clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para criação de frangos de corte.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para aumentar a quantidade de pintos, automaticamente aumentando o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Aminosse Alberto J. was born in the district of Boane, Maputo, in Southern Mozambique, where he still lives with his parents and is responsible for their support as well as the support of a sister. For the last four years, in addition to attending school (he is currently in the last year of secondary school), Aminosse has been in the business of raising chickens (he also works as a computer teacher). He works by himself and earns 4.000.00mt per month, which allows him to support himself and his family and to save some money in the bank. This is the first time he is applying for a loan. He heard about Hluvuku through some clients of the institution. He will use the 15.000.00mt to buy more baby chicks to raise, chicken feed and vitamins. He plans to apply for another loan in the future, to increase the number of chickens he raises and sells and, therefore, his profit.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baby chicks, chicken feed and vitamins

loans.name: Fualole

texts.en:
Fualole M. is 30 and married with 1 child (1 year old).  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains). Fualole has 1 year of experience in this business. Fualole needs a loan of 1000 talas to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fualole joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fualole's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena M. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a motorcycle transport service. Lorena is just starting this business.

In 2008, Lorena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Lorena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle tires and other accessories

loans.name: Ericson

texts.en:
Ericson D. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. He is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ericson owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for breeding. Ericson has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Ericson joined Kiva partner, ASKI ,to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina M.  tiene  una Pulpería desde hace 6 años, Tiene 14 años de vivir en esta misma dirección, es casada su esposo Trabajaba en Banex (Banco del éxito) Doña Isabel Cristina tiene dos persona a cargo que depende de ella y de los ingresos del esposo. 

Es cliente A de CEPRODEL desde enero del 2005 habiendo trabajado  a la fecha 7 créditos, pagándolos en tiempo y forma, los cuales ha utilizado para la inversión en mercadería. Tal como Arroz, Frijoles, cereales, Aceite y productos varios
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel Cristina M. has had a general store for 6 years. She has lived for 14 years at the same address. She is married and her husband works at Banex. Ms. Isabel Cristina has two dependents that depend on her income and that of her husband. 

She has been a client of CEPRODEL since January 2005, having worked through at this time 7 loan cycles, paying them in a timely manner, which she has used to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store such as rice, beans, cereals, oil and various products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. C. is a man of 30 years, married to Margaret K., and together they have two children. His wife is a housewife and fully depends on her husband to provide them with basic items like food, clothing, etc. David’s primary business is horticulture; he plants vegetables for resale and he also buys cereals like maize and beans in bulk and sells them in small quantities to others at a profit. He has been in this business for 16 years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya Shillings. 

This will be David's third loan through KADET, and he plans to buy more cereals for resale and also expand his farm where he plants vegetables for resale. 

In future David plans to build a good house for his family and also pay school fees for his children so that they can get the best education.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale and expand the farm for horticulture

loans.name: Gbossèdé Célestine

texts.fr: H. Gbossèdé Célestine est née le 31 Juillet 1976 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à ALANMENOU Rémi, Célestine est mère de quatre enfans, dont deux sont à sa charge. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à PK11 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis cinq ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Célestine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Célestine prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot, pâte de maïs, oeufs, etc.) à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Célestine achète ses produits à Cotonou. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse, Célestine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité, afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et ses revenus. C'est pour cette raison que Célestine sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Gbossèdé Célestine H. was born on July 31, 1976 in Adjohon, in the Ouémé district. Married to Rémi Alanmenou, Célestine is the mother of four children,   two of whom are in her care. For five years, Célestine has been living together with her children and husband in the PK11 neighborhood in the Sèmè-Podji community. The spouses jointly take care of various family needs. Célestine has had very little schooling. To support herself, Célestine prepares food for sale (rice, beans, soft-boiled polenta, eggs, etc) in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Celestine purchases her groceries in Cotonou. She has been in this business for three years and already obtained a loan from ALIDé before, repaying it well. Facing an increase in customer demand, Célestine would like to bolster her stock and expand her business, in order to increase her sales and  revenues. This is why Célestine is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries (rice, beans, corn) and sauce condiments

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon B., 24, is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. As the family's sole bread-winner, Ilhomjon works hard selling blankets, towels and children's clothes, a business he has had for nine years. He secures the goods from neighboring China and then supplies his customers in the market. Good quality items and attractive prices have allowed him to establish and maintain his clientele base, and the resulting stable income has allowed him to improve the family's living conditions.

Today Ilhomjon requests $2000 USD to purchase additional goods to sell. He would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To putchase blankets, towels and different kinds of clothes to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband, 2 school-aged children and one older parent. She cooperates with her husband in providing the family’s income. She has been working as a teacher in a local school for10 years and in 2007 she decided to receive students at her house. 

Today she is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip her teaching room with the needed tools. She is in really urgent need of a system to make the room warmer especially in the winter season to make to students feel comfortable while taking the lessons.

loans.use: to equip the teaching room

loans.name: Minura's Group

texts.en:
Minura D. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 23 years old and married. Her husband earns money by mining coal; sometimes he resells wool to make additional income. They have two children, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). Three years ago, with the initial investment of 4000 soms, Minura started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a cow in order to increase the number of cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. M. is a married lady with six children, aged between thirty-one years old and fourteen years old. She owns a curio shop in which she sells carvings, curios and African beaded sandals. Her business is located at the Maasai market in Kisumu along the Kisumu-Nairobi highway. Her target market is primarily tourists, but she also gets local residents who like the items she sells. Beatrice has been in business for eleven years now. Her business is profitable, but her major challenge is unavailability of the raw materials. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She plans to use her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy beads and other materials to make the curios to grow the business and meet the demands of the customers. She sees herself growing her business and even getting a bigger space right at Kisumu museum, where she will be getting many potential customers. She describes herself as tolerant and loving.

loans.use: To buy beads and other materials for crafts

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les huit prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
KADIA D. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 régimes de bananes et quelques paniers de papayes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de MEDINE. Les bananes et papayes sont revendus aux  marchés de MEDINE et de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the JIGUISSEME group are all married women, averaging 40 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a village in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their ninth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. All eight previous loans were repaid without problems.

KADIA D. intends to use her loan to buy 100 banana bunches and a few baskets of papayas. She gets her supplies at the grand market in MEDINE. She resells the bananas and papayas for cash, at her home and at the market in MEDINE and HAMDALLAYE, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 85'000 (ca US$ 170), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Dora Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora Delia; la socia tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; la socia es docente de profesión, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta ella estuvo ahorrando un dinero el cual siempre deseo invertir en algún negocio propio de esta manera la socia aperturo este año su propio colegio y con el préstamo ella va a comprar  algunas cositas que le faltaba, la socia está feliz ya que mediante esta empresa ella podrá realizar su sueño que tanto quería.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar algunas cosas para la apertura de su nuevo colegio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” ["Lord of the Miracles of Chimpahuaylla"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Dora Delia, and she is 30 years old and single. She is a teacher by profession, and she is a very cheerful and enthusiastic person. She has been saving her money, which she has always wanted to invest in some kind of business of her own. Accordingly, this year she opened up her own school. With the loan, she will buy some items which were still lacking. She is happy because through this business she will be able to achieve the dream she has wanted so much. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy some items to open her new school. 

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy some items she needs to open her new school

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena makes different kinds of rice cakes that she sells in her community. She also makes banana cue. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about $75 per month. Magdalena has requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour and sugar. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business.

Magdalena is 56 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have an 18-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour and sugar

loans.name: Nizar

texts.ar: نزار عمره 34 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الهواتف النقالة والاكسسوارت وغيره له في عمله 7 سنوات يحب عمله ويتميز به في محيطه يسعى نزار الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي ويريد بناء عائلة ومساعدة الاهل على تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة اكسسوارت للهواتف النقالة و خطوط تعبئة له زبائن من جيرانه واقاربه يتميز بابتكاره وتصليح الموبيلات الجديدة على الماسحة الضوئية (scan) يريد دائما مساعدة الاهل حتى يمكن العلاقة الاسرية بينه وبين اهله وان يبني اسرة تكون على اساس جيد ومادي متوسط
texts.en: Nizar is a 34 year old bachelor. He has been working for seven years at a shop for selling mobile handsets and mobile phone accessories. Nizar has a passion for his work. He seeks to improve his sociA. and financiA. conditions. He wants to have a family and to improve his parents' living conditions. Nizar wants a loan from A. Majmoua to buy new mobile sets accessories and pre- paid lines to sell in the shop. His clients are mainly from his neighbours and relatives. He is innovative and he fixes mobile handsets using scanners. He wants to help his parents and to build a good family with a reasonable income.

loans.use: To buy mobile handsets and mobile phone accessories to sell in his shop

loans.name: Jose Dario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose; es soltero; el socio tiene 60 años de edad; el socio tiene 2 hijos, (menores);  el socio es secretario del banco comunal, el socio se dedica a la ganadería, el socio tiene vacas y el vende los derivados de las vacas, el socio en la actualidad tiene 33 vacas lecheras el socio nos comenta que él comenzó con 10 vacas al inicio; el socio desea seguir creciendo y aumentar su vacas y la producción de leche de vaca para la venta. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de vacas.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. José is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 60 years old, single, and has two children who are still minors. José serves as the Communal Bank secretary and earns his living by raising livestock. He has cows and sells whatever they produce. José currently has 33 dairy cows and says that he started his business with 10 cows. He wants to grow his herd and increase the production of his dairy cows so that he can sell the milk. José is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cows.

He is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo J.  Méndez vive en Pilas de Pérez Zeledón y se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura.
Domingo  tiene una pequeña finquita en la cual quiere sembrar tubérculos. Específicamente jengibre   y ñampi. Para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra de los tubérculos. 
El espera sacar provecho de la temporada y aumentar sus ingresos, para el beneficio de su familia.
Domingo es  socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Domingo J.  Méndez lives in Pilas de Pérez Zeledón, and he has dedicated his entire life to agriculture. 

Domingo has a small farm, where he would like to plant root crops, specifically ginger and ñampi [malanga]. For this, he needs a loan of ₡500,000 (five hundred thousand Costa Rican colones) to buy the necessary supplies to plant these root crops. 

He hopes to take advantage of this season and increase his income, for the benefit of his family. 

Domingo is a member of the "La Danta" communal credit association, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to plant root crops.

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Yesenia Benita vive en su casa con sus 3 hijos juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de mercadería en general, ya que es una mujer muy emprendedora  y cuando tuvo sus hijos vio una buena oportunidad para establecer este negocio, que tantos logros le ha otorgado. Es onceavo crédito y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ella tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mayor cantidad de inventario como toallas, cosméticos, sabanas, ropa en general y calzado al por mayor pues no logra abastecer a sus clientes que le piden mayor variedad. Ya que se acerca la temporada del día de las madres.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita lives at home with her three children. Together they strive each day to get ahead. For the past 10 years, Yesenia has managed a business selling general merchandise. She is a very enterprising woman. Given her many other achievements, she saw a good opportunity to establish this business when she had her children.

Yesenia is receiving her eleventh loan and promises to submit her payments on time. She does not want to disappoint those who made this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of more inventory such as towels, cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and shoes in bulk. This will enable her to serve her customers since they request greater variety. In addition, she will have enough merchandise for Mother’s Day.

loans.use: to purchase towels, cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a business selling barbeque in the local community. Engaged in her enterprise for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting her eighth loan of 10000 PHP to purchase bananas and meat and other ingredients for her business. Marife plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and meat and other ingredients for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is married with seven children. Felisa is 61 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Felisa sells different kinds of products for her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store.
Felisa has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en:
Kelly is a 26-year-old, married woman with a three-year-old child. She operates a food stall to earn a living. She has been operating the business for only one year. She previously sold clothes. Kelly also depends on her husband, who is employed, for financial support.  

She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested for 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes and cooking fat for preparing chips.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat and potatoes for preparing chips.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man with three children; two attend school while one is still young for school. Elijah lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 6 years, he has operated a clothing business, selling from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His primary dream is to expand his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin, es una persona responsable cuenta con un pequeño SNACK  en Ivirgarzama, es soltero y no tiene hijos, pero cuenta con tres hermanos a los cales el ayuda y apoya en su educación, el se vino de La Paz hace como unos 10 años con su familia, empezó como albañil, jornalero, etc., poco a poco el empezó ahorrar dinero para poder tener su propio negocio, hoy en dia en cuenta con un SNACK que es uno de los mas concurridos en la localidad.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo cuyo destino será el ampliado de su SNACK y así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a la gente del lugar y por defecto mejorar sus ingresos  su calidad de vida de el y sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Edwin is a responsible person who has a small snack bar in Ivirgarzama.  He is single and does not have children, but he has three siblings.  He helps them out and supports their education.  He came from La Paz 10 years ago with his family; he started as a bricklayer and construction day worker.  Gradually, he saved money so that he could have his own business.  Now he has a snack bar that is one of the busiest in the area.

This is the first time that he has gotten a loan.  He will use the proceeds to expand his snack bar and in this way provide better service to the people of the area, and as a byproduct, improve his income and the quality of life of himself and his siblings.

loans.use: to expand his post selling fast food and snacks

loans.name: Marcial Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Marcial tiene 45 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio trabaja como personal administrativo en una institución pública, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para comprar una laptop, el socio irá pagando con el pago de sus honorarios mes a mes el crédito que se le otorgara para lo cual el solicita el préstamo en esta oportunidad. El socio solicita e préstamo para la compra de sus laptop para poder mejorar su trabajo y tener sus informes a tiempo. 

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Marcial is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old and single. Marcial works as a human resources manager at a public institution. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer so that he can process the monthly payroll. This is why he is requesting a loan at this time. By purchasing a laptop computer with this loan, he will be able to improve his work and have his reports ready on time.

Marcial is grateful for the support being provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for his job.

loans.name: Khea

texts.en: Mrs. Khea, age 45, is married to Meth and has six children who live under her income. Khea has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her parents when she was young. Taking time from this business, Khea is a pig raiser also. From these businesses, she earns approximately $2 each day. According to the rainy season and the lack of money, she would like to request some funds. These funds will be used to purchase fertilizers, seed and other materials for supporting her business. This is the seventh cycle that Khea is borrowing from HKL and the first cycle from Kiva. She said that this loan is very useful for her life and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and other materials.

loans.name: Mirian Katiana

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mirian, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 6 y 4 años, los dos mayores estudian  en colegio y los menores en escuela y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es Ing. Eléctrico.

Nuestra amiga es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja cinco  días a la semana de una a dos horas diarias y en los momentos que está desocupada ya que no tiene un horario fijo. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene ocho  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén de repuestos de carro.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente the communal bank 1 de Diciembre (December 1st) meets bimonthly.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists as well as offering a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of local cuisine.  

Here we meet Señora Mirian who is 36 years old and has young children in school and kindergarten.  Her husband is an electrical engineer.  She is a great homemaker who brings in her own income selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women).  She sells door to door and works 5 days a week for one to two hours daily and also when she is not busy as she doesn't have a fixed schedule.  She sells her products on credit and charges weekly.  She has been doing this for eight years and things are going well.  She tells us that she mostly sells perfumes since they are very good.  

With the loan she will buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the easy payment terms.  
 
Her dream is to have a warehouse for spare car parts.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 10 children. 

Alan has a corn field and vegetable garden that allows him to sell corn grains and vegetables in due time. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for the corn field and vegetable garden.

Alan is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field and vegetable garden.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de León, el señor José Esteban se dedica arduamente a la actividad educativa con 18 años de laborar en esta área. Es soltero y convive con su mamá a quien tiene que proporcionarles condiciones necesarias para el mejor nivel de vida.

Una de las necesidades que el señor José atraviesa  hoy en día, es que debe mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda debido a que  esta en mal estado y la época del invierno  le afecta más por las lluvias, por lo que ha tomando la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora, es por ese motivo que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de material de construcción como zinc, para iniciar las mejora de la vivienda  realizando el cambio de techo para mayor seguridad de la vivienda , por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su mamá.
texts.en:
In Quezalguaque municipality, in León department, José Esteban works in the field of education.  He is currently a Ministry of Education delegate and has been working in this post for 18 years.  He is single and lives with his mom who he has to provide with the necessary conditions to enjoy a better quality of life.

One of the needs that José has right now is to improve the condition of his home as it is in a bad state of repair and the winter season affects him more because of the rain.  He has taken the wise decision to begin some improvement work and has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction supplies such as metal sheets, so that he can start improving his home, replacing his roof in order to make his home safer.  By carrying out this work, he will be able to provide his mom with better living conditions.  It is important to point out that by carrying out this work, José will be providing his family with a decent home.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal to improve his roof

loans.name: Mayra Veronica

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 28 años es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive con su familia en Machachi que está ubicado a 1 hora de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro del Ecuador. Mayra es una persona tranquila con el caracter fuerte para salir adelante con su esposo e hijos.

Mayra trabaja con su esposo en la crianza y venta de cerdos. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el cual va a ser invertido en la compra de una chancha madre para hacerla reproducir, gracias a esta actividad podrá incrementar la cantidad de cerdos y después de criarlos podrá tener más ventas y mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.

Su sueño es llegar a tener 100 cerdos para convertirse en una proveedora a las empresas importantes.
texts.en:
Mayra is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in Machachi, which is located an hour away from Latacunga in the central mountains of Ecuador. Mayra is a peaceful individual with strong character. She wants to move forward along with her husband and children.

Mayra and her husband work together raising and selling pigs. This is the first loan she has requested from FODEMI and she will invest in the purchase of a sow for breeding. Thanks to her business, she will be able to increase the number of pigs she has on hand. Once they are grown, she wants to generate more sales and improve the income for herself and her family.

Mayra’s dream is to have 100 pigs so that she can become a supplier to large businesses.

loans.use: to buy a sow for breeding.

loans.name: Aturanagyayo Association Group

texts.en: William is a 42-year-old Ugandan male who needs a loan to buy sugar for resale. The retail shop owner hails from the Kyenjojo district and is a father of four children, aged between eight and twenty-four. Having had this business for two years, he dreams of growing his business into a wholesale business and educating his children. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other access to a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Gabriela le está haciendo falta el techo en dos cuarto, desean colocarla de concreto ya que es mas segura y doradora. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento, varilla, arena y pagarles a las personas que se encargara de elaborar la losa. 
Dona Gabriela se dedica al cuidado y intención de sus dos hijos y de su esposo el señor José Luis.  Quien se encargas de los gastos familiares y escolares Don José Luis con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como supervisor de una compañía. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y que el patrimonio este en buenas condiciones y seguro para ellos.
texts.en:
Gabriela's household needs a roof for two rooms. They want it to be made of concrete as it is safer and durable. She is requesting a loan to buy the following materials: concrete, rods and sand as well as paying the workers charged with making the flagstones. 

Gabriela takes care of her two children. Her husband José Luis, with his salary as a company supervisor, is in charge of the family's expenses and education. They wish to improve their children's quality of life and have their estate in good and safe conditions for them.

loans.use: to install concrete flagstones in two rooms.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Nang is 32 and married. She resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Nang and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Nang is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to repair her house. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income.This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last 20 years, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells dried fish and squid. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Marta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and squid to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with three children. She has earned a living raising pigs for the past five years. In addition, she also makes money selling vegetables.

Susan is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang (pictured above) is a scarf weaver, while her husband, Ros is a construction worker. They have been married since 1979 and have three sons and four daughters. Five of the children are married and live outside the family home and the other two are garment workers. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ang is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 in order to purchase weaving materials (cotton threads) for her scarf weaving business. She will also use a part of the loan to set up one more loom.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials (cotton threads) for her scarf weaving business and set up one more loom.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a housewife and a mother of 10 children. She and her husband live in a refugee camp and she helps her husband, who is a blacksmith, in running a small workshop they own.

Since they are living a hard life trying to provide for their large family, Samira has applied in hope to get a loan to be able to help her husband expand his workshop and also help with the household expenses since he is the only provider for the family.

Because Samira is a conservative person, her son Samer has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his workshop and also help with the household expenses since he is the only provider for the family.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 22 years old, single, and has one child. She has been running a cereals retail stall for the last two years, earning a monthly income of 12,050 KES.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET ltd. of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more cereals such as maize and beans. She will save the anticipated profits to increase her inventory levels. 

Her hopes and dreams are to diversify into farming and to grow her cereal retail business.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
El señor José, de 65 años de edad, es soltero vive en su casa con sus 4 hijos y dos nietos, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de Refrescos al por mayor y detalle además cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos que son dos molinos ubicados uno en su casa y otro en amapala, El vive en una comunidad de coyolito amapala al sur de Honduras.
Don Jose esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar Refrescos, jugos y reparar el motor de uno de los molinos, con  el préstamo pretende seguir trabajando y mejorando su condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y aumentar más su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Refrescos, jugos y reparar el motor de uno de los molinos para su negocio

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en: Abdumalik has a kind heart. He works hard during 20 year to provide his family with good living condition. Abdumalik has been busy with animal husbandry. He feeds cows. He sells milk to local people as he feeds milk cows. He grows cattle feed in his own land. He also has an income from growing agricultural products. He is a repeated client of IMON and makes payment on time. Now, he is going to increase working capital. Abdumalik is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Miwononvi 2 Group

texts.fr: MIWONONVI 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Goussi Louise (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Goussi Louise a un enfant, scolarisé et à sa charge du couple. Goussi Louise vit seule avec son enfant. Goussi Louise assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis dix ans environ, Goussi Louise vend des produits de quincaillerie dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Goussi Louise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Goussi Louise et les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI 2 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de quincaillerie.

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MOUGNOU ont en moyenne 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et vente des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe MOUGNOU sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. MAH, 1ère femme debout à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3Kgs de poivre, 25Kgs de sel, 4 paquets de Cube Maggi, 25Kgs d’oignon, 2Kgs de piment, 5 boîtes de tomate concentré, 2Kgs de potasse et 20Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat  des condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase computers for sell to Schools and computer accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her hair-dressing salon

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda is a very optimistic and hard working woman. She is married and has two small kids aged 2 and 8.

The lack of employment in the country made it hard for her husband to find a job for a long time, in which debt started to accumulate. In order to stop the crisis Arminda decided to begin selling shoes. Fortunately she's done well. The business allows her to take care of her children and her home since she can do it from her house. Her main clientèle are family and friends.

In order to obtain greater earnings from her products, Arminda needs to buy wholesale and for that she requires a loan of only $150. She already has many orders and with this amount she can supply them at a lower cost. She and her family thank your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Arminda es una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, la falta de empleo del país provocó que su esposo no consiguiera un trabajo durante un largo periodo, en que se fueron acumulando las deudas y para poder salir de esta crisis Arminda decidió empezar a trabajar con la venta de calzado, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en el negocio, esta labor le permite estar al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar porque puede realizar esta tarea desde su casa, sus principales clientes son familiares y amigos.

Para obtener mejores ganancias de sus productos, Arminda necesita comprar a mayoreo y para esto requiere de un préstamo de solo $ 150 dólares, ya tiene muchos pedidos y con esta cantidad podrá surtirlos a un precio más bajo. Ella y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana is 38 years old, single with two children ages 16 and 19. They are all originally from Tampico, Tamaulipas. She never had the support of a spouse to help raise her children so she has had to work very hard to earn enough to meet their needs. Since her first child was born Juana has sold cosmetics part time in addition to her full-time job at a local company. Given her situation, and the difficulties she had to meet the family expenses, her children left their studies to begin to work. But Juana wants them to continue with their education, so she has started selling clothing and shoes to earn more money.

In order to grow her business and support her children, Juana needs a loan of US$925 to purchase merchandise. She travels to the city of Moroleón in Guanajuato to purchase goods at wholesale prices, which will help to increase her profitability. She commits to repay the loan within 6 months. Now is the time to help someone who most needs it. Decide to support this family who sincerely appreciates your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Juana tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 19 años de edad, ellos son originarios de la ciudad de Tampico, Tamaulipas. Ella nunca ha tenido el apoyo de su pareja para sostener a sus hijos por lo que ella ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para obtener los recursos que necesitan, desde que nació su primer hijo Juana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sus tiempos libres porque también estaba empleada en una empresa. Ante la situación en la que se encontraba y la dificultad que tenía para poder cubrir sus deudas, sus hijos abandonaron sus estudios y comenzaron a trabajar, pero Juana desea que ellos puedan continuar estudiando para esto ha incorporado la venta de ropa y calzado con lo que está obteniendo mejores resultados.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos, Juana necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella viaja a la ciudad de Moroleón en Guanajuato donde puede conseguir precios de fábrica, con lo que incrementa sus ganancias, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar es esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Catharine

texts.en: Mrs Catharine E. sells wooden combs to people in her community. She is 54 years of age, married, and mother of 7 children. She is the secretary of her union in LAPO. She needs the loan amount of $625 to boost her business, which she started 2002.

loans.use: To buy more for sales

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard K. is 26, single and takes care of three orphaned children. He has a strong entrepreneurial spirit. He owns a retail shop, is a property broker, and has a boda-boda business. Boda-boda are motorbikes, and the streets of Kampala are filled with matatoos (taxi vans) and boda-bodas. The word boda-boda comes from motorbikes that take people to the border, drop them off and another motorbike picks them up once they crossed the border, hence boda-boda. Plus it’s fun to say.

Richard has had his business for five years and has been with his lending group for three years. He will use his loan to buy some much needed parts for his boda-boda. He is very energetic and one day he hopes to his business will be successful enough to enable him to marry.

loans.use: To buy  parts for his boda boda

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en:
Rafiga is a 25-year-old with three years of experience in the farming business. She is single and lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region.

Rafiga requests a loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has a small business selling clothing items and footwear from her little outdoor market kiosk in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Tatyana, who is single, has had her business for about six years. She makes enough to support herself plus a little extra to help her two grown children. Her daughter recently got married and incurred some of the costs typically associated with weddings. Ukrainian weddings sometimes have celebrations lasting up to two days so they can be quite expensive.

Tatyana is a determined entrepreneur who would like to continue developing and growing her business. She has requested a six-month loan of $1000 to help purchase new inventory items so she can continue offering her customers attractive clothing and make good sales.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her clothing kiosk

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 38 year old Eliza S.. She is married with four children, aged between 10 and 23. In 1999, Eliza established a soap and crops selling business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en: Nazih is a 40-year-old father of 6 children. He lives and works in Bekaa, Lebanon. Nazih sells home products. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, Nazih would like to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sustain and develop his business

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara is forty years old and a widow with four children. She has been selling tomatoes, tilapia, onions, eggs, spices and maize for five years now. She has low working capital and sells from a table top.

Ajara wants to use her new loan to buy bags of maize, crates of eggs, crates of tomatoes and some spices to avoid price hikes during the lean season. She also wants to buy more tubers of fresh yams from the northern part of Ghana since she has run out of stock.

Ajara is a member of the group called Gold. The members use peer pressure to ensure repayment of the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more foods for sale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Edith M.. She is not married and has 3 blessed children aged 5,10 and 15. She has 5 more dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2003, Edith established her genge business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot, icky dough, made from maize flour), a plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more stock ni bulk.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, 40, is separated from her partner. She has three children, one in elementary school, one in high school and one working and independent. All live in the city of Caaguazu.

Julia started her small "copetin" (snackbar or food-selling shop) around 1992 and later decided to take a course to learn to make confectioneries, something that led to added growth for her business, especially from the sale of "flores de azucar" ("sugar flowers", a local confectionery). She now works with supermarkets in the city and even other cities.

Julia's fondest wish is that her children finish their studies and become successful professionals. She hopes that the change of government (in Paraguay) will bring more security, more jobs and greater justice.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Julia V. de 40 años de edad, quien actualmente esta separada de su conyuge, tiene tres hijos, una va a la escuela, la otra al colegio, y el mayor de ellos ya es profecional independiente, todos viven en la ciudad de Caaguazú.

Ña Julia comenzó con un pequeño copetin aproximadamente en el año 1.992, tiempo despúes se decidió a estudiar un curso de confiteria, con la que hizo crecer su negocio, en especial con la venta de Flores de Azucar, actualmente trabaja con supermercados de la ciudad e incluso con los de otra ciudad.

Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios y sean profecionales exitosos. Ella espera que con este cambio de gobierno que haya mas seguridad, fuente de trabajo y justicia.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients for bakery business.

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Mrs. Poy D., 44, lives in Kraing Sromo Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she is a dessert-seller and farmer. Her farming earns only a small revenue because she owns only a small field. To increase her income, she is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land upon which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ol Eth, rents loudspeakers to villagers for their parties and ceremonies.

Mrs. Poy D. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a dessert-seller while another is a subsistence farmer. The remaining one is attending the local school. Previously, Mrs. Poy D. obtained a loan to buy loudspeakers for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Kety Yulia

texts.es:
Kety is a hard-working and fighting woman. She is 27 years old and, alongside her husband, works in their own business selling construction materials such as sand and stone. With the passing of time -- already two years -- they have been able to grow significantly. Since a young girl, she occupied herself with agricultural work. However, due to her small daughter's education needs, she had to move to the zone in which they now live. She frequently returns to her village to her farmland, where she sows potatoes and raises animals, leaving it to the care of other people. For the future, her wish is to obtain a truck, for which she is saving. In order to add to the required amount, Kety is requesting this loan to increase her stock and sales earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Kety es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, tiene 27 años y junto a su esposo trabajan en un negocio propio, la venta de agregados, tales como arena y piedras que son materiales de construcción. Con el tiempo transcurrido, que son ya 2 años, han podido crecer significativamente. De niña se ocupó en las actividades agrícolas, pero por motivos de estudio de su pequeña hija tuvo que migrar a la zona donde actualmente radica. Frecuentemente regresa a su pueblo para sus tierras de cultivo, donde siembra papa y cría animales, dejando esto al cuidado de otras personas.Para el futuro su deseo es obtener un camión de carga, para ello, está ahorrado, para ir sumando el monto necesario Kety solicita el presente préstamo para incrementar la cantidad de su material y aumentar sus ganancias de venta.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of construction materials that she sells so she may purchase a truck in the future.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith I. lives in Iyano-era, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and married with four children. Edith sells clothing and undergarments in her shop. She is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more clothing and jewelry to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es natural del Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno. Tiene 51 años de edad, sólo estudió primero de primaria, es casada y madre de 06 hijos, de los cuales 04 tienen su pareja y 02 son solteros.

Desde el año 2002 es socia del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado de Acari, Yunguyo. Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa (casacas, buzos, conjunto y Jeans), compra en la ciudad de Desaguadero y vende en la ciudad de Ilo, tanto al por mayor como al por menor. Paralelo a este negocio lleva, papa, chuño, oca y haba a la ciudad de Ilo.

Doña Margarita manifiesta que a los 13 años quedó huérfana de padre y junto  a su madre se apoyan para seguir adelante. A los 20 años de edad empezó a dedicarse al negocio, vendía pan y pescado en el mismo Centro Poblado de Acari.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará mercadería (casacas, conjuntos para niños, etc.).

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilo e instalar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Margarita is a native of Centro Poblado de Acari, Yunguyo. She is 51 years old and only had one year of school. She's married with six children, four of whom are married and two who are single. Since 2002, she has been a member of the "Faith and Joy" Community Bank in her hometown. She makes a living selling clothes (frock coats, sweatshirts, outfits and jenas), which she buys in the city of Desaguadero and sells in the city of Ilo, both at wholesale and retail. Along with this business she also takes potatoes, potato flour and beans to Ilo. She started in commerce at age 20, selling bread and fish in her hometown. With this loan, which she plans to repay in three months, she will purchase supplies (frock coats, children's outfits, etc.). Her dream is to buy a house in Ilo and set up a convenience store there.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies (frock coats, children's outfits, etc.)

loans.name: Halim

texts.en: Halim D. is married and has three children.  While his wife works as a teacher at the local high school, Halim raises livestock and sells them for a profit.  He currently has two cows, and is hoping to fatten them through the winter and resell them in the spring.  In order to purchase the necessary forage and hay for his cows and further expand his business, Halim is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To purchase forage and hay for cattle.

loans.name: Zuhrija

texts.en:
Zuhrija was born in 1952 and she lives in a suburb of Bratonac in Bosnia. She is married, and she works with her retired husband to grow vegetables and raise cows and chickens. Zuhrija requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy poultry and a calf, to expand their business and generate additional income for her family. At this point she is earning just enough money to meet her basic needs.

This loan is guaranteed by Zumra Bajrić.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a calf

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. is a trader; she sells firewood and charcoal at Iture near Elmina. She is divorced and has five dependents. She has been in this business since 2006.

Araba will use the money from her loan to buy more goods to sell. She will use her profits to expand her business and increase her income to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Tsévié dans la préfecture du Zio, Mme Afi B. est revendeuse de médicaments génériques et de pommades dans le village de Gapé Centre. Elle est mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle a entrepris la vente de médicaments génériques avec peu de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite un crédit pour ouvrir une petite pharmacie dans le village afin de mieux protéger ses produits et s’approvisionner suffisamment en médicaments auprès de la CAMEG (Centrale d’Achat des Médicaments Essentiels et Génériques). Ce financement va lui permettre de répondre aux besoins en médicaments des populations et d’augmenter ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi B. was born in 1969 in Tsévié in the prefecture of Zio. She is a retailer of generic medicines and ointments in the village of Gapé Centre. She is the mother of seven children. She started selling generic medicines with very little financial means. She is requesting a loan to open a small pharmacy in the village.This will allow her to better protect her products, and to stock up on enough medicines at the CAMEG (Central Purchasing Agency of Basic and Generic Medicines). This financing will allow her to meet the population's needs in medicines, and increase her profit.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of basic and generic medicines

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion B. is a vinegar and soy sauce manufacturer in the village of Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. This is a business initiated by her daughter, who has just gotten married. She continues the business to earn additional income aside from farming to sustain her family's needs.

Concepcion is 55 years old and married to Juanito Basili, a farmer who was formerly a community councilor. They have six children: Nick is 35 years old, married, and a high school graduate; Nedy is 31 years old, married, and a college graduate; Novie is 30 years old, also married, and a computer engineering graduate; Nomar is 27 years old and a college graduate too; Nida is 25 years old and the only one who did not finish college; and the youngest, Norie Ann, is 21 years old and in the fourth year of college.

Concepcion is proud that their children are now enjoying a good life despite the hardships the family has encountered, especially during the time when all her children were still studying. Concepcion is not selfish so she did not prevent her children from marrying, reasoning that they are educated enough to decide what they need to do or not do.

Now, Concepcion still strives to support her youngest child in finishing her last year in college. She hopes to increase her daily income from her vinegar and soy sauce manufacturing and vending business in order to sustain their family's needs. Thus, she hopes to get a loan of $150, which will serve as her additional capital. She also wishes to attend trainings in the future to improve her business. These include product development, packaging and labeling, since she is not using any business name yet.

loans.use: Expand her vinegar and soy sauce manufacturing and vending business

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: Christine N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is in her late 40s and a mother of 9 children; only 4 are still in school. Christine has a business selling fish where she buys dry fish from the surrounding landing sites of Senyi and Kiyindi at a lower price and sells to her customers in Ajjija as well as to those in Buikwe and Lugazi. She has been in the business for over 5 years and she is happy that the business is paying. She has also been able to acquire 2 cows and 2 goats, with the cows giving her milk for sale. Christine needs a loan to help with buying more fish for sale.

loans.use: More fish for selling.

loans.name: Pir

texts.ru: Шарипов Пир житель района Бохтар.Возраст 45 лет, женат и имеет десятерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. Опыт в бизнесе уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
