Pir S. lives in Bohtar. He is 45 years old, married, and has ten children. He has a high school education. He sells household goods. He has eight years experience in business. He plans to take out a loan to increase his sales. He can pay off the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improve the selection of goods

loans.name: Olga Amparo

texts.es: olga Amparo H. se dedica al comercio, ella vende pan casero y rosquillas las cuales son muy buscadas por los clientes ya que el sabor de las mismas son muy buenos y lo mas importante higienicas,  ella tiene 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y tiene 2 hijas que dependen de ella al 100% las cuales dos cursan la secundaria en un colegio publico de esta localidad, gracias a su negocio logra salir con todos los gastos del hogar, pero ella necesita vender mas para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas, su esposo se dedica a la caficultura ya que este lugar es apto para la siembra de cafe por las montañas y el clima fresco, eso hace que el grano que se produce sea sabroso y aromatico.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Amparo H. sells homemade bread. The sweet bread she makes is very popular with her clients both because it is very tasty and because it is made under sanitary conditions. She has done this for 16 years. She has two daughters, both of whom depend entirely upon her. They are in middle school at a public school in the area. Thanks to her business she can pay all of her household expenses; in order to provide her children with a higher quality of life, however, she must make more profit. Her husband sells coffee beans because the area is well-suited to their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for bread

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Mme A. Bintou est née en 1961. Mariée et mère de huit (08) enfants, elle exerce le commerce de la vente de maïs. Elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du maïs pendant la période d’abondance et le revendre en période de soudure. Les revenus pourront lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Bintou was born in 1961. She is married and the mother of eight. She does commerce in corn and is requesting financing to stock up on corn when abundant and to sell when scarce. The revenues will enable her to improve the family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and to sell corn

loans.name: Ellen Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ellen Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, vive en el Jr. Gregorio Delgado Nº 481, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos, todos que aun dependen D. ella. 

Por su capacidad y experiencia en el negocio, al que ya viene dedicándose durante muchos años, dado a su perseverancia fue incrementando  poco a poco sus productos haciéndose  muy conocida en el mercado. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio D. venta D. artículos D. oficina, que se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa donD. atienD. a sus clientes fijos que viven en el barrio y amigos conocidos.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará más productos para su stock como archivadores, cuadernos, lápices, borradores lapiceros, plumones, engrapadores, clips, tampones, gomas y lápices colores.

Ellen Rosario tiene un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que  Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ellen Rosario belongs to the Virgen D. la Inmaclada community bank. She lives at Jr. Gregorio Delgado Nº 481, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 46, married, and has three dependent children. Due to her business capacity, her many years of experience, and her perseverance; she was able to, little by little, get more products and make herself well known in the market. She currently has the same business of selling office supplies. The business is located in her own home, where she waits on her regular customers who live in the neighborhood and are well known friends. With the loan of 1,500 PEN she will stock more products like file folders, notebooks, pencils, erasers, ball point pens, felt tip pens, staplers, paperclips, ink pads, rubber bands, and colored pencils. Ellen Rosario has a charisma for selling to customers. She says that the organization Movimiento Manuela Ramos helps women develop and progress with the same opportunity as men.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more office supplies for her stock (ball point pens, file folders, felt tip pens, etc.)

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Yuri es padre soltero, tiene 41 años y vive con su querido hijo Ángel de 11 años en la casa de sus familiares, trabaja muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde muy temprano lleva su mercadería hasta la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se hacen ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca) donde la vende de manera ambulatoria. A Yuri le gusta mucho vender ropa y ganar dinero, con el cual pueda cuidar a su hijo, anhela poner una tienda grande donde pueda vender prendas variadas y accesibles para sus clientes. Para él trasladar su mercadería hasta el lugar de venta es lo más difícil de su trabajo, ya que siempre lleva gran cantidad. Tiene 10 años en este negocio y lo que más quiere es brindarle a su hijo unos buenos estudios, para que sea un buen profesional. Es el segundo préstamo de Yuri con MFP, no quiere fallar en el pago de sus cuotas, porque sabe que eso le traería problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es uno de los socios más antiguos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de prendas para elegir.
texts.en:
Yuri is a single father. He is 41 years old and lives with his beloved 11-year-old son Ángel in the home of his relatives. He works very hard to move up in life. Yuri makes a living selling clothing. From very early in the morning he takes his merchandise to the Explanada Laguna Temporal (where they have the flea markets in the city of Juliaca) where he sells his products outdoors. Yuri really enjoys selling clothes and making money, with which he can care for his son. His goal is to setup a big store where he can sell various and accessible garments to his customers. For him, the most difficult thing about his work is transferring his merchandise to his sales post because he's always taking a lot of items. He has 10 years experience in the business and what he wants most is to provide his son with a good education so he can grow up to be a good professional. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has never missed a payment, which he knows would present problems for his community bank, where he's one of the oldest members. With the 1500 soles he's requesting, he plans to purchase more clothing in order to offer his customers a wider selection of garments to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Adela Francisca

texts.es: Adela Francisca Sánchez García tiene la edad de 33 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio con este oficio por cuenta propia, por lo que anteriormente cuando su Papa estaba con vida, el se hacía cargo de los gastos de la familia, pero por debido a las circunstancias su Papa fallece por lo que su Mama empezó a trabajar como doméstica y ayudar junto con su hija a sacar a su familia adelante, ahora Adela se hace cargo todos los gastos de su familia. Y es así que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra tela, tijeras, hilos, alfileres entre otros. Sus sueños son de engrandecer su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Adela Francisca Sánchez García is a 33 year old single mother. She is raising two children. She is a seamstress, and she has worked at this business for more than 15 years. She started this work on her own. Previously, when her father was alive, he was in charge of the family expenses. But, due to the circumstances of her father’s death, her mother started working as a domestic employee. Her mother helped her to keep the family going. Now Adele is in charge of the family expenses. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy fabric, scissors, thread, and needles among other things. Her dreams are to expand her business in order to get better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is divorced with one adult son. She owns a kiosk at the market and sells women's bathrobes as well as bedsheets. Natalia has been in this business for eight years. During this time she has been able to attract many repeat clients. Natalia has worked hard to develop her business. She always offers good, quality products and has a good discount policy, which helps her business to be a stable source of income. Natalia would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase the assortment of items she sells. She hopes to use additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of items she sells

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a member of the KInanambo borrower group,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2children,Her children are aged 18,8 years.

Resty started her own clothing business selling clothes (fabric)like kanga na vitenge 8 years,she works 12 hours a day nad earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tsh .

This is Restly first loan from BRAC.She requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Resty hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: to buy more Kanga,Vitenge

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda D., 47, hails from the breezy town of Silang, Cavite, a couple of miles south of Manila. She has four children, all school-aged. Yolanda buys fruits and vegetables from farmers and traders then retails them to market buyers. She has been running this business for the last five years and earns a net income of P5,000 per month. She uses her profits to pay for her children’s education and to provide for her family’s basic daily needs. Yolanda joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been receiving blessings both spiritually and economically. She is now on her ninth loan with the cooperative. Yolanda needs a loan of P14,000 as additional capital for her fruits and vegetables business. She hopes to acquire her own vehicle soon to help her transport the fruits and vegetables. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette I. is 35 years old, is married with four children aged between 15 and 2 years, and she has three dependents. She lives in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Antoinette has owned a small shop for three years where she sells different kinds of merchandises as shown in the photo. She opens her shop everyday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Before requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company, Antoinette was not able to earn more profit to help her to get more food for her children and to satisfy all the needs of her family.

With this new loan she hopes to earn more profit so that she is able to provide more food for her family and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila G. D. C. D. 46 años, resiD. en Mejicanos junto a su esposo y su único hijo. Ella posee un comedor desD. hace un año en el cual prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Domitila solicita un préstamo por  medio del cual espera obtener el capital necesario para comprar mesas y sillas para sus clientes, así también desea comprar más productos para la elaboración D. comida. Domitila desea mejorar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que todo esto beneficiará a su familia y como toda buena madre desea lo mejor para su hijo.
texts.en:
Domitila G. D. C., 46, lives in Mejicanos with her husband and only son. For one year she has had a dining room where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Domitilia is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs for her customers. She also wants to buy more products for making meals. Domitila wants to improve her business and be able to get greater earnings. All of this will benefit her family. Like all good mothers, she wants the best for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is a Nairobi-based business person who runs a pharmacy in the pipeline area. She has been in this business for the last two years after leaving employment. Phoebe is requesting a loan of Kes 30,000 to add to her stock of medicines. She hopes to grow her business and open multiple outlets across Nairobi. She describes herself as determined and cooperative. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of medicines

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es: Agapito tiene 56 años de edad vive con su esposa e hijos que son jóvenes en su casa propia, Agapito junto a su esposa se dedican a la producción de mandiles, en este negocio tienen mucha experiencia y además de ser muy conocidos en el medio. Por otra parte, Agapito es músico en las fuerzas armadas y está en trámite para su jubilación anticipada.  La competencia es media ya que Agapito y su esposa entregan los productos a personas conocidas.  El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación, debido a que Agapito ha estado realizando construcciones en su casa por lo que se ha descapitalizado.  El comportamiento de Agapito es muy bueno ya que paga puntualmente  es su tercera secuencia, también trabaja con créditos institucionales. Finalmente, cabe mencionar que el cliente  ha demostrado durante este tiempo responsabilidad y buena fe pagos.
texts.en:
Agapito is 56 years old and lives in his own home, along with his wife and young children. Agapito and his wife make aprons. They are well known and are very experienced in this business. Agapito is also a musician in the armed forces and he is preparing for his retirement. They do not have much competition and Agapito and his wife deliver their goods to regular customers. This loan will be used as operating capital, as Agapito has had to make repairs to his home, which has depleted his savings. He has always been punctual in making payments, and this will be his third loan, also having worked with commercial lending institutions. He has always acted responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marvic

texts.en:
Marvic M. is from the town of Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 30 years old. Marvic is widowed and has 3 infant-aged children.

To make a living, Marvic operates a computer services business for local community members. Marvic also runs a t-shirt printing business.

Marvic joined HSPFI to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvic successfully repaid his first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI.which he invested in expanding his business.

Marvic is requesting his second loan from HSPFI, for 8000 PHP, to use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

loans.name: Lloid

texts.es:
La señora Lloid, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Unión y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Lloid, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Lloid, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Lloid is a member of the Union and Labor Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Departament of San Martín. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of two dependent children.

Lloid is a hardworking and determined woman who decided to start her own business selling soft drinks. Her store is located in her house, which is well-equipped for managing her business. She neither works on a set schedule nor reports directly to anyone. Lloid says her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy 5 packs of soda. She did very well, so she gradually invested in more merchandise. Lloid continues to manage her business to this day and is known among her customers who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she plans to buy packs of sodas of different flavors, sizes and brands. In addition, she will purchase both carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Lloid has many goals ahead of her and is motivated to achieve all of them. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing assistance when she needed it. She has been responsible with her loan payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Young Stars Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Young Stars' group. Members of the 'Young Stars' group are small-scale business people in the small town of Waterloo, very close to Freetown, the capital city. They are business people who want a loan in order to further expand their businesses.

Ibrahim S. T. in the middle of the photo is the group’s leader. Ibrahim was born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone, in 1974. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have three children. Ibrahim’s children are attending primary school – one in class five, another in class three, and the last in class two. For more than ten years now, Ibrahim has been a businessman. He sells cigarettes, mints, chewing gum, Vaseline, toothpaste, cosmetics, bottled water, and so on in a kiosk. He also sells firewood and charcoal. With his share of this loan, Ibrahim is going to buy a half carton of cigarettes and with the remainder of the loan, he will buy piles of firewood. A carton of cigarettes cost SLL 450,000 and a pile of firewood costs SLL 4,000.

loans.use: Buy half carton of cigarettes and piles of firewood

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y a la producción de leche  que comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive en la comunidad de Tipampa  sector Achacachi de Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y su hijo menor el cual esta en últimos años en edad escolar  quien también colabora  en los trabajos del cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Victor earns his living raising cows and producing milk that he sells to Pil Andina, an industrialized milk plant. He lives in the community of Tipampa in the Achacachi sector of the Omasuyos province, part of the La Paz region of Bolivia, four hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and his youngest son, who is still school age and helps his father take care of the livestock. Victor will use the loan to buy livestock of higher quality breeding, as a way to increase his milk production and as a result, his earnings. This is Victor's second loan with Impro. A credit evaluation qualified him for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow in order to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Juana Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  Juliana R. S., labora como recepcionista de commema central, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los nueve créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
 Ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos dos de estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de varias láminas de zinc para su casa de habitación, con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
Juana dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Juana Juliana R. S. is a receptionist and has worked with Ceprodel for six years. In this time, she has improved her living conditions through nine loans she has borrowed from Ceprodel. She is married and has four children, two of whom are school-aged. This loan is for the purchase of various zinc sheets for her home, which will provide a better lifestyle for her children, who require the support of their parents. Juana gives thanks for the loans from Ceprodel, as her home has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en:
Olabisi is 41years old, married and has four children. Her husband produces cellophane bags to support his home (cellophane is a thin, transparent sheet made of regenerated cellulose and used for food packaging).

Olabisi sells plastics in Lagos State, Nigeria. She also has a shop where she sells frozen foods like beef, chicken and fish. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Olabisi is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Olabisi says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Olabisi is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Jimoh

texts.en: K. is excited to take her loan with LAPO. She sells sarongs, cream and clothes. She hopes for a loan of 140,000 NGN that she will invest in her clothes business. She will buy in bulk to get a better price. K. hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support. K. is 40 years old and married with five children who are doing well in school.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and clothing in bulk

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Florida está conformado por tres personas emprendedoras, trabajadoras y luchadoras una de ellas es Aracely del Carmen M. Martínez quien se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra con lo cual le proporciono estudios a sus tres hijos que son profesionales. Ella invertira el credito en ampliar el negocio e invertir en mayores productos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Rosa Argentina López la cual tiene un pequeño taller de calzado y Pablo Antonio R. C. quien vende productos Avon pero sueño de el llegar a tener una tienda de ropa deportiva. Ellos invertirán  en sus respectivos negocios para ampliarlos.
texts.en:
The Florida group is made up of three, hard-working, enterprising and tenacious people. One of them is Aracely del Carmen M. Martínez, who buys scrap for resale. This work made it possible for her to educate her three children, who are now all professionals. The other group members are: Rosa Argentina López, who has a small shoe repair shop and Pablo Antonio R. C., who sells Avon products but who dreams with having a sports clothing store. They will invest in their respective businesses in order to expand them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scrap.

loans.name: Bebelie

texts.en: Bebelie Fulon is 28 years old and lives Norala, South Cotabato. She and her husband Dario have one child aged three. She joined CEVI for financial assistance to improve her business in farming and retail. Her loan will be used to buy the needed goods to sell at retail, fertilizers, and e-load — pre-paid cell phone units.

loans.use: Buying goods for her farm and her store

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas N. is 52 years old and has owned a plot of farm land since 1999. There she grows all types of crops, which she plants twice a year. Meas N. is a good mother of four children, one of whom lives with her and the other three are married and have already started new homes. All four of her children are employed in different jobs. Meas N. is married to Mr. Oeun, 57, who assists her on the farm. Meas N. has been planning to buy a vehicle for the family’s traveling needs, but she does not have enough money to buy one. She is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorbike to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som R., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is employed at a zoo in the province, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family's expenses. R. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children's studies. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R. is pictured with her husband here.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 43 years old and married to a businesswoman. They are blessed with five children.  For the past twenty years, he has been doing tailoring to earn a living.  He mainly makes trousers and shorts to sell.  He uses his income to pay his one employee and to support his family.  

He is in the Dafulos group in Faulu Kenya where he saves part of his income weekly.  Through this, he has been able to invest in his business and stabilize it.  He is also able to pay school fees for his four school-going children.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With this loan, he wants to buy an overlock (serger) machine and buy fabric for making clothes.  He hopes to open up another shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine and fabric

loans.name: Kisakye Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
A firm belief that she cannot fail in any business undertaking has always been 33-year-old S. Cissy’s winning trump card. With this kind of attribute and self-worth, this married mother of two has won her spurs in her retail shop enterprise, which she has operated for the past four years in Kafunta, Lugazi.

The business experience Cissy wields began with a two-year farming business that she later dispensed with. Since then the retail business has been her invaluable and settled means of subsistence. Her place of vantage in this business has been made doubly sure over the last four years by her good customer relationship skills.

Cissy’s future prospects are very rosy. She has made profitable use of her time spent operating her business. In a month, she reveals, she makes profits totaling up to 250,000 shillings. She also ekes out other side profits operating a taxi.

With this loan, Cissy wants to purchase more retail items for her shop like soap, sugar and salt.

loans.use: The purchase of more items for her store like sugar, soap, cooking oil and rice

loans.name: Abed El Hussein

texts.en:
Abed El Hussein is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and their child in Lebanon.

Abed El Hussein has been selling plastic, nylon, plates, spoons, forks, knives and other types of dishes. He has been in this business since 2007. He believes that his honesty and experience working in the field of sales has helped him distinguish himself. His customers are people from his region and its surroundings.

When he first opened his shop, Abed El Hussein had difficulty purchasing the necessary merchandise to sell and that is why he took a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Today, for the second time, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a new collection dishes to sell. He hopes to continue improving his work in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection dishes to sell

loans.name: Martin Ramón

texts.es:
Martin Ramón D. L. P. tiene una gran familia conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos D. 22 a 40 años. Él es propietario D. un negocio, en un interior D. un centro comercial muy popular, en L. zona central D. BarranquilL., donD. se encuentra D. todo lo relacionado con los celulares en todas las marcas, desD. los más antiguos hasta los más modernos, así como accesorios y centros D. reparación D. estos mismos; es allí  donD. Martin tiene un puesto D. venta D. celulares y diversos accesorios relacionados con esta línea;  él Inició su vida como comerciante vendiendo cigarrillos, luego comercializando víveres  que traía D. Maicao, un municipio del departamento D. L. Guajira al norte D. Colombia; como se encontraba en el espacio púbico, fuè reubicado en este  amplio centro comercial donD. hoy se encuentra y ahí decidió vender hielo al por mayor y refrescos, pero luego enfermó y   con otro amigo  se dedicó   a vender celulares y gradualmente le metió accesorios como porta celulares, carcasas y otros detalles. 
Martin tiene 8 años D. estar en los programas D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  quien lo ha financiado para  L. compra D. activos fijos y para invertir en capital D. trabajo; y desD. entonces su negocio está más elegante y genera más ingresos porque se ha posicionado en estas instalaciones. En L. actualidad solicita a esta organizaciòn un credito para comprar nuevos estilos D. celulares y modernizar L. linea D. ellos con actuales modelos que han salido al mercado.
Su sueño en este momento es capitalizar su negocio y tener variedad D. mercancías  para competir con L. diversidad, teniendo lo que el cliente necesite y le guste y sobre todo lo más moderno que aparezca el mercado, por eso debe estar constantemente inyectándole capital D. trabajo a su negocio. También sueña con disfrutar más D. sus nietos y es un propósito que se ha trazado y que le genera mucha felicidad.
texts.en:
Martin Ramón D. L. P. has a large family that consists of his wife and 3 children ranging in age from 22 to 40 years old. He owns a business, insiD. a very popular mall in central BarranquilL., where he deals in everything related to cell phones of all kinds from the oldest to the most recent, as well as accessories and service centers. He has a stall here where he sells cell phones and different cell phone accessories. He started as a businessman selling cigarettes, then selling food brought in from Maicao, a city in the Department of Guajira in northern Colombia. Since he found a public space he relocated to this large shopping center and here he decided to sell soft drinks and ice wholesale. He eventually became tired of this, and along with another friend, he decided to sell cell phones and gradually, he introduced accessories like cell phone holders, cases and other items. Martin has been in the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo programs for 8 years now and they have given him loans for the purchase of fixed assets and to invest in working capital. Since then his business has become more chic and generates more income because of his place in the shopping center. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy new styles of cell phones and to update the line with the current models that have flooded the market. Right now his desire is to grow his business and have a variety of merchandise in order to compete by having what his customers need and want and above all, to have the most up-to-date merchandise in the market. For this reason he wants to keep investing money into his business. Also, he plans to enjoy his grandchildren more as this makes him very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new styles of cell phones and to update his line with the current models

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch C. is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tosontsengel, a city of Zavhan province, western Mongolia. His wife operates a clothing sewing business and his elder son works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia while the youngest son attends a local middle school. The family has been living in their current home for 22 years. Banzragch makes iron items in his own shop near the family home. He started this business in 1995 and has since made quality products for the people of his province. He has found out the advantage of his business is that there are very few people in his province operating an ironsmith business supplying local citizens with ironwork products. Banzragch also wants to expand his business by making more products and further improve his family’s financial situation and the quality of life. Banzragch is a very modest person. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more iron and welding products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M. lives in the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store where she sells different items to people who live in her community. She has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Jessica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new loan, for 10,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue improving and expanding her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Los Lopez Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Los López lo integran Félix Elena V. F., Ana María López B. y Terencio Margarito Martínez Hernández. Elena, su coordinadora, con 57 años es la mayor del grupo y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental en Managua, toda su mercadería la vende al contado y el instinto adquirido en sus 40 años de experiencia es el que le guía para saber que fruta comprar para obtener el mayor beneficio.

Ana desde hace 6 años elabora bordados y los vende en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya, el cual también es lugar de comercio para Terencio quien es, según sus palabras, un artesano del calzado. Estas personas desean lo mejor para sus familias y ver superados a sus hijos e hijas es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Félix Elena V. F., Ana María López B., and Terencio Margarito Martínez Hernández make up the community bank Los López. At 57, Elena, their coordinator, is the oldest of the group. She sells fruit and vegetables in the east market in Managua. She sells all her merchandise on a cash basis, and the instinct acquired in her 40 years of experience is what guides her to know what fruit to purchase to obtain the greatest profits. For 6 years, Ana has made embroidery and sold it in the municipal market in the city of Masaya, which is also the business place of Tercenio, who is, in his own words, a craftsman of footwear. These people want the best for their families, and to see their sons and daughters excel is their greatest dream.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Hold Tight” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Marie K.. Marie is 35 and was born in Matotoka village. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. For five years now, Marie has been selling rubber bowls, dishes, cups, etc. With her share of this loan, she will add more rubber bowls, dishes and cups into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rubber bowls, dishes and cups for her business

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora María es la tesorera del Banco, responsabilidad que ha llevado muy bien desde que se inicio el Banco, dice que le ha gustado mucho por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la Fundación Espoir.

Tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada hace 28 años y tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales aun viven con ella, su esposo es Ing. agrónomo y se dedica a varios trabajos temporales de su profesión. Estudio belleza en la Academia Romero Bastidas que pertenecía a la Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Tiene un gabinete de belleza desde hace varios años, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de su hija, tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por el buen trabajo que realiza, además vende productos de belleza y de cuidado personal.

Quiere comprar con este crédito un sillón para cortar cabello ya que solo tiene uno y le hace mucha falta otro.
 
Sus sueños son viajar y especializarse como estilista.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscape and for its lovely fresh water spas which are visited by many tourists, the members of the "Nueva Luz" (New Light) Communal Bank meet every fortnight. María is the Bank's treasurer, a responsibility that she has taken on since the Bank began, she says that she really likes the additional benefits that the Espoir Foundation offers. She is 49 years old, and has been married for 28 years and has 4 children, three who still live with her. Her husband is an agricultural expert and has several temporary jobs with his profession. She is studying beauty at the Romero Bastidas Academy which belongs to the Manabí Technical University. She has had a beauty clinic for several years, and she works every day from 8am until 6pm with the help of her daughter. She has a lot of clients who prefer her because of the good work that she does. In addition she sells beauty and personal care products. With this loan she wants to buy a chair for cutting hair as she only has one and she really needs another. Her dreams are to travel and to specialize as a stylist.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a chair for cutting hair.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie A. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Elvie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta D. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 55 years old, widowed and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Crisanta joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olga Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Olga del Socorro R. Lambí tiene 34 años de edad, trabaja como docente en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería UNI ella es Ingeniera Química tiene aspiraciones personales como es consolidar una planta industrial para la fabricación de Vinagres y Colados de frutas para bebés cuyo nombre que lleva es BBPLUS.

Es soltera, no tiene hijos, tiene dos personas que dependen de ella su mamá y su abuelita.

Es primera vez que hace préstamo en CEPRODEL, dice que le gustó la política de crédito que le ofreció y por medio de este crédito podrá mejorar sacar adelante su proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Olga del Socorro R. Lambí is 34 years old.  She works as a teacher at the National University of Engineering UNI.  She is a chemical engineer, and has personal aspirations such as to outfit an industrial plant to make juices and strained food from fruit for babies, which currently carries the name of BBPLUS.

She is single, doesn’t have children, and has two people that depend on her:  her mother and grandmother.

This is the first time she has taken a loan through CEPRODEL.  She states that she liked having the opportunity to access credit and, through this loan, would like to make her life’s dream a reality.

loans.use: To improve her home: sewage lines, roof and electrical repairs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 41 years old and in business. She sells firewood in a slum and employs four people. Her business is located strategically near a bus stop along a busy path. She is a member of Unity SHG that has guaranteed her a loan of Kes. 60,000. 

With the loan money, Ruth intends to add to her stock of firewood for sale. Ruth is a single mother of one adult. She hopes to open another stall for selling firewood and paraffin in five years' time and employ many youths in future. She describes herself as hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To add to her stock of firewood

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: S. Josephine est mariée à DEDJI Bernard et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a près de onze ans que la famille s'est installée à Djeffé dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Josephine apporte une aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différents besoins de la famille. Josephine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Josephine vend des draps, des rideaux, et des tissus par le système de distribution. Josephine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josephine exerce cette activité depuis huit ans. C'est la première fois que Josephine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Josephine S. is married to Bernard Dedji and is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. The couple has one other child in their care, besides their own children. All the children are in school.

About eleven years ago, the family moved to Djeffé, in the Sèmè-Podji district. Josephine helps her husband by taking responsibility, along with him, for the family's various needs.  She did not go to shcool, and to meet her needs, Josephine sells sheets, curtains, and other fabric through the distribution system.  Josephine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has been involved in this activity for eight years. 

This is the first time that Josephine has asked ALIDé for a loan, in order to increase her inventory and better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy sheets, curtains, and fabric.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 33-year-old married woman with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for the last five years. She started selling in the market but now has a store. However, the hardship is that during the rainy season, transport is expensive. 

Her vision is to own a milling machine and educate her children to higher institutions of learning. Beatrice needs the loan to buy cassava flour.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “KUÑA GUAPA ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Venita quien  se desempeña como vendedora de leche y queso, ventas de verduras, lácteos y cosméticos.
Para preparar varios tipos de comestibles  solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne en gran cantidad.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo, aprendiendo unas de otras. En el 3º ciclo se sienten con mucho mas animo de seguir sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
Several neighbors joined together to form the Kuña Guapa Communal Bank.  All of the members of the communal bank have independent business activities like sales and fast food preparation.

Venita is one of the members.  She sells milk, cheese, vegetables, dairy products, and cosmetics.  In order to prepare various types of food, she is requesting a loan to buy meat in large quantities.

The members formed a communal bank that is capable of jointly carrying out business activities that strengthen their comradeship.  They are learning from each other.  In their third cycle they have a lot of energy to continue their enterprises.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat makes artificial flowers as a business. She collects orders from different gift shops and earns a regular income. The income she earns helps her with paying utility bills and the school fees of her children. 
 
She has three children, all of whom are young. Two are getting their education while her youngest daughter is only 3 years old and has not started attending school yet. 

Ulfat’s husband works abroad; she lives with her brothers and a sister. They are also involved in different works and one of her brothers runs an academy in the community, where he has a good number of students.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s academy. With the loan, he will buy furniture, like chairs and tables, for his academy. The additional furniture will help him in facilitating more students.  

Ulfat is hopeful that the investment will bring good outcomes for her brother's business. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She lives in Gujranwala, which is a mid-size city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its rice industry. She has been living there for over nine years.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her brother's academy

loans.name: Rider Alexander

texts.es:
Rider, se dedica a destazar cerdos, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos en Nueva Guadalupe departamento de San Miguel, su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábado desde hace 3 años.
Actualmente  él quiere construir en su vivienda un muro de contención ya que la zona donde está ubicada la casa, en temporada de lluvias existen deslaves lo que va erosionando la tierra y dañando parte del patio, la casa es familiar pero Rider quiere tenerla en mejores condiciones por lo solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales para llevar a cabo la construcción, la inversión la hará en cemento, arena y piedra.
Él espera hacer una buena administración del préstamo, dedicarse a su trabajo para poder cubrir los pagos de este crédito y seguir contribuyendo por mejorar la vivienda y en un futuro formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Rider earns a living by butchering pigs. He is 28 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in Nueva Guadalupe in the Department of San Miguel. Rider has been working Monday through Saturday for three years.

Rider currently wants to build a retaining wall for his home since it is located in an area that experiences landslides during the rainy season. Land erosion has damaged part of the yard. The house belongs to his family, but Rider wants to have better living conditions. He is requesting this loan to buy materials so that he can proceed with the construction. Rider will invest in cement, sand, and stone.

He hopes to manage this loan very well. Rider dedicates himself to his job so that he can cover the payments for this loan and continue contributing to the home improvements. In the future, he hopes to start his own family.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, and stone to build a retaining wall

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Margaret operates a kindergarten school.  Children from the neighboring community attend her school. Margaret faces a major challenge of debt from parents who have not cleared school fees. She hopes to expand her kindergarten school in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, Margaret wants to purchase chairs for her kindergarten school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs for kindergarten school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa tiene la edad de 31 años, casada, madre de cinco hijos, con un pequeño negocio de venta ropa nueva, con más de un año vendiendo, el cual comenzó con poco capital de su liquidación en zona franca, ya que siempre ha trabajado para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos. El cual trabaja como despachador en una aduana.

Hoy lo que quiere es invertir en ropa, zapatos, cosmético y lograr poder cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes el cual el ochenta por ciento lo trabaja al crédito.
Para ella este financiamiento es de gran beneficio ya que podrá expandir sus ventas a través de ropa variada, al invertir más productos.teniendo como objetivo el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 31, is married and the mother of five children.  She has had a small clothing sales business for over a year that she started with a bit of capital she got when she was retired from the free zone since she has always worked to help her husband with expenses; he works as a Customs Agent.

What she wants to do now is invest in clothes, shoes and cosmetics to meet pending customer orders; 80% of her sales are on credit.  For her, this financing is a great benefit because it will help her expand sales through varied clothing by having more products available.  Her objective is to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kizota Group

texts.en:
Tatu S., who is in her late thirties, is married with two children.  She has been running a business of selling ladies clothes and handbags for three years.  She sells her products from door to door.  She works from 9.00am to 4.00pm (7 hours only) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Tatu's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy bedsheets, hand bags, face creams and food at a local place.  She has paid back all her loans sucessfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more bags and she will start selling charcoal.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "Kizota", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Tatu is second from the right, in the first row.

loans.use: to start selling charcoal and also buy more bags

loans.name: Kimererio

texts.en:
Kimererio E. N. is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been farming her own piece of land for the past eight years.

She was first introduced to KADET by one of its local staff members. She has now applied for her third loan, which she intends to use to buy maize seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity. She also intends to buy a few cows for fattening.

She dreams of educating her children to a higher level. She is a thorough lady who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy maize seed, fertilizer and cows to expand a small scale farming operation

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 31 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años, ambos estudian en escuela. Su marido tiene un taxi amigo y es comerciante. Ella es nacida en Guayaquil pero hace seis años se vino  a vivir a  esta linda ciudad.

Ella tiene una tienda comestibles en su casa, en el que vende desde arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio seis años y que le ha ido muy bien, los productos compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría  los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su tienda es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here is where we find Martha, 31 years of age; she is in a common-law marriage that has resulted in two children ages 10 and 5 who are both in school.  Her husband has a taxi and is a merchant.  She was born in Guayaquil, but came to live in this beautiful city six years ago.

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, and even bazaar items.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm, and sometimes even later.  She tells us she’s been in business for six years, and that things have gone very well.  She buys her products in Portoviejo, although she receives most items in her locale.

This loan will be used to better supply her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, cold cuts and bazaar items.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank for 3 years and enjoys it because, through the loans, she has been able to finance her business.

Her dream is to have her own location as she currently rents.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, cold cuts and bazaar items.

loans.name: Moserrate Leonor

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Divino Niño se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Leonor es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la forma de trabajar de la institución y porque los créditos son rápidos. Tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en  escuela y colegio.  Su esposo es comerciante.

Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección y ahora tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde se dedica a coser, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, aunque nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de niñas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa, también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que lleva como 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, cierres, botones y otros materiales para la costura. 

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y con más maquinas.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño community bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The place is known for bering very commercial, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for its people's cheerfulness.  

Leonor is a founding member of the community bank and she likes the way the institution works because the loans are quick. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children aged 19, 14, 12 and 9 years old. The three youngest go to elementary and high school. Her husband is a merchant.  

For several years, she has done sewing. Now she has a small sewing workshop where she sews. She makes all types of clothes, although she tells us that what she likes the most is to make little girls' clothes. She works with orders from people who go to her house. She also makes uniforms for institutions, elementary schools and high schools in the areas. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., sometimes later when she has orders to finish. She tells us that she has been doing this activity for 15 years and it is going very well for her. 

This new loan will be used to buy fabric, zippers, buttons and other materials for sewing. 

Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop with more machines.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Sop Mame Rokhaya Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est composé de 16 femmes qui habitent le même quartier.Il est créé le 28 mars 2008.La principale activité est le petit commerce.

Coumba est une femme veuve qui a en charge cinq enfants; elle est debout sur la photo habillée en. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes avec une expérience de plus de 20 ans.

elle se ravitaille et vend ses produits au marché central de la ville. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité pour réaliser plus de revenus 

Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge les dépenses de sa famille pour assurer un bien être à ses enfants
texts.en: This solidarity group is made up a 16 women who live in the same neighborhood. It was created on March 28, 2008. They are mainly involved in small business. Coumba is a widow who takes care of five children; she is one of the women standing in the photograph. She has managed a small business of selling vegetables for the past 20 years. She buys her supplies and sells her products at the central market in town. Her new loan will help strengthen the business and increase revenues. With her profits, she takes care of all the family's expenses to ensure the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Garang Tangub City. She is 21 years old. Edna is single. 

To make a living, Edna raises fish for sale. Edna has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets. This will be the second loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with only one child. Virginia is 62 years old and lives in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Virginia sells canned goods and other daily needs such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, noodles and so on to earn a living, and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns about $150 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products which people need daily.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Virginia hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap and other daily needs to sell.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is 34 years old, married, and a father of four children who are between two and twelve years old. Tsuma is a draftsman in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last eight years and has been a success. 

Tsuma has been a KADET client and this marks his second borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase drawing materials to enable him to draw plans, sections and profiles for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, to gradually expand his business, and to start up a tailoring business. His dream is to own a construction company.

loans.use: to purchase drawing materials to enable him to draw plans, sections and profiles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 year old, married to Erastus and is blessed with two children.

For the last ten years Elizabeth has sold milk in Jericho market in Nairobi. She earns an income of 16,000 KES a month.

Elizabeth has a good credit history with KADET. She is now applying for a second loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more milk.

Elizabeth will use her extra profits to expand her business and educate her children. She hopes to expand her business so as to become an authorized milk distributor.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to sell.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe y su esposa la señora Jovana tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y artículos de bebe en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía que es ropa para dama y caballero, zapatos, aparatos electrónicos (planchas, licuadoras, tostadores y cafeteras) pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para l inversión que desean hacer le a su negocio.    
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio y que los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos los cubrirá con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como oficial vehicular de la ciudad. 
Desea darles lo mejor y sacar a delante a su familia.
texts.en:
For more than three years José Guadalupe and his wife, Jovana, have sold used clothing and baby items in different parts of the city.  

They would like to invest in purchasing merchandise such as women's and men's clothing, shoes, and small appliances (irons, blenders, toasters, and coffeemakers) but they don't have the necessary capital, so they are requesting a loan to make this investment in their business.   

He plans to repay the loan with the earnings from his business, and to cover the family expenses and school expenses for his three children with the income from his job as a traffic officer for the city. 

He wants to give his family the best and help them get ahead.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Elena Petrona

texts.es: La Sra. Elena vive en la zona de la Villa Primero de mayo junto con su esposo en la casa de su madre. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y de cosméticos la cual vende al contado y a crédito su esposo es consultor independiente. El crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo con la compra de mercadería ropa de temporada ya que tiene muchos pedidos porque ha aumentado sus clientes tanto de ropa como de cosméticos. La Sra. Elena se fijo como meta tener su propia casa y por eso con los créditos que le esta otorgando Emprender y Kiva ella esta saliendo adelante.
texts.en: Elena lives in an area called Villa Primero de Mayo with her husband. They currently live in her mother's house. Elena sells clothing and cosmetics. She offers her customers the option of paying in cash or on credit. Her husband is an independent consultant. The loan Elena is requesting will provide her with working capital to increase her inventory of seasonal clothing. She has a growing number of customers and demand is high. Elena hopes to be able to afford her own house, and the loans she is receiving from Emprender and Kiva are helping her reach this goal.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio's dream is to become financially stable in the future. He is 56 and a father of five.  He has owned and managed 1 hectare of rice fields for almost 28 years and usually earns a profits of only P 23,000 per cropping.  He works hard and endures hardships because he wants to continue sending his children to school.

He aimed to increase his yields this coming season to earn a higher income to finance the education of their children and other family needs.  He requests a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay expenses incurred in transplanting the rice seedlings. He believes that, patience and hard work are the only key to make his dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: San Miguel De Arcangel Group

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha D. 58 años D. edad soltera , es una D. la socias que conforman la Alcancía comunal San Miguel D. Arcángel ,se le dio en este segundo ciclo el préstamo ya que Bertha al igual que sus demas compañeros  demostraron  en el anterior ciclo trabajar en equipo  y ser puntuales en cuanto a sus pagos .Bertha se dedica actualmente a la  venta D.  animal vacuno  en las ferias D. Chupaca ,Ahuac.Solicita este  préstamo para poder  comprar buenos alimentos para sus animales ,para que así pueda  vender a un buen precio los animales .Quisiera para el futuro  tener un buen espacio para que ella misma pueda sembrar los alimentos para sus animales. En la foto viste  una  casaca color negro, polo color blanco y un sombrero color crema .Todos los integrantes la Alcancia comunal San Miguel D. Arcangel  estan muy agradecidos  por el prestamo obtenido .
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is 58 years old and single. She is one of the members of San Miguel D. Arcángel communal bank. This is the bank’s second loan cycle, since Bertha and the other members of the group demonstrated in the previous cycle that they worked as a team and were punctual in making their payments. 

At present, Bertha sells cattle in the street markets of Ahuac district, in Chupaca province. She is requesting this loan to buy good feed for her animals so that she can then sell the animals at a good price. She would like in the future to have a good space so that she can plant food for her animals herself. 

In the photo Bertha is dressed in a black jacket, a white polo shirt and a cream-colored sombrero. All the members of San Miguel D. Arcángel communal bank are very grateful for the loan obtained.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 51 years old, married and lives in village of Ilagan, province of Isabela. It is located in a rural area. The area is known for trade, farming and tourism.

Merlita has been a beautician for four years, providing manicures, pedicures and cutting hair. She has a loyal clientele because of her good service. She spends her income on personal expenditures.

Merlita applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy materials and tools that she needs to continue to provide good service. Thanks to her larger clientele she will be able to pay off the loan and have an even more successful business. Merlita is a hard-working and dedicated woman whose only wish is to expand her business and provide financial support to her family.

loans.use: to buy scissors, nail cutters, nail polish and nail color for her business.

loans.name: Rebeca Sobeyda

texts.es:
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, en el municipio de Achuapa del departamento de León, la señora Rebeca inicia sus labores abriendo su negocio que consiste en una pequeña pulpería el cual atiende a diario a todos sus clientes cercanos a su localidad.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo es necesario invertir en él y para ello es que actual mente  acudió a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para ampliar el inventario ya que comprará carne de res, pollo, aceite y azúcar para así continuar vendiéndolos y alcanzar las mejores condiciones de vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Rebeca starts her work day very early in the morning in the town of Achuapa, León Department, opening up her business which consists of a small grocery store that she opens daily for all her nearby customers in her location.

Like all developing businesses, it’s necessary to invest in it and this is why she’s called upon Ceprodel now to request a loan to increase inventory.  She will buy beef, chicken, oil and sugar to continue selling them and attain better living conditions both for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken oil and sugar.

loans.name: Yuliney

texts.es: Yuliney de 20 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 9 meses de edad al suroccidente de la Ciudad, allí tiene una papelería, vende servicios de telecomunicaciones vía celular e internet, además de ofrecer los servicios de juegos de play  Station  y la venta de dulces.  Yuliney se dedicó desde niña al estudio y logró terminar una carrera técnica pero no encontró un empleo para desempeñarse,  por eso hace dos años, se dedicó al negocio actual, del que hoy genera ingresos y apoya a su familia. Su sueño más adelante es lograr que su hijo obtenga una educación, donde pueda desempeñarse exitosamente y por eso se esmera en trabajar al lado de su cónyuge día a día. Mientras esto ocurre rota  sus inventarios cada 14 días y tiene una rentabilidad promedia, no menor del 41,49%,  desde la que planea incrementar su capital. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará dulcería, un computador, 1 televisor, un juego de play Station, y tendrá éxito porque se acerca una época de gran demanda en la cual programa darse a conocer aún más en el sector.
texts.en: Yuliney is 20 years old and she lives with her common-law partner and her 9-month old child. They live in the south-west of the city and she has there an school supply store from where she also sells telecommunications services via cellular phone and internet, Play Station gaming services, and sweets sales. Yuliney attended school since she was a girl and she managed to accomplish a technical career but she could not find employment. This is why two year ago she started up her current business. Today she generates and income and she is able to support her family. Her dream for the future is to send her son to school where he will apply himself successfully, which is the reason why she strives to work alongside her partner day after day. While this develops she has an inventory rotation of 14 days and she has an average profit of no less than 41.49%, which she hopes to increase with her capital. Currently she is investing her Kiva loan, the first loan she receives from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase sweets, a computer, a television, and a Play Station game. She will be successful because the season when she sees the greatest demand approaches and she will strive to make herself even better known in her sector.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, a computer, a television, and a Play Station game.

loans.name: Mahuklo Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Eliane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un tailleur nommé Barnabé. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à leur charge. Eliane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Eliane a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Depuis environs cinq ans, Eliane vend des divers (condiments de sauce, conserves, œufs frais) dans une ville du Bénin. Eliane achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Eliane et les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et diversifier leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MAHUKLO is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Eliane (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 37 years old and married to a tailor named Barnabé. They have three children, all in school. Two of the children are in their care. Eliane lives together with her husband and children. The couple ensures the different household expenses are covered. 

Eliane dropped out of primary school. For about five years, Eliane has been selling various goods (sauce condiments, canned foods, fresh eggs) in a city in Benin. Antoinette buys her goods in Benin. 

This is the third time that Eliane and the other members of the group MAHUKLO have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and diversifying their businesses, as well as responding better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments, caned foods, and trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El Señor Freddy vive en la zona de  Pucara Grande en la provincia de Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba, hace 2 años que Freddy compró el terreno en cual actualmente vive, donde pudo construir 3 cuartos. Mantiene a su familia con el ingreso de servicios de transporte que hace con su propio taxi. En una primera instancia el terreno que compro hace 2 años, lo hizo con financiamiento bancario, ahora terminó de pagar su préstamo, y estuvo buscado un nuevo préstamo para terminar de construir su casa, levantar muro y colocar puerta de garaje.
