Por recomendación escuchó de los créditos que ofrece KIVA a través  de nuestra Institución. Es así, que tramitó el crédito para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in the Pucara Grande zone of Cercado province in Cochabamba department. Two years ago, Freddy bought the land where he currently lives, and he built three rooms there. He supports his family with income from transportation services that he provides using his own taxi. 

To start out, the land that he bought two years ago was purchased using financing from a bank. Now he has finished paying off that loan, and he was looking for a new loan to complete the construction of his house, put up a wall, and add a garage door. Through a recommendation, he heard about the loans that Kiva offers through our institution. Because of that, he applied for the loan to complete the construction of his house.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his house.

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
Narcefa is 42 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Narcefa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcefa runs a business buying and selling dried coconuts in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried coconuts to sell.

Narcefa has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Narcefa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of dried coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh is a 24-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She has owned a clothing shop since 2010 and works with her husband who has sold cars for the past 26 years. Together they work to raise their income levE. and cover their children’s educational fees.

Today, Jamileh wishes to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra products for her shop such as new designs in clothes, accessories, etc. She notes that this Kiva loan will increase her sales and allow her to raise her income.

In the future, she plans to have her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy extra products for her shop such as new designs in clothes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 27 years old, unmarried and lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years she has had a shop from which she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marina became a member of HSPFI this year. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock for her shop.

In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Momakiz

texts.ru: Момакиз 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она занимается шитьем и вышивкой чехлов. В основном она занимается изготавливанием седла. Эти видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа тканей, ниток и иголок.
texts.en: Momakiz is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. She does sewing and embroidering of covers. Mainly she makes the saddle. She has been in this business for twelve years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics, threads and needles.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and needles.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her thread making business. With the loan investment, she will purchase old warm clothes like sweaters and then gets thread from it to sell at the local market for a profit. She is a very creative minded and skilful lady and earns reasonably good income from her business.
 
Her husband is a laborer by profession. His income is not confirmed every day because some days he doesn’t get any work. Bashiraan has given birth to a son who is young and works as a mason. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well along with her business. 
She is confident that she will successfully be able to make good use of the loan and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy old warm clothes for her thread selling business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 30, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over five years and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, she runs a groceries store at home to generate more income to support the family.  She earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed in a gas station. He earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Mom is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to sell. This purchase would enable her to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the additional profit to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.fr: Âgée de 37 ans, Emma est mariée à un couturier du nom de Guy. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Emma vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Emma vend des condiments à son domicile et des façon ambulante depuis cinq ans et des cuillères et des boules d'akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté) de façon secondaire; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Emma s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Emma devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Emma sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika is 53-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. She has two sons and both are working in a private company. She owns a general store where she sells ladies' fashion items, cosmetics for ladies and dressmaking supplies. She also does tailoring and gives training to others. She wants to start a ladies cloth store where she will sell cloth only for females. 

Radhika has requested a loan of 35,000 INR to buy female cloth in bulk to resell. She hopes to do well in her business, and she would like to thank Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy cloth for ladies to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Tandika , Temeke District in Dar es Salaam.She is married with four children. The elder daughter is in Secondary. Mariam runs a tailoring  business  in a verandah of her home. The business have not been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials and competition she faces from her neighbours.  She want to improve her business by having enough supply sewing materials and rented business premise. She is currently working on the varandah of her house which does not attract customers and does not provide her enough space. She also need to add two saving machines and one assistant. The strategy requires a capital injection of USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Adiwa Charlotte

texts.en:
Ms. Adiwa Charlotte D. was born July 7, 1961 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of two who also takes care of two other people. After leaving secondary school she went to learn the laundry business from her uncle's wife. She loves her job and does it with joy, and it earns her a decent income. Despite the fact that her husband is currently unemployed, her family is still happy because she enjoys her job, which she does with energy and attentiveness. She has a lot of management experience, so she has had no problem repaying her previous loans. She is currently requesting a loan of $800 to set up her shop and to buy new equipment. The financing of this project will allow her to increase her income and thus improve her family's living conditions, which is her top priority.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 07 juillet 1961 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame D. Adiwa Charlotte est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants avec deux autres personnes en charge. Avec un niveau d'instruction secondaire, elle est allée se faire initier au métier de blanchisserie par la femme de son oncle. Un métier qu’elle aime tant et exerce avec joie et qui lui procure beaucoup de bénéfice. Malgré la situation actuelle du mari qui est en chômage, la famille est toujours heureuse à cause du métier qu’elle exerce avec dynamisme et assiduité. Très expérimentée en gestion, elle n'a eu aucun problème dans le remboursement de ses crédits antérieurs. Pour aménager sa boutique et acheter de nouveaux matériels, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra d'améliorer ses revenus et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille car c’est la première de ses soucis.

loans.use: To set up her shop and buy new equipment

loans.name: Tariyel

texts.en:
Tariyel is 47, is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has one child. He has run this business for 4 years, and this is his only source of income.
Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy a calf to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is a very hard working and responsible woman. Her husband works in a factory where he earns very little. Therefore, Candelaria started her own business selling stationary about a year ago. Little by little her business has grown and the quality of her service has improved. In this way she is able to earn money to cover their household costs which her husband’s salary could not.

Candelaria is now asking for a loan of $200 to buy a machine which will allow her business to grow. She will repay this loan over a period of 4 months. Today you can help someone who really needs it and contribute to the growth of her business. Candelaria thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Candelaria es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, su esposo labora en una empresa ladrillera donde gana muy poco, ante esta necesidad Candelaria inició su propio negocio vendiendo papelería hace más de un año, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio y mejorando la calidad del servicio que ofrece, de esta manera obtiene un ingreso que le permite cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y pagar los servicios básicos que sólo con el salario de su esposo sería imposible.

En estos momentos, Candelaria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de una máquina para enmicar, la necesita para hacer crecer su negocio ya que sus clientes le demandan mucho este servicio, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Candelaria te lo agradece mucho.

loans.use: To buy equipment/Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio Q. lives with his twenty year old son in his own home in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of La Paz. He teaches at a night school in La Paz. As it stand now Ignacio's home is centered on its lot, but the neighborhood association is requiring him to extend the facade so that the municipality will pay for improvements to the street. This loan will pay for the needed section of wall and to build a room for Ignacio's son. This is Ignacio's first loan from IMPRO. Our analysis shows he is qualified.

Translated by Kiva volunteer.

El señor Ignacio Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hijo de 20 años de edad; el señor Ignacio trabaja como profesor de primaria en una escuela nocturna de nuestra ciudad. Su vivienda esta construida en la mitad de la fachada y la junta de vecinos le exige que edifique el total de su propiedad por cuanto ese es un requisito para que el gobierno municipal realice las mejoras viales en la zona. El crédito solicitado es para el cerramiento del muro frontal y la construcción de una habitación para su hijo. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To complete the facade of a private home and add a room.

loans.name: Aastamaiya

texts.en: Mrs. Aastamaiya D., 44, lives in Chappagaun, a village famous for vegetable farming. She lives with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her son is in grade 11. Her husband, Bhakta Lal D., is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop 6 years ago. He makes different varieties of furniture, such as beds, tables, and chairs. All the family's needs depend on the shop income. Therefore, Mrs. Aastamaiya seeks a loan to buy timber to meet the demand for the furniture.

loans.use: To buy timber to make furniture

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat A. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells books. She has been in this business since the year 2000 and needs a loan of $450 to buy more books for sale.

loans.use: To buy more books for sale

loans.name: Marilu Flores

texts.en:
Marilu is in her early forties. She and her husband have four children, two girls and two boys.  They all attend secondary school.  Marilu owns a car and motorcycle repair shop. Her garage provides a lot of services and also sells products such as lubricants, brakes, used bumpers etc.  Marilu started the business a few months ago with her husband’s help.  As the couple didn’t have sufficient money to operate the new enterprise, Marilu took a loan to purchase the neccessary materials.
Marilu has some experience selling products and attracting clients.  Currently, her employees (two mechanics) repair an average of eight cars a day.  Marilu’s work consists of selling articles the customers need.  She is currently requesting a loan to purchase more materials and products in order to improve the quality of services she can offer to her clients.  Marilu’s business supports the studies of her children.

loans.use: To purchase materials and articles for a small car repair shop

loans.name: Fariji

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 29 year old Fariji H.. She is married with one child, aged 5, and has one other dependent who was a street child. In 2003, Fariji established a retail shop, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of goods. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of goods in bulk

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two children and lives in Mukachevo. Mariya sells cosmetics and has been in this trade for 12 years. Her high-quality merchandise has always been in demand. Mariya’s business has been growing with remarkable stability and consistency. However, Mariya believes that now is a good time for further expansion. 

Currently, Mariya has $600 in profit each month, which is not quite enough for her to open a new vending location and stock it with inventory. She is requesting a loan of $800 to help her expand to another location. Mariya tries to keep her customers in mind and has managed to get better products, provide good customer service, and a larger market share. Mariya hopes this focus on her customers and commitment to business will help her business become even more successful.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Cell phone service has become one of the most popular businesses and at the same time the most demanded among the population of Juliaqueña . For this reason, without thinking twice, Maritza decided to buy cell phones and offer this service to the entire population. Everyday, after caring for her beloved son and hardworking husband, she leaves her home to make her way to one of the busiest avenues of the city of Juliaca. Additionally, in her free hours, this hardworking mother makes use of the time to make beautiful sweaters, shawls and Peruvian Andean hats that at the end of the month she offers at the very least to her friends, with the objective of supplying the basic necessities of her home. Maritiza wants to take this opportunity to acquire a greater quantity of raw material to make a wider variety of garments and in greater volume. With this project in mind reach inside your heart.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

El servicio de llamadas móviles de un tiempo a este se ha convertido en uno de los negocios más populares y al mismo tiempo el de mayor demanda entre la población Juliaqueña, es por esa razón que Maritza sin pensarlo dos veces decidió comprar celulares y brindar este servicio a la población entera.Ella todos los días después de atender a su querido hijo y laborioso esposo, abandona su hogar para dirigirse a una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, de manera adicional en sus horas libres ésta laboriosa madre aprovecha el tiempo para confeccionar hermosas chompas, chalinas y chullos, que cada fin de mes oferta al por menor a sus amistades, con el objetivo de suplir las necesidades primordiales de su hogar.En esta oportunidad Maritza tiene pensado adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para confeccionar mayor variedad de prendas y en mayor volumen.Con ese proyecto en mente recurre a tu buen corazón.

loans.use: Increase of capital to buy a greater amount of raw material to make more articles of clothing

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
I am Bushra S.. I was married 15 years ago but unfortunately was divorced four years ago. I have three children: two daughters and one son, all of whom attend a local school. The purpose of sending them to school is to make them qualified so that they can secure their future.

My business is to sell blankets and clothing, sheets, and thermoses. I had to start this business after I was divorced to earn a living for my children. I handle my business independently and now, because I feel the need for an increased income, I have decided to expand my business. I require a loan to buy men's clothing as well as women's clothing to diversify my inventory.

loans.use: To diversify her clothing business

loans.name: Estrellas De Mar Group

texts.es:
The association called "Estrellas de Mar" has worked with Pro-Mujer for several years and has completed 9 credit cycles. They are located in the Villa Adela zone, in the city of El Alto and currently have 18 members, and have shown that they are a well-organized group with their credit.

The majority in the group are married with children, almost all school-age. There are a few cases in which, for lack of economic resources, unfortunately their children had to abandon their studies and now stay at home taking care of their younger siblings.

There are different businesses within the association, such as: sales of clothing, sale of milk products, sale of lingerie; but the main activity is sewing curtains, coverings for chairs and furniture upholstery. After completing their work, they sell only by order since they do not have any stand or exhibit space to show their work.

The "Estrellas de Mar" association says they need capital to rent stands or spaces in commercial zones, which will enable them to be more profitable. In addition, they need to be able to buy better-quality materials so their products have higher quality, and in this way they can get more customers and, in turn, have better earnings. Their main objective is to improve their economic situation and to be able to give their children a better quality of life, mainly an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La asociación denominada “”Estrellas de Mar” trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo con 9 ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Villa Adela, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias y ha demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.

Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos económicos, lastimosamente sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar sus estudios y ahora se quedan en sus casas cuidando de sus hermanos pequeños.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de ropa, de lácteos, ropa intima pero la actividad principal es la costura de cortinas y fundas para sillas, además tambien de tapizar muebles. Luego de finalizar sus trabajos solamente las venden a pedido, ya que no cuentan con ambientes para poder exponer sus trabajos,

La asociación Estrellas de Mar, afirma que necesitan mayor capital para alquilar ambientes adecuados y en zonas comerciales, que les asegure rentabilidad, además de poder adquirir telas de mejor calidad para que sus productos también tengan mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el unico objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Capital to acquire stands or rent spaces in commercial zones.

loans.name: Adunwole Elizabeth

texts.en:
A. Adunwole Elizabeth is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She is a fashion designer in Badagry, Lagos state, Nigeria. She learned this business in 2 years and has been working for the past 11 years. A. now has 3 sewing machines and 2 apprentices. She also makes bags.

A. has been a leader in a lending group for the past 2 years. She needs a loan of $1,200 USD to buy more tailoring and bag-making materials. She sends a big thank you to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esthers is a dynamic and entrepreneurial woman, who has dedicated herself to hard agricultural work since childhood, and since then she has not stopped working and saving to increase the income of her family. She has land holdings where she grows potatoes, corn, wheat, etc. and also raises animals like pigs, sheep and cows. She cares for and sells her animals while she waits for the harvest season. Her goal is to increase the amount of crops so that she can have a more abundant harvest, and this way can gain more earnings, which is why she has asked for this loan to be invested in the purchase of compost and fertilizers for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Esther es una mujer muy dinámica y emprendedora, se dedica a las duras tareas agrícolas desde su niñez, desde entonces no ha cesado de trabajar y ahora para incrementar los ingresos de su familia.Tiene extensiones de terreno en las que cultiva papa, maíz, trigo, etc. y también crías animales como cerdos, ovejas y vacas, cuida y vende sus animales mientras espera la época de la cosecha.Su deseo es aumentar la cantidad de siembra para que su cosecha sea más abundante, de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, para lo cual esta solicitando un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Purchase of compost and fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna E. sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams, and plantains, as well as drinks. She learned the skill of selling from her auntie. Anna is 38 years old and married with nine children. She is a LAPO client. Anna lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy one deep freezer to cool her drinks. This, she says, will increase her sales. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Luz Viva Group

texts.es:
La elaboración de almuerzos y meriendas es la principal actividad de la asociación “Luz Viva” .Esta pertenece a l centro focal de Villa Tejada, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan muy organizados en sus actividades de grupo.
Toda la elaboración de estos alimentos lo realizan con productos frescos por lo que deben realizar compras a diario ya que no cuentan con refrigeradores suficientes. Luego de la elaboración de sus alimentos los entregan  a pedido en oficinas y puestos en la ciudad  de El Alto. La asociación Luz Viva necesita comprar refrigeradores grandes  con la suficiente capacidad para almacenar productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus almuerzos.
texts.en:
Making lunches and snacks is the main activity that the 'Luz Viva' ('Living Light') association does. They belong to the focal center in Villa Tejado and with the help of their credit assistant they are very organized in the way in which they work in a group. They make all their food using fresh produce which means they must buy things daily as they don't have enough refrigerator space. After making foods they take them to the offices and food stalls which have ordered them in the city of El Alto. The 'Luz Viva' association needs to buy bigger refrigerators with enough room to keep all the products necessary for making their lunches.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need capital to buy big refrigerators/Necesitan capital para la compra de refrigeradores grandes.

loans.name: Mwasiti Bakari's Masasi Group

texts.en:
Mwasiti B., aged 24, is married with one son, four years old. She has a business selling prepaid phone credit, which she started in 2000. She operates stands in two areas: the city center and an area called Mbagala. She works with her husband from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $112.

Mwasiti has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loans to open the second shop in Mbagala and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase both businesses, but specificA. the one in Mbagala.

Mwasiti will share this loan with her loan group, Masasi, which totals 15 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mwasiti is in the second row from the front, on the left.

loans.use: To increase phone credit business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For a living, she sells foodstuffs such as cassava, plantains, and maize in the local market of Ashaiman, where she lives. Having sold such foodstuffs for the past eight years, she has gained a lot of business experience and has developed a loyal customer base. 

Esther notes that she is an overachiever, and that her goal is to save enough money so that she can provide her kids with a quality education and so that they can have a bright future. To that end, she is now seeking a loan to meet her customers' demands by purchasing an additional stock of cassava, plantains, maize, beans, etc. 

She is a member of the community group known as the Angel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell any goods on days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for any assistance provided.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing additional stocks of food (e.g., cassava, plantains, maize, and beans)

loans.name: Jerocelyn

texts.en:
“In order to succeed in life, we must not give up and never lose our hopes” said Jerocelyn Pascual, a 23 year old vendor of a variety of foods, vegetables, fish and meats in their village of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela. She is still single and lives with her parents.

“Engaging in that kind of business is my way of helping my parents to earn for a living,” Jerocelyn added. Jerocelyn ventures into a vending business wherein she sells viands, different kinds of vegetables, fish and meat and snacks. She hopes to increase her capital so she is encouraged to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to improve her vending business since it is doing well in the village. She will do her best to improve her business because she wants to have a better future in the long run and when she has her own family in the right time.

loans.use: Jerocelyn would like to improve her small store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Josephine is 36 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children that go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business. She is a member of BRAC, whose approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs in terms of its scale and diversity of projects.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. Its microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: expanding her tea business and investing in the future of her family and business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to Gideon M. and they are blessed with seven children, none of them below 15 years of age. Mary is living in a house with 6 sleeping rooms and one sitting room with her entire family. Mary has been a very hard-working woman during her whole life just to sustain her family. In the cause of hard work, Mary encountered some challenges in life such as the death of her son, of other relatives, and poor health. These challenges made life miserable for Mary until the year 2007 when she discovered GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.

In that same year of 2007, Mary received her pioneer loan of 40,000 FRS CFA and the repayment was made promptly. If she receives this loan, she plans to rent farmland for cultivation for 50,000 FRS, purchase seedlings, manure, fertilizer for 75,000 FRS, and 25,000FRS will be used to hire laborers to work in the farm. Mary is convinced the business will progress because of the experience she has had in farm work. Furthermore, she is commonly known in her locality as a main supplier of these goods, and she is considered trustworthy by the members of her community.

The farm work that Mary does will help her community by reducing their distance to the market in order to buy what she is supplying. Mary plans to use the profit from her loan to pay her children's school fees, feed them, and to take of their medical fees if they are sick and taken to the hospital. Mary prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because of the trust she has in GHAPE; the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings, clear farmland, etc.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Гурезов Шариф проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 47 лет. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Кроме того, он занимается животноводством. Сейчас хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы купить дойную корову. Это поможет ему обеспечить семью свежим молоком , а так же лишнее он сможет продавать и получать прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharif G. lives in the Abdurahman Jomi district. He is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children. He works on a small farm and raises livestock on the side. Now he would like to use a loan to buy a dairy cow. This way he will be able to provide fresh milk for his family as well as selling the extra milk at a profit. The loan will be repaid over 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Ami Mawulon

texts.fr: Cette dame  est mariée et a 03 enfants, elle réside dans le quartier de tokoin cassanblanca qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Depuis 2007 elle  a mis sur pied le commerce de débit de boissons non loin de la pharmacie « bon pasteur », ce commerce lui réussit  bien , la plupart de ses clients sont des tenanciers de bar. Son stock de boissons est épuisé, pour rehausser son stock, elle demande à wages un crédit pour l’achat de boissons.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and has three children. She resides in the Tokoin Cassanblanca district, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. In 2007, she set up a beverages outlet business not far from the Bon Pasteur pharmacy. This business is successful for her. Most of her customers are bar owners. Her inventory is exhausted. To replenish it, she's asking WAGES for a loan to buy more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Maximiliana es casada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Maximiliana vende comida en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de garbanzo, arroz y arveja.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son mejorar su casa y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She walks around selling food every day at the fresh food market in Ayacucho. Maximiliana needs a loan of 1500 sols to buy chickpeas, rice and peas. She dreams of making improvements to her house and running a store from home.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickpeas, rice and peas

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Elsa es madre soltera tiene 55 años, dos hijos de 25 y 23 años que estudian en instituto 
Desde joven cosía en su casa, estudio en curso especial para hacer sabanas y edredones, hace tres años ha puesto en su casa  un pequeño   negocio donde vende todo lo que hace. 
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales, como tela para sabanas y tela para polos.  
Desde que  esta en Finca gracias al dinero que recibe, le sirve para invertir y no tiene que estar en apuros pidiendo a otros, aprendió a ser mas ordenada, a saber priorizar sus compras.   
El sueño de Elsa es ampliar su negocio y tener gente  que trabaje para  ella.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of La Fortaleza Community Bank. She is a single mother, 55 years old, and has two children who are 25 and 23 years old and study in college. Ever since she was young she has sewn in her home. She took a specialized course in making sheets and comforters, and three years ago started a small business in her home selling all that she makes. Elsa needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy materials like fabric for sheets and fabric for polos. Thanks to being a part of Finca and for the loans she receives, she has been able to invest and no longer struggles, having to ask others for help. She learned to be more organized and prioritize her purchases. Elsa's dream is to expand her business and employ other workers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for sheets and polos

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Marina C. D. C. tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito D. Casa GranD., provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa.  Tiene 3 hijos.
Rosa antes vendía productos D. belleza en mínimas cantidades (lo distribuía entre amigos y familiares), ahora con el crédito otorgado le ha permitido ampliar su negocio adquiriendo nuevos productos D. belleza y ampliando su cartera D. clientes. Sus productos los distribuye en Ascope (como ha vivido en ese lugar tiene muchos conocidos).
Recién ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II
Con el crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá para adquirir productos D. belleza como cremas, esmaltes, perfumes y otros para su stock.
Rosa tiene como sueño instalar su tienda D. perfumería.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Marina C. D. C. is 55 years old and lives in the Casa GranD. district of Ascope, in La Libertad, Peru. She completed high school and has three children. Rosa used to sell small quantities of beauty products to friends and family. With this loan, she has been able to grow her business by acquiring new beauty products and increasing her clientele. She sells her products in Ascope since she lives here and knows many people. She has recently become a member of Manuela Ramos and a member of the communal bank Romanas Luchadoras II. With the loan of 300 soles, she will invest in beauty products like creams, nail polishes, perfumes, and other things for her stock. Rosa’s dream is to have a perfume store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: lo invertirá para adquirir productos en stock

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. is forty-three years of age. She is the divorced mother of six children – one son and five daughters. She says some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, trading in printed textiles. She buys printed textiles from the depots in Kumasi at a cost-effective price. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Akua also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Akua desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is blessed with three children: 21-year-old Arnel, 20-year-old Arnold, and 13-year-old Charmaine, who is now the family's only hope to finish college. She is currently a high school sophomore. The family peacefully resides in the village of San Francisco of Cauayan City, where farming is the major source of income for most residents.
 
Herminio is a farmer. He maintains a vegetable (eggplant) farming business. He produces eggplant and other types of vegetables, depending on the season. He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 as additional farming capital in order to sustain his business and increase his production. He will be purchasing agricultural inputs and allot financial support for the labor needed for vegetable farming business. Herminio is hoping that through KIVA his farming will become successful in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rudy Domingo

texts.es: Don Rudy T. tiene 28 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Playeras” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  a sus Papas, él y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Playeras en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Estación Rodríguez Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rudy T. is single, 28 years old, and makes t-shirts. He has a shop with 3 machines and lives with his parents. He and his parents share the same profession and they have 2 employees. He has made t-shirts for 6 years from his home, which is located in Paraje Estación Rodríguez Cantón Nimapá in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has increased. However, the current economic conditions do not allow him to increase his capital, which is why he is turning to Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan so that he can buy raw materials. This way, he can increase his sales, hoping to be able to help his family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette N., 51 ans est mariée avec 01 enfant en charge. Son activité est le commerce de pâte d’arachide et de niébé. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Bernadette N., age 51 ans, is married and has one child to support. Her business consists in selling peanut butter and black-eyed peas. She wants to use this loan to bolster her business. Her income enables her to help with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (selling peanut butter and black-eyed peas)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Lydia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita L. is from the village of Cebulin. She is 59 years old. Cristita is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cristita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es chofer propietario de un taxi que trabaja en la línea del trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, grupo  Correcaminos, trabaja como servicio de transporte publico interciudad La Paz - El Alto. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus  cuatro hijos que depende de él; es casado y su esposa no cuenta con un trabajo. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la Zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para el arreglo de su movilidad y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Juan.
texts.en:
Juan is the owner and driver of a taxi who works in the trufi 88 line of the Eduardo Albaroa labor union. He works providing public transportation between La Paz and El Alto. This work is his main source of income and helps him support his four dependent children. He is married and his wife is does not work. They live in a rented house in the Tembladerami Zone in La Paz city.

The loan he requests will go towards the repair of his auto so that he can increase his income.

An evaluation by IMPRO approved Juan for this solicitation of his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Piedras Preciosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Preciosa esta integrado por tres señoras inteligentes, audaces y con visión. Ellas son de Villa Nueva un barrio del casco urbano de Managua.

María Auxiliadora G. es la coordinadora del grupo ella aprendió el oficio de la zapatería de su esposo con el cual trabaja lustrando zapatos, arreglandolos y vendiendo  materiales para su fabricación como cuero.

Mientras las otras dos integrantes Paula Lourdes  V. H. y Martha Cecilia 	A. venden ropa de  forma ambulante.

loans.use: Comprar pasta para lustrar, chinola, cepillos, cuero, suelas, hilo, pega, clavos...etc

loans.name: Mr. Bunthoeun Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people who all live in Chroung Sdau village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. Mr. Bunthoeun T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes. He is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, he has a problem because his field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Bunthoeun T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crops more productive. His wife, Mrs. Kim Sros, is a tailor. Mr. Bunthoeun T. is 33 years old and the father of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Srey Loeng K. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Opening a Chinese restaurant might seem to be a unique calling for a guy who is originally from Mexico, but Jose takes pride in the fact that his restaurant is the only Chinese restaurant in his neighborhood. He always knew he wanted to run his own restaurant, and when the restaurant he used to work at was forced to close down, he started up a new one in the same building. 

Even with the recession, Jose says the business has done well, especially because of his unique status. He wants to take advantage of the fact that many restaurants are closing and that he is able to get their old equipment on sale. He also wants to invest in new equipment for the restaurant, like a cooking range, freezer, and deep fryer. 

In the future, Jose sees himself opening another branch of his restaurant, or possibly a second restaurant. Having a restaurant is a lot of work - Jose says that "having a restaurant is like having another wife," but thankfully his wife works at the restaurant as well. Overall, Jose says having his own place has been good for his personal life - he can be his own boss, and he has gotten to know many more people in his community as a result.

loans.use: To buy a cooking range, freezer, fryer, and other equipment; neon sign for store

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Saom T. is a 38 year old woman and the mother of three children. One of her children is employed in the garment industry. She and her husband currently weave bamboo baskets for sale. They operate the basket business after they finish planting and harvesting their rice crop. The family makes many sets of baskets before selling them. T. sells her finished produce to her nearby neighbors, who then take it to sell at the market. T. is requesting a loan to purchase more raw materials for weaving baskets.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna Kumari M. lives in Thecho, which is located in Lalitpur District of Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the less developed areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are farmers. Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband, son and daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7 and her daughter is in primary school. 

Her husband, Ganu Ratna M., a carpenter, and opened a furniture shop one year ago. Her husband makes different varities of furniture like beds, tables and chairs to sell. All of the family's requirements are fulfilled by the shop's income. Therefore, Mrs. M., seeks a loan of Rs 30000 to buy wood so her husband can make more furniture to sell and meet his customer's demands.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: G.s. Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esperanza Méndez vende ropa la cual ella elabora ya que es costurera, desde hace 9 años, tiene 57 años de edad y junto a su esposo se han esforzado para sacar adelante la familia ya que es una de sus prioridades es que su hijo logre salir adelante, solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima del negocio, ella vende su producto en Managua.
La señora Maria Del Carmen Méndez Martínez posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 años, es madre de tres hijos dos de los cuales dos  asisten al colegio, ya que el tercero es un niño de tres años, La señora realiza sus compras a camiones repartidores y en el mercado oriental, solicita un financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza Méndez has been selling clothes that she makes for nine years. She is a seamstress. She is 57. Together she and her husband have put forth a lot of effort to get the family ahead. One of their priorities is that their son gets ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy raw material for her business. She sells her product in Managua. María del Carmen Méndez Martínez has a mini market, which has been in her house for five years. She has three children. Two go to school, and the third one is three years old. She makes her purchases from delivery trucks and in the eastern market. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wade

texts.fr: Wade B. est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle fait de l’embouche Bovine et ovine et fait parallèlement du commerce d’arachide. Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Wade B. is a 37 year-old woman who is married with three children. She has been a member of the village bank for three and a half years. She does bovine and ovine fattening and at the same time has a peanut selling activity. She is participating in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is married and has two school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Salama 1 Ndagire Agnes Group

texts.en:
N. Agnes is forty years old and is married with four children of whom three are schooling. She also has three dependents, also schooling.

Agnes is the group representative and she has owned a carpentry business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase timber for her workshop.

Agnes is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to work hard, educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase timber for her carpentry business

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en: Vitaliy used to make trips to Siberia, Russia, to make his living because of the high unemployment in Western Ukraine. A few years ago, he decided to stop this activity and start his own small business where he lives. His started a printing business several years ago. This type of business seemed like one that could bring a stable and high income. Today he has a number of repeat clients that order various printed materials from him. Vitaliy would like to receive a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase supplies for printing like paper, toner, paint, etc. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions. Vitaliy is not married and lives in his own apartment.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esta señora es Obrera, tiene 50 años de edad, es casa y trabaja para una compañía productora de Ron, su marido es agricultor, tiene dos personas a su cargo los cuales están en escuela de secundaria, ella ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Es bueno señalar que en los dos créditos obtenidos anteriormente su comportamiento de pago ha sido excelente, por lo que se le ha estado considerando como cliente A.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is 50 years old, married, and a worker who is employed by a company that produces rum. Her husband is a farmer and they have two dependent children who are attending high school. Martha has received a total of three loans, all of which have been used for home improvements.

It is nice to point out that Martha demonstrated a good payment history with her two previous loans. For this reason, she is considered to be an “A” client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making home improvements

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice sells pastries and drinks to make a living in Benin City. She is doing well in her business. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her dream is to own a catering school where she will teach young boys and girls how to bake and make a living for themselves. She is 47 years old and married with 3 children. Her children are making progress in school. 

She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°18 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Quant au sous groupe Femmes Commerçantes N°18, Madame Vénise T. est la présidente. C’est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle commerce des tissus et du savon venant de la Côte d’Ivoire. Elle compte, cependant avec sa part du prêt, s’approvisionner en marchandises à Rosso en Mauritanie. Les autres membres de ce sous groupe sont Madame Bineta Kassé la trésorière vendeuse d’habits et chaussures, Madame Sabou M. élève coiffeuse et vendeuse de greffages, Madame Aïssatou Lame N. commerçante de produits cosmétiques et Madame Anta D. qui vend des légumes.
texts.en:
The group “Femmes Commerçantes” (F.C.), as its name indicates, is a network of women who are active in commerce. It is based in Grand Thiès and was founded in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, the network’s current president. She got the idea of forming the network after participating in a training session run by the NGO OXFAM in Thiès. She is therefore quite knowledgeable about group management, entrepreneurship, etc. The network members are extremely devoted and meet once a month.  Beyond a membership fee, each member must pay 200 francs CFA monthly into a solidarity fund. Desiring financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. This is why their network was split into nineteen sub-groups of five persons each to ensure a better profit outcome. For the second time, they are requesting a loan of 100,000 francs per member, that is 500,000 francs per sub-group, to develop their various businesses. However, payments are made at the monthly meetings to the group president, assisted by the group treasurer, Ms. Coumba Seck, who are then responsible for reimbursing U-IMCEC. In the words of its president, the network has only one single, noble objective: to fight family poverty. The network currently numbers nineteen sub-groups, each with its own president and treasurer. As for the sub-group Femmes Commerçantes N°18, the president is Ms. Vénise T.. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. She sells fabrics and soap from Cote d'Ivoire. With her share of the loan, she plans on stocking up on merchandise from Rosso in Mauritania. The other members of this sub-group are Ms. Bineta Kassé, the treasurer and a vendor of clothing and shoes; Ms. Sabou M., a student hair stylist and vendor of hair weaves; Ms. Aïssatou Lame N., a merchant of cosmetics; and Ms. Anta D., who sells vegetables.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Phem Y., 48, is a widowed farmer who lives with one of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Phem Y. included. In light of this economic difficulty, she is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a hand tractor. Phem Y. was not available for the picture so her son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and married with four school-going children.  She operates a retail shop where she sells maize, beans, green grams (mung beans) and rice.  She also runs a posho mill (for grinding maize into flour) to earn extra income. Her family is her priority and therefore she works hard to provide for the family.  

She was introduced to Faulu Kenya by her friend and she is an active member of the Elim Self Help Group.  She attends their weekly meetings and pays her dues consistently.  Because of this, the group members have guaranteed her a loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to expand her business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia R. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Delia is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a service-based business. Aside from her small variety store where she sells both food and daily use products, the main source of income for the business comes from providing video karaoke services to local community members. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell in her store. Delia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for her video karaoke business like chairs and tables. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her video karaoke business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children and all of them are at school.  She is looking after her father who is elderly and not working. She sells  second-hand clothes in  Bwaise  market. She has been in this business for four years. She sells these clothes to all categories of  people on a retail basis.  

Jane buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the leading markets in Uganda.  Her greatest challenge has been transportation. She works seven days a week. Besides this clothing business, she also  sells charcoal to get additional income. Jane is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and getting enough profits so that she can own a plot of land. 

Jane joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. She resides in and rents  a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Victoriano Percider

texts.es:
Victoriano de 41 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), el tiene cuatro hijos y trabaja vendiendo helados, bolos (refresco congelados en fundas). 

El y su esposa se levantan muy en la mañana para hacer los bolos y los helados, en la mañana y tarde sale a vender los bolos y helados y en las noches para tener mas dinero trabaja en el mercado de “Montebello” de Paraíso.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas para vender en su casa y tener mas dinero. En el futuro quiere independizarse totalmente para pasar mas tiempo con su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 41 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil - an area now on the outskirts of the city, whose natural ecology is fast disappearing. He has 4 children and works selling ice-creams and "bolos" (frozen soft drinks, a bit like popsicles). He and his wife get up early in the morning to make the ice-creams and bolos, and Victoriano goes out in the morning and afternoon to sell them. In the evenings he makes extra money working in the Montebello market in Paraíso. With the loan he wants to buy fruit, to sell from home to make more money. In future he would like to work totally for himself so that he can spend more time with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en: Uyanga B. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house. Her husband transports loads throughout the town. Her two daughters attend a district middle school and her 2-year-old son stays at home. During the day, Uyanga operates a clothing trading business at Narantuul, the biggest and most crowded market in Ulaanbaatar city. Uyanga has been operating her business since 2001, and has steadily expanded her business and gained much experience in previous years. Her working capital has now reached to 5,000,000 MNT and the daily earning is from 50,000 to 60,000 MNT. Uyanga is a very hardworking person and her business is very important for her family. She says, “I would like to expand my business and own a shop in the future”. She is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Kossiwa Nicole

texts.fr: A. est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commere de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis Huit ans déjà. elle a déjà sollicité et obtenu de WAGES du crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite ce troisième pour s'approvisionner et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, avec ce crédit elle pourra acheter 3 pièce de GTP, 6 pièces de WAX,  3 pièces de tissus à dentelle et divers.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is married and the mother of two children. To generate income, she buys and sells "pagnes" (printed fabric), an activity she has been involved in for eight years already. She has previously asked for and been granted loans from WAGES which she has fully repaid. She is requesting a third to obtain supplies and better meet the needs of her customers. With this loan she will be able to buy 3 bolts of GTP pagne, 6 bolts of Wax pagne, 3 pieces of lace fabric, and more.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy printed fabric

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia D. 47 años, es una madre D. familia muy jovial y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su hijo que es universitario. Es profesora desD. hace 19 años, en un colegio particular cerca D. su localidad, pero con el fin D. tener más ingresos elabora trabajos didácticos ofreciendo algunos D. sus alumnos, siendo el costo retribuido en partes. Es así que se inicia en estos trabajos pedagógicos, en vista que sus alumnos requerían y compraban D. las librerías a costos mucho más elevados, desD. entonces le va muy bien, por lo se siente muy feliz. Además cuenta con el apoyo D. la directora del colegio y con las ganancias pueD. ayudar a cubrir la educación superior D. su hijo. Para el futuro piensa  diversificar y ampliar la distribución D. sus  trabajos didácticos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, asimismo esta muy agradecida con las integrantes, por la invitación e integración a este grupo. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cartulinas plastificadas, temperas, pegamentos, corrospum, así como también plumones D. diversos colores, para terminar los acabados D. sus materiales didácticos.
texts.en:
Siliva is 47 years old and a jovial hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her son who is attending university. Silvia has been a teacher for 19 years and works at a private school near her home. In order to earn extra income, she prepares educational materials and offers them to some of her students who pay for the cost in installments. She started creating these educational materials because her students had a need for them and were paying much higher prices at the bookstores. Since then, she has done very well and feels very happy. Silvia also has the support of her school principal and the income helps cover her son’s higher education. In the future, she wants to diversify and expand the distribution of her educational materials.

This is her first loan with MFP. Silvia promises to complete her loan payments promptly. She is grateful to the other members of her Communal Bank for inviting her to join the group. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy laminated poster boards, paints, adhesives, “corrospum” (a type of plastic used for crafts), and markers of different colors so that she can compete the finishing touches on her educational materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making educational materials

loans.name: Víctor Leonel

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Leonel B. M.   él  es Trabajadora activo  de la Empresa servicios Múltiples desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad, tiene  treinta años de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Leonel B. M. is an active employee of "Empresa Servicios Múltiples" where he works as a security guard. He has worked for this business for thirty years, since he was school-age. He has had two loans with "CEPRODEL" and he has taken out these loans to buy construction matrials to improve his home. They have helped him a great deal because he has been able to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials: quarry stones, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Teu

texts.en:
Teu T. is 49 and married with 7 children. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Teu has 3 years of experience in this business. Teu needs a loan of 2500 talas to purchase weed-killer such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Teu joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Teu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killer such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Zaida Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Zaida E. tiene un taller de zapatería en donde su especialidad es la bota militar y vaqueras, en esta rama ya tiene 33 años de experiencia, este taller lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, al mismo tiempo la señora para tener un poco más de ingreso logro entrar a trabajar como maestra en un colegio que se llama Mundo Infantil en donde le dan clases a niños, ella visita a CEPRODEL con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración del calzado como cuero, suela y plantina y poder estar estable con su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Zaida E. owns a shoemaking shop and she is specialized in military and cowboy boots. She has been engaging in this activity for 33 years, and the workshop is located in her house. At the same time, and to earn some more money, she succeeded in being employed as teacher in a school called Mundo Infantil (Children’s World), where she teaches small children. She has asked CEPRODEL for a loan that she will use to buy core materials she needs to make shoes such as leather, soles and insoles, in order to live a stable life with her family.

loans.use: To buy leather, soles and insoles.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen T., age 36, lives in the area of Phnom Penh, where there are many Muslims. Pen T. doesn’t have a life partner because she and her husband divorced a few years ago. She has two children; both of them are single. One of her daughter is on the staff of KFC Company.  To make a living, Pen T. currently sells rice in front of her home and earns an average of US$ 7 each day. She will be using her loan form Kiva to expand her working capital and support her business growth.

loans.use: To expand capital to support her business growth

loans.name: Angel Alberto

texts.es: ANGEL ALBERTO G. M.,Trabaja Como Carpintero en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.es padre de familia de dos niños y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion ya que piensa mejorar su casa de habitación reforzar y repellar  paredes de casa y resolver algunos problemas familiares.
texts.en:
Angel Alberto G. M. works as a carpenter at the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua, in Spanish). He has two school-aged children.

The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials because he plans to make improvements to his house, reinforcing and plastering walls of the house, and to solve some family problems.

loans.use: To remodel his house, reinforcing and plastering walls, and to cover some family expenses.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two children. She is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk. Valentina sells sportswear and footwear at two different locations: she owns an outlet in a local mall called ‘Bashny’ (‘Towers’) and a vending kiosk at the central city market. She has been in the market for about 10 years. Presently, Valentina has 65,000 UAH in turnover capital.  

Valentina is requesting a 10,000 UAH loan to reconstruct her vending facility at the local marketplace and increase assorted merchandise. Valentina usually purchases additional merchandise from wholesalers at affordable prices and then resells it at a higher price. She is hoping to have increased sales this holiday season and thus generate extra income for her family of four.

loans.use: To reconstruct her vending facility and increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 37 years old. He is married and the father of three children between the ages 5 and 11. He is a carpenter. He makes and repairs home and office furniture (e.g., tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc.).  His business is open from 8a.m until 6p.m and he has 13 years experience working in this business.  Vianney currently employs six people. 

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to add to his stock of wood. He says that once he gets this loan he will make a profit and pay the school fees of his children and improve the welfare of his family. He is seen by the community as a hard-working and trustworthy man.

loans.use: To increase his stock of wood

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 25 years old and married. She operates a retail shop so as to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She also does farming for extra income.  

She has managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya. Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesale one in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and crates of soda.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and crates of soda

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Don Lorenzo, es un señor de 52 años, dedicado a la agricultura, vive con su madre y una hermana, él es soltero y no tiene hijos, el tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, de esta actividad ha logrado mantener a su familia con la ayuda de sus sobrinos, no tiene horario de trabajo.
Él está iniciando el proceso de una nueva siembra de maíz para realizarla solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, con estos materiales podrá desarrollar el proceso de siembra de una forma ordenada y correcta para obtener una cosecha sana y abundante.
Su principal objetivo es realizar la siembra y obtener una buena producción, comercializar el producto y pagar este préstamo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 52 years old.  He works as a farmer and lives with his mother and sister.  He is single and doesn't have any children.

Lorenzo has been farming for 30 years.  Through this business, he has managed to support his family with the help of his nephews.  He does not work regular hours.
